specification: Person is born in Afghanistan to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to two citizens. Or person is born abroad to a citizen and a non-citizen, and (1) one of the parents permanently resides in Afghanistan, or (2) the parents live outside Afghanistan and they select Afghan citizenship for the child by mutual consent.
Person is found in Afghanistan and documents prove that the child cannot acquire the parents' citizenship.

Person is born in Afghanistan to foreign parents and intends to permanently live in Afghanistan after reaching the age of 18 years, unless citizenship of another country is acquired within 6 months after reaching the age of 18. Does not apply if parents are diplomats or work for an international organisation.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in Afghanistan for 5 years. Other conditions: no crime committed during his/her stay in Afghanistan.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Afghanistan for 5 years.
No crime committed during his/her stay in Afghanistan.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and the marriage was concluded in accordance with Islamic Sharia law.
category: Group restriction: only if spouse of a citizen is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is the minor child of parents who are acquiring citizenship, or one parent is acquiring citizenship and the child lives with him/her. Children who have reached the age of 18 years and live abroad can 'request' citizenship if both parents are acquiring citizenship.; Person is the minor child of a foreign widow(er), is living with that parent, and the parent is marrying a citizen and acquiring citizenship.; Person is the minor child of a foreign separated parent, is living with that parent in Afghanistan, and the parent is marrying a citizen and acquiring citizenship. If the child and parent do not reside in Afghanistan, the other separated parent must consent to the child acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen and his/her request for reacquisition is approved by the Council of Ministers and signed by the president.
Person does not have citizenship of any country. Other conditions: see A06.; Person does not have citizenship of any country and marries a citizen.
Person is born in Angola to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Angolan territory as a newborn child.
Person is born in territory and does not possess any other citizenship, or person is born in territory of parents who are stateless or of unknown citizenship.

Person has been resident in Angola for 10 years. Other conditions: able to govern him/herself and secure subsistence (evidenced by regular tax payment in previous 3 years), sufficient knowledge of Portuguese as proved in an exam, effective link to national community proved by exam, adequate knowledge of rights and duties under the constitution, not convicted of crime punishable by more than 3 years in prison.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Angola for 10 years.
Person has sufficient knowledge of Portuguese as proved in an exam.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person has effective link to national community proved by exam, adequate knowledge of rights and duties under the constitution.
Person is not convicted of crime punishable by more than 3 years in prison.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is able to govern him/herself and secure subsistence (evidenced by regular tax payment in previous 3 years).
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse or legally recognised partner of a citizen for 5 years, with common household. Other conditions: required to be adult, show integration in Angolan society, and no conviction of crime.
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen. Other conditions: if person is over 14, s/he must demonstrate willingness to become a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is without legal capacity and either parent acquires citizenship. Person has to submit a separate request and provide proof that one of the parents has acquired Angolan citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who renounced citizenship or who lost it because s/he worked for a foreign state.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered services to the country or has exceptional professional, scientific or artistic qualifications. Other conditions: National Assembly grants after debate on request of at least 15 deputies.; Person has rendered relevant services to the state. Other conditions: president grants on basis conditions provided under mode A06, except that residence period, financial requirements, and knowledge of Portuguese may be waived.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Albania to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born to parents of another country who are lawful residents in Albania and both parents give their consent to acquisition of citizenship.
Person is found in Albania of unknown parentage and would otherwise be stateless.

Person has been lawfully resident in Albania for at least 5 continuous years. Other conditions: dwelling and sufficient income, no sentence in any country for a criminal offence that carries a prison sentence of at least 3 years (exemption only if the sentence was given for political motives), elementary knowledge of the Albanian language, no danger to security and defence of Albania.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident in Albania for at least 5 continuous years.
Person has elementary knowledge of the Albanian language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person is not a danger to security and defence of Albania, no sentence in any country for a criminal offence that carries a prison sentence of at least 3 years (exemption only if the sentence was given for political motives).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person has dwelling and sufficient income.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been married to an Albanian citizen for at least 3 years and has lawfully and continuously resided in Albania for 1 year.
Person is a minor and is adopted by two citizens, or by one citizen and both parents reside in Albania at the time of adoption, or is stateless or becomes stateless as a result of the adoption.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a direct descendant up to the 2nd generation and has been resident in Albania for at least 3 continuous years. Other conditions: see A06
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor who lives with his/her parents, and both parents are acquiring citizenship by naturalisation and request that the child be included (child must consent if between the age of 14-18). If only one parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation, the minor acquires citizenship if so requested by both parents, or by one of the parents if the other parent is stateless, and the child is resident in Albania.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
Person is born to a parent of Albanian origin, regardless of the place of birth. Excludes people of Albanian origin who are citizens of Kosovo.; 

Person is of Albanian origin and 1) is a citizen (or documented resident) of an EU member state, the United States of America or another state the citizens of which are not required to hold a visa to travel in the states belonging to the Schengen Area. OR 2) possesses another citizenship or is stateless and one parent is an Albanian citizen. OR 3) person possesses another citizenship or is stateless and was born in Albania. Or person's ancestors were in possession of citizenship and are no longer alive at the time of request, provided that the person can prove direct descent (up to the 3rd generation) from such a citizen ancestor. Excludes people of Albanian origin who are citizens of Kosovo
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor or adult and has been resident in Albania for 5 continuous years. Other conditions: no danger to security and defence of Albania.

Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in special (scientific, economic, cultural or national) interest of Albania. Other conditions: no danger to security and defence of Albania.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in special economic interest of Albania. Other conditions: no danger to security and defence of Albania.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person is born in the UAE to a male citizen, or to a female citizen and the father is unknown or stateless;
Person is born to a female citizen who is married to a foreign citizen. Citizenship can be acquired six years after the date of birth, and only if the mother had citizenship during the period from the date of birth until the date of submission of the request.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification:
Person is born in the UAE to a male citizen, or to a female citizen and the father is unknown or stateless;
Person is born to a female citizen who is married to a foreign citizen. Citizenship can be acquired six years after the date of birth, and only if the mother had citizenship during the period from the date of birth until the date of submission of the request.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born in the UAE to unknown parents.

Person has been resident in the UAE for at least 30 years. Other conditions: renunciation of original citizenship, lawful and continuous residence in UAE, proficient in Arabic, legitimate means of income, educational qualification, good character, not convicted for crimes of dishonour (unless person has been rehabilitated), obtained security approval, sworn an oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the UAE for at least 30 years (lawful and continuous residence in UAE).
category: More than 10 years of residence required
Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must have sworn an oath of allegiance.
Person must have good character, not convicted for crimes of dishonour (unless person has been rehabilitated), obtained security approval.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Legitimate means of income, educational qualification required.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen and the couple have been married for at least 10 years (reduced to 7 years if couple has children). Other conditions: see A06 (exemption may be granted from educational qualification requirement).
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is the wife of someone who is acquiring citizenship and provided she renounces her original citizenship.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)
Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person had obtained a foreign citizenship and has meanwhile renounced that citizenship. A minor who lost citizenship may regain it after reaching the age of majority.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is an Arab of Omani, Qatari or Bahraini origin and s/he has been resident in the UAE legally and continuously for more than 3 years immediately preceding his/her application for citizenship. Other conditions: legal means of living, good conduct, and not been convicted for a crime that impugns integrity.
Person has special skills. No residence requirement. Other requirements: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article:
ARG 1(2), 5, Decree 3213/84 (2);

Law 16.569 as modified by Law 25.327
specification:
Person is born abroad to a citizen who was born in Argentina.;

Person is born abroad to a citizen who was exiled from Argentina. Option right can be exercised after arrival in the country.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Argentina. Unless parents are foreign diplomats.

Person has been resident in Argentina for a continuous period of at least 2 years preceding his/her request in accordance with the regulatory framework on immigration and expresses his or her will to acquire citizenship before a federal district judge. Other conditions: honest source of income or occupation, no convictions for a crime committed in Argentina or abroad that carries a prison sentence of 3 years or more (unless the sentence has been served and the application for naturalisation is submitted 5 years after serving the sentence, or when amnesty has been granted), no criminal proceedings initiatives against the person in Argentina or abroad, and oath of loyalty. Judge may deny naturalisation if the applicant publicly advocates the overthrow of the democratic system, the use of violence, or denies the value of the human rights system. Political, ideological, trade union-related, religious or racial considerations can have no effect on the acquisition of citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Argentina for a continuous period of at least 2 years preceding his/her request in accordance with the regulatory framework on immigration.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: No convictions for a crime committed in Argentina or abroad that carries a prison sentence of 3 years or more (unless the sentence has been served and the application for naturalisation is submitted 5 years after serving the sentence, or when amnesty has been granted), no criminal proceedings initiatives against the person in Argentina or abroad. Judge may deny naturalisation if the applicant publicly advocates the overthrow of the democratic system, the use of violence, or denies the value of the human rights system.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Honest source of income or occupation.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement). (Note: Provision used to discriminate between men and women. After the ratification by Argentina of the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women on 15 July 1985 and the adoption of the 1994 Argentinean Constitution which includes this convention in Art. 75 (22), this discrimination ceased to exist and the provision applies to both men and women.)

Person is the child of a father who acquired citizenship by naturalisation. Other conditions: the person was a minor at the time of the parent's naturalisation, was born abroad and he/she enrols in the National Guard under the age-conditions prescribed by the pertinent law.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the child of a father who acquired citizenship of another country by naturalisation. Other conditions: he or she enrols in the National Guard under the time-conditions prescribed by pertinent law.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person lost citizenship due to de facto laws 21.795 and 21.610 (i.e. enacted by the dictatorship). Re-acquisition is automatic unless the person manifests the contrary via judicial process.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification:
Person is an entrepreneur or builder in the field of railway construction, part of an established colony and own real estate in the country, populates an Argentinean national territory, or is a teacher in any field of education or industry. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).;
Person has established a new industry or introduced a useful invention. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has honourably fulfiled, in Argentina or abroad, a function in the service of Argentina, or has militarily defended the country. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person is born to parents who are both citizens or to a parent who is a citizen and the other parent is unknown or stateless. If one parent is a citizen and the other parent is a foreigner, the child acquires citizenship based on a written consent. In the absence of written consent, the child acquires citizenship if s/he is otherwise stateless, or both parents reside permanently in Armenia.

Person is born to parents who are both citizens or to a parent who is a citizen and the other parent is unknown or stateless. If one parent is a citizen and the other parent is a foreigner, the child acquires citizenship based on a written consent. In the absence of written consent, the child acquires citizenship if she or he is otherwise stateless, or both parents reside permanently in Armenia.
Person is a child is found in Armenia of unknown parentage. This can be changed in case of discovery of at least one of the parents or a trustee.
Person is born in Armenia to stateless parents or parents whose nationality is unknown or parents who cannot transfer their citizenship to their child.

Person has been lawfully resident in Armenia for 3 years. Other conditions: proficiency in the Armenian language, familiarity with the Constitution of the Republic of Armenia, his/her activities do not violate state and social security, public order, protection of the public health and traditions or rights, freedoms, dignity and good reputation of others, and oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident in Armenia for 3 years.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Proficiency in the Armenian language required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Familiarity with the Constitution of the Republic of Armenia required.
Person's activities may not violate state and social security, public order, protection of the public health and traditions or rights, freedoms, dignity and good reputation of others.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is married to a citizen for at least two years and has resided in Armenia for at least 365 days or has a child with his/her Armenian spouse. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement and language proficiency).
Peron has a father and/or mother who is/are citizens. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement and language proficiency).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a child both whose adoptive parents are citizens. If one parent is a foreigner, the child acquires citizenship if a) both parents give their consent, or b) the child resides in the country, or c) the child would otherwise be stateless.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person has a child who is a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement and language proficiency).
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is the child of a parent(s) who held citizenship of the country in the past or the person was born on the territory of the country and applies for citizenship of Armenia within 3 years of reaching the age of 18 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is under 18 years old and both parents are acquiring citizenship of the country. If one parent is a foreigner or stateless person the consent of both parents is required, unless the child resides in the country and the parent who is a citizen gives his/her consent. If child is 14-18 years old, the child's consent is required.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is (1) a citizen of the former Armenian SSR permanently residing on the territory of the Republic of Armenia, who until the enactment of the Constitution has not acquired citizenship of  another State or has rejected that citizenship within 1 year from the day of the enactment of the Armenian Citizenship Law. Or person is (2) a former citizen of the Armenian SSR, who lives outside the Republic of Armenia and has not acquired another citizenship. Or person has (3) lost citizenship of Armenia unless s/he was deprived of it. Or (4) person renounced citizenship after 1995 (exemption from residence and language requirements).  Or (5) person has renounced Armenian citizenship in order to acquire another citizenship, but has not received citizenship of another country.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a stateless person or former citizen of another USSR republic, is not a foreign citizen, permanently residing in Armenia and applied for citizenship before 31 December 2019.

Person is Armenian by origin and has resided in Armenia. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).; Person has ancestors who were Armenian by ethnic origin.;Person is an ethnic Armenian child who takes up permanent residence in Armenia.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has applied for citizenship in a manner prescribed by law and received a document confirming that he/she is a citizen. Recognition of citizen is retroactive until the date on which the Citizenship Act of 1995 came into force.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement and language requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has provided exceptional services to the country. No other conditions.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen who was born in Antigua and Barbuda, or to a citizen who is in the service of the government, or to a deceased parent who held Antigua and Barbuda citizenship.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Antigua and Barbuda unless the child is born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.
Person is a newborn infant found in Antigua and Barbuda of unknown parentage.

Person is a minor or adult who was born in Antigua and Barbuda and has always been stateless. Registration can be denied in the interests of defense or public order, if the person is sentenced to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good character, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means to support him/herself.

Father acknowledges, and can show he is the parent of, the child or a Court has judged him to be the father. Also, alleged father has signed, and had notarised, an instrument recognizing paternity, which has been deposited with the Registry.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has been resident in Antigua and Barbuda for 12 months immediately prior to the application (exemption for British protected persons), as well as during 5 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, intent to reside in Antigua and Barbuda, and oath of allegiance. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements. Minister may refuse to grant citizenship in interest of public safety, morality, order and defence.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Antigua and Barbuda for 12 months immediately prior to the application (exemption for British protected persons), as well as during 5 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Person must have intent to reside in Antigua and Barbuda. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
Person must take an oath of allegiance.
Person must be of good character. Minister may refuse to grant citizenship in interest of public safety, morality, order and defence. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen, with common household, for 3 years. If spouse died during that period and would have become an Antigua and Barbuda citizen, widow can apply for citizenship. Other conditions: oath of loyalty.
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen or, in case of joint adoption, by a male citizen. Other conditions: oath of loyalty.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Parent or grandparent of the citizenship by investment applicant. Other conditions: must be over 65 years old, living with the applicant and fully dependent on the applicant.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to relatives in ascending and descending line)

specification: Person is born abroad and parent was or would have been a citizen ex Const 112 but for his/her death.;Spouse of deceased citizen must have been married to the latter for at least 3 years.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Spouse must have been married for at least 3 years to person who becomes a citizen (or who would have but for death become a citizen) and must have been residing with person who becomes a citizen.

Child must be under age 18. If child is adopted or the stepchild of citizen parent, the child must have been 'recognised by law'.; Citizenship By Investment Programme: Child of the main applicant or his or her spouse who is less than 18 years of age, or 18-26 years of age and who is in full time attendance at a recognised institution of higher education and fully supported by the main applicant, or at least 18 years of age and physically or mentally challenged and who is living with and fully supported by the main applicant
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who had to renounce citizenship in order to acquire or retain citizenship of another country. Other conditions: oath of loyalty.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen of full capacity and has been ordinarily resident in Antigua and Barbuda, or has been in the service of the government, or has had partly such residence and partly such service for at least 5 out of 7 years immediately prior to the application. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements. Registration can be denied in the interests of defense or public order, or if the person is sentenced to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good character, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means to support him/herself.

article: Investment Act 5(1-2), Schedule of Fees (Regulations 4(3) and 5(2))
specification: Person is at least 18 years old and whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the special economic interest of Antigua and Barbuda. Other conditions: oath of loyalty, provision of police and medical certificates, payment of fee.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is from a First Schedule country, of full mind and capacity, and has been in Government service, or partly in Government service while ordinarily resident in Antigua and Barbuda. Grounds for refusal include interests of defence, public safety, morality and order, as well as conviction for a criminal offence, being of poor character, engaging in activities prejudicial to Antigua and Barbuda and likelihood of becoming a public charge.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person is born in Australia to a citizen or permanent resident (with exceptions for birth to an enemy alien in occupied territory).

Person is born abroad to a citizen. Only requirement for applying to become a citizen is that a responsible parent be a citizen at time of birth and that, if aged over 18, the person is of good character. If the parent was a citizen by descent or by overseas adoption by a citizen then, unless the person was never a citizen of another country, the parent must have spent a total of 2 years in Australia at any time before application for citizenship.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Australia to parent with permanent residence status.
Person is found in Australia as a child whose parents are unknown.
Person has never been the national or citizen of any other country, and is 'not entitled to acquire' the nationality or citizenship of a foreign country.
Person must be 'ordinarily resident' (as defined in AUS 3.) in Australia throughout the period of 10 years from birth.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person must have been lawfully resident in Australia for 4 years immediately prior to making the application and holding permanent resident status for the last 12 months of that period. Other conditions: sit a citizenship test (English language skills and knowledge about Australia and Australian citizenship), Minister must be satisfied that the person is likely to reside, or to continue to reside, in Australia or to maintain a close and continuing association with Australia, and person is of good character at the time of the Minister's decision.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person must have been lawfully resident in Australia for 4 years immediately prior to making the application and holding permanent resident status for the last 12 months of that period. Minister must be satisfied that the person is likely to reside, or to continue to reside, in Australia or to maintain a close and continuing association with Australia.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Person is required to sit a citizenship test (English language skills and knowledge about Australia and Australian citizenship).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person is required to sit a citizenship test (English language skills and knowledge about Australia and Australian citizenship).
Person must be of good character at the time of the Minister's decision.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: n.a. Note: No direct basis for acquisition. Person who is the spouse of a citizen has to apply in his/her own right under mode A06. However, under AUS 22(9), where a person is the spouse, de facto partner or surviving spouse of a citizen at the time of making his/her application, the Minister may treat a period in which the person was not present in Australia but was spouse/de facto partner, and was a permanent resident of Australia, and had a close and continuing connection with Australia, as a period in which the person was present in Australia for the purposes of satisfying the general residency requirement.

Person is adopted under a law in force in a State or Territory of Australia by a citizen present in Australia as a permanent resident at that time.; Person is adopted in accordance with the Hague Convention on Intercountry Adoption or a bilateral agreement by a citizen present in Australia for a total period of at least 2 years at any time before the person made the application.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is born outside of Australia and is the child of a former Australian citizen who lost his/her citizenship under pre-2002 provisions which provided for loss of citizenship on acquisition of another citizenship.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the child of a deceased citizen who died before the birth.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is eligible to become a citizen again if s/he ceased to be a citizen through renunciation in order to acquire or retain the citizenship of a foreign country or to avoid suffering significant hardship or detriment. Resumption provisions also apply to a child who lost his or her own citizenship as a result of his or her parent(s) ceasing to be citizens for the above reasons.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person satisfies the Minister that she or he was born in Papua before 16 September 1975 to a citizen born in Australia (as that term is understood at the time of the application) and is of good character.

Person is employed by the Commonwealth government in a position that requires a security clearance as high or higher than the nominated level, or participates in an Australian team in certain competitions, or is engaged in 'particular kinds of work requiring regular travel outside Australia'. Other conditions: see A06 (but at variance with the standard naturalisation requirements, provision is made for 'special' i.e. less onerous, residence requirements for those seeking to engage in an activity of benefit to Australia, where the person needs to be an Australian citizen to engage in that activity and there is insufficient time for that person to comply with the general residence requirements).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has performed a 'relevant defence service'. Other conditions: see A06 (except that provision is made for 'special' i.e. less onerous, residence requirements).
Person is born in Austria to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Austria of unknown parentage and is younger than 6 months.

Person was born in Austria, has been stateless since birth and resident in Austria for at least 10 years, 5 years of them uninterrupted and immediately before the application. Application for citizenship at the age of 18 or 19. Other condition: not convicted for certain crimes.

Person was born out of wedlock to a foreign national mother and Austrian father recognises the child within 8 weeks after the birth.;Person is an unmarried minor born out of wedlock obtains Austrian nationality when she or he has not become Austrian national by birth, her/his father is an Austrian national and the parents get married.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is born in Austria and has been resident there for 6 years immediately before the application. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in Austria for 10 years, of which 5 years with a permanent resident permit immediately before the application (can be reduced to six years if person has proof of sustainable personal integration). Other conditions: no criminal convictions, the granting of citizenship must not have an adverse impact on the international relations of the Republic of Austria and the person must have an <d4>affirmative attitude towards the Republic of Austria<d5>, and he or she must not represent a danger to public law, order and security including any other public interest that is covered by Art. 8(2) ECHR, secure income, renunciation or automatic loss of previous citizenship(s) (unless legally impossible or unreasonable due to high fees), proficiency in German (B1 CEFR, certification), knowledge of Austrian democratic order and history and of the federal province responsible for the administration of naturalisation (naturalisation test). Person is entitled to naturalisation if he/she has proof of sustainable personal integration as mentioned above.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Austria for 10 years, of which 5 years with a permanent resident permit immediately before the application. Residence requirement can be reduced to six years if person has proof of sustainable personal integration.
Person has renounced or automatically lost previous citizenship(s) (unless legally impossible or unreasonable due to high fees).
Person is proficient in German (B1 CEFR, certification).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person has knowledge of Austrian democratic order and history and of the federal province responsible for the administration of naturalisation (naturalisation test).

Person has no criminal convictions, the granting of citizenship must not have an adverse impact on the international relations of the Republic of Austria and the person must have an <d4>affirmative attitude towards the Republic of Austria<d5>, and he or she must not represent a danger to public law, order and security including any other public interest that is covered by Art. 8(2) ECHR.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for 5 years, with common household, and has been resident in Austria for 6 years, with a permanent residence permit at the time of the application. No residence requirement if the person left Austria with his/her spouse before May 9, 1945. Other conditions: see mode A06.

Person younger than 14 years obtains Austrian nationality when adopted by an Austrian national. Conditions: The person must live in Austria or the adopting Austrian must live outside Austria for at least 12 months. The granting of citizenship must not have an adverse impact on the international relations of the Republic of Austria and the person must have an <d4>affirmative attitude towards the Republic of Austria<d5>, and he or she must not represent a danger to public law, order and security including any other public interest that is covered by Art. 8(2) ECHR.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the child of a deceased citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person has been the spouse for 5 years, with common household, of a person who acquires citizenship. Person has been resident in Austria for 6 years, with a permanent residence permit at the time of the application. No previous withdrawal of Austrian citizenship based on employment in non-military public service of another country. If the spouse has acquired Austrian citizenship based on special achievements: no residence requirement, required duration of marriage or renunciation requirement. Other conditions: see mode A06.

Person is an unmarried minor (or handicapped adult in need of care), has not lost citizenship by withdrawal due to employment in military service or non-military public service of another country, and father or mother is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation (or is already a citizen).  Person must have a permanent residence permit at the time of the application. If mother or father has acquired Austrian citizenship based on special achievements: no residence requirement or renunciation requirement. Other conditions: see mode A06. Also children of this unmarried minor acquire Austrian citizenship under the condition of the renunciation of former citizenships.;
Unmarried person whose parents acquire citizenship by legitimation (see mode A04)
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor
Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen of the European Economic Area and has been resident in Austria for 6 years immediately before the application. Other conditions: see mode A06.

Person acquires Austrian citizenship if he/she has been mistakenly treated as Austrian citizen by public authorities for a period of fifteen years or having served in the armed forces/alternative civil service. Application must be made within six months after the discovery of the erroneous treatment. Other conditions: no criminal convictions (but less stricter conditions than A06), the granting of citizenship must not have an adverse impact on the international relations of the Republic of Austria and the person must have an <d4>affirmative attitude towards the Republic of Austria<d5>, and he or she must not represent a danger to public law, order and security including any other public interest that is covered by Art. 8(2) ECHR. renunciation of other citizenship is not required.;
Person had mistakenly been treated as Austrian by descent because a determination of paternity and it has subsequently been shown that none of the reasons for ius sanguinis apply. Retroactive acquisition of Austrian citizenship from the date of birth or legitimation (no further conditions).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been resident in Austria for 15 years, can prove effective personal and professional integration, and has not previously lost citizenship due to withdrawal or renunciation. No proof of integration is required if the person has been resident in Austria for 30 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee and has been resident in Austria for 10 years immediately before the application. Renunciation of former citizenships not required. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person born abroad, mother or father are according to the law of that country (but not according to Austrian law) Austrian citizens and the person would be stateless
category: Additional restrictions apply (eg citizenship status of parent)

specification:
Person has been resident in Austria for 6 years and acquisition of citizenship due to past and expected future special achievements in science, economics, arts or sports is in the interest of Austria. Other conditions: see mode A06.;
Person with past and expected future  special achievements in the special interest of Austria (constitutional provision). No residence or secure income requirement, no German knowledge, no naturalisation test and no renunciation of previous citizenships. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been resident in Austria for 6 years and acquisition of citizenship due to past and expected future special achievements in economics is in the interest of the country. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Azerbaijan to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is a child living in Azerbaijan and of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Azerbaijan to parents who are both stateless.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has had 5 years of permanent and uninterrupted residence. Other conditions: knowledge of language (certificate), legal source of income, commitment to abide by the Constitution. Application is rejected if the person calls for forcible change of the state structure set by the Constitution of the Azerbaijan Republic, for disturbing its territorial integrity, performs activities that cause damage to state security, public order, the health and morality of the population, propagandises racial, religious and national hatred, or has relations with terrorist activities.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has had 5 years of permanent and uninterrupted residence.

category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Commitment to abide by the Constitution.

Application is rejected if the person calls for forcible change of the state structure set by the Constitution of the Azerbaijan Republic, for disturbing its territorial integrity, performs activities that cause damage to state security, public order, the health and morality of the population, propagandises racial, religious and national hatred, or has relations with terrorist activities.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is adopted by parents who are both citizens. If only one parent is a citizen, the child will acquire citizenship by consent of the adopters. Child's consent is required if s/he is between 14 and 18 years old.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a child under 14 years old and both parents (or his/her one known parent) are acquiring citizenship. If one parent is acquiring citizenship and the other parent is a foreigner, the child acquires citizenship upon the request of the parent acquiring citizenship, provided that the other parent consents. If one parent is acquiring citizenship and the other parent is a stateless person, the child acquires citizenship, provided that s/he lives in the country. If one parent is acquiring citizenship and the other parent is a stateless person, a child who does not live in the country acquires citizenship upon the request of the parent acquiring citizenship, provided that the other parent consents.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person has previously been a citizen of the Azerbaijan Republic, or his/her citizenship has been terminated. No conditions, but application will be rejected for the reasons listed under mode A06.
Person is a refugee who was settled in the territory of the Azerbaijan Republic from 1 Jan 1988 until 1 Jan 1992.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is stateless. Other conditions: see A06.

Person has high achievements in the sphere of science, technics, culture or sport, or the person represents a special interest for the country. No conditions, but application can be rejected for the reasons listed under mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has rendered great service to the country. No conditions, but application can be rejected for the reasons listed under mode A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person is the child of a citizen (constitution), or person is born in wedlock to a father who is a citizen, or is recognised by voluntary or court-ordered legitimation as the child of a Burundian father, or paternal descent is not established and the child is recognised voluntarily or by court order as the child of a Burundian mother, or the child is repudiated by the father and the mother is a citizen (law).

Constitution: person is the child of a citizen. Law: person is born in wedlock to a father who is a citizen, or is recognised by voluntary or court-ordered legitimation as the child of a Burundian father, or paternal descent is not established and the child is recognised voluntarily or by court order as the child of a Burundian mother, or the child is repudiated by the father and the mother is a citizen.
Person is born in Burundi of unknown parents, or found in Burundi as a child unless it is established that s/he was not born in Burundi.

Person is born out of wedlock and the subject of a voluntary or judicial recognition or a legitimisation, or paternal filiation is not established and person is the subject of voluntary or judicial recognition by the mother, or person is disowned by father and mother is a citizen.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has been resident at least 10 years. Other conditions: at least 21 years old (or if less, application submitted with that of a parent), good conduct, behaviour and customs, no convictions for crime or other offence, attachment to the Burundian nation and assimilation with Burundian citizens.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident at least 10 years.
Attachment to the Burundian nation and assimilation with Burundian citizens required.
Attachment to the Burundian nation and assimilation with Burundian citizens required.
Person is of good conduct, behaviour and customs, no convictions for crime or other offence.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is the wife of a Burundian citizen.; Person is the husband of a Burundian citizen and has been resident in Burundi for 5 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Minor child is the subject of full adoption by a citizen, provided that s/he resides in Burundi at the time of the adoption.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the child of a father who was a citizen on the date of death.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is the child aged under 21 years of a person who is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person was Burundian citizen from birth and lost it because s/he acquired another citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been resident 5 years and has rendered exceptional services to Burundi. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Belgium to a citizen.
Child is born to non-citizens who have lived in Belgium at least 10 years before the birth of the child and who have filed a citizenship claim for the child before the age of 12 years.
Person is born in Belgium to a person who was also born in Belgium and resided legally there at least five of the ten years preceding the person's birth.
Person is found in Belgium of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Belgium and is not entitled to citizenship of another country.
Person is a minor and descent from a citizen is established.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification:
Person is under the age of 12 and was born in Belgium to parents who have resided there for at least 10 years (declaration by parents).;
Person was born in Belgium and has resided there since birth (by person)
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in Belgium for at least 5 years. Other conditions: proficiency in language of the country (certification), no convictions for serious criminal offence, adequate social integration and work participation. Language proficiency and social integration or work participation is not required if person cannot work due to a handicap or invalidity or is retired. Or person has been resident in Belgium for at least 10 years and is proficient in language of the country (certification), not been convicted convictions for serious criminal offence, and adequate participation in local community.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Belgium for at least 5 years.
Person is proficient in language of the country (certification), unless person demonstrates that he/she cannot work due to a handicap or invalidity or is retired.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person has adequate social integration and work participation, unless person demonstrates that he/she cannot work due to a handicap or invalidity or is retired.
Person has been convicted for a serious criminal offence.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen. Other conditions: proficiency in language of the country (certification), no convictions for serious criminal offence, adequate social integration in local community, 5 years of residence in Belgium (three years of which in common household). Only applies to marriage, not to registered partnership.

Person is born in Belgium and adopted by a citizen, or person is born in another country and adopted by a citizen who (1) was born in Belgium or (2) applies for citizenship for the person within five years after the adoption or (3) the person holds no other citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the parent of a citizen. Other conditions: Belgian citizen must be a minor, proficiency in language of the country (certification), no convictions for serious criminal offence, adequate social integration in local community, 5 years of residence in Belgium.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is the child of a deceased citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship and has parental authority over the child, provided that the child resides in Belgium.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person has lost citizenship other than by withdrawal and has legally resided in Belgium for at least 12 months immediately preceding the declaration.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Persons has been resident in Belgium for at least 10 years. Other conditions: proficiency in language of the country (certification), no convictions for serious criminal offence, and adequate participation in local community.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised stateless person and has legally resided in Belgium for 2 years.
Persons legally resides in Belgium and has demonstrated exceptional achievements (scientific, sports, culture) that are in the special interest of the country. Other conditions: resident in Belgium.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Benin to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen (with right to repudiate before majority if father is foreign).
Person is born in Benin to a person who was also born in Benin (with right to repudiate before majority if the parent born in Benin was the mother).
Person is a newborn child found in Benin.
Person is born in Benin to parents who are unknown or stateless and the person would otherwise be stateless.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born in Benin and has been resident there since reaching the age of 16.; Person is born in Benin, has been resident for 5 years, and has not reached the age of majority. Government may oppose acquisition during 6 months before majority or within 6 months of declaration.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in Benin for 3 years. Other conditions: good conduct, never convicted with prison sentence of more than 1 year, good mental and physical health, assimilated to Beninois community, in particular by knowledge of a national language or the official language (French).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Benin for 3 years.
Assimilated to Beninois community, in particular by knowledge of a national language or the official language (French).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person must be assimilated to Beninois community.
Good conduct, never convicted with prison sentence of more than 1 year
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen, unless she declares before marriage that she declines citizenship. Government may oppose.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is minor child whose father acquired citizenship by naturalisation, or mother if father is unknown or deceased.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor adopted by a citizen.; Person is an adult adopted by a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the wife of a person who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who has not been deprived of citizenship, expelled or sentenced to house arrest.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is presumed to be born in Benin to a father born there and the person has 'apparent status' (possession d'<8e>tat) as a citizen.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has rendered important services or his/her naturalisation is in the interests of Benin. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Burkina Faso to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Burkina Faso to a person who was also born there.
Person is born in Burkina Faso of unknown parents. Newborn child found in Burkina Faso is presumed born in the country.
Person is born in Burkina Faso and cannot claim any other citizenship.
Person is born in Burkina Faso of foreign parents and has been habitually resident there at time of majority for at least 5 years.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been habitually and legally resident in Burkina Faso for 10 years. Other conditions: good character, sound mind, no criminal convictions for more than 1 year in prison.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually and legally resident in Burkina Faso for 10 years.
Person is of good character, no criminal convictions for more than 1 year in prison.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is married to a citizen, unless person declares s/he does not wish to acquire citizenship. Government may oppose within 1 year.
Person is minor child of a person who acquired citizenship (if person has not already acquired citizenship by collective effect under mode A14).
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is adopted by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is married to a person who is acquiring citizenship.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is the child of a person who is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is an industrialist or business person, who has important investments or who brings funds, according to the laws in force.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Bangladesh to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to a citizen other than by descent.; Person is born abroad to a citizen by descent (registration at a Bangladesh consulate required unless the citizen parent is in the service of Bangladesh at the time of the birth).

Person is born in Bangladesh. Unless born to a father who is a foreign diplomat and not a citizen of Bangladesh, or the father is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.  (Note: no practice is reported in this regard and Bangladesh does not apply the ius soli principle, but ius soli acquisition is arguably possible under BAN 4. In practice at least one of the parents must be a citizen.)
n.a. Note: In practice, a child found in Bangladesh whose parents are unknown is treated as a citizen.

Person has been resident in Bangladesh for 12 months immediately prior to the application, as well as during 4 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period, or the person has been ordinarily resident in Bangladesh for 5 years. Other conditions: good character, intent to reside in Bangladesh or to enter or continue in the service of Bangladesh, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. Further information may be required, such as person's income and its source, properties owned in Bangladesh, and particulars of the family members residing in Bangladesh.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Bangladesh for 12 months immediately prior to the application, as well as during 4 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period, or the person has been ordinarily resident in Bangladesh for 5 years. Intent to reside in Bangladesh or to enter or continue in the service of Bangladesh required.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person has been the wife of a Bangladeshi citizen and has been ordinarily resident in Bangladesh for 2 years. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship and domicile of other country, and evidence proving her husband's citizenship of Bangladesh as well as a marriage certificate. The Government may also require other information regarding, for example, income or knowledge of Bengali language.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is the wife of a deceased citizen (or of a person who would have been a citizen under BAN 3, 4 or 5). Citizenship can be acquired upon fulfilment of the other conditions listed under Mode A13.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person is the wife of someone who becomes a citizen, and makes a declaration expressing the wish to become a citizenship within 1 year after the husband took the oath of loyalty. Other conditions: oath of loyalty and possession of a certificate of domicile.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor residing in Bangladesh whose parent acquires citizenship through naturalisation, includes the child in his/her naturalisation certificate, and has parental authority over the child.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen. If person lost citizenship due to the non-renunciation of citizenship of another country or because s/he was deprived of citizenship, the person is not entitled to reacquisition but is dependent on the previous consent of the government.
The person is a citizen of any state of Europe or North America or of any other state which the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify in this behalf.
Person is born in Bulgaria to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Bulgaria of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Bulgaria and does not acquire citizenship of another country by descent.
Person is born to a citizen whose paternity has been established by a court ruling. A person who acquires citizenship on this ground is considered to be a birthright citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person is an adult who is born in Bulgaria and has had permanent residence there for 3 years if they have independent means, no convictions, know Bulgarian and renounce any other citizenship.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has had permanent residence in Bulgaria for at least 5 years prior to the application. Other conditions: no convictions of intentional crime and no pending criminal proceedings against the person, source of income and occupation sufficient for support, command of language of Bulgaria, and renunciation of another citizenship. Since 2013 renunciation not required for spouses of Bulgarians and for EEA nationals
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has had permanent residence in Bulgaria for at least 5 years prior to the application.
Person renounces other citizenship (renunciation not required for spouses of Bulgarians and for EEA nationals).
Person has command of language of Bulgaria.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: No convictions of intentional crime and no pending criminal proceedings against the person.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person has source of income and occupation sufficient for support.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for 3 years and has had permanent residence in Bulgaria for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
Person has been adopted by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the child of a deceased citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification:
Person is under the age of 14 and his/her parents are acquiring citizenship by naturalisation.;
Person is between the age of 14 and 18 and his/her parents are acquiring citizenship by naturalisation (declaration required).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who has had a permanent residence permit for at least 3 years preceding the application (this requirement is waived if the applicant was of Bulgarian descent). Other conditions: no convictions for an intentional crime in the country of residence or in Bulgaria, and does not pose a threat to the public order, public morals, public health or national security.
Person is of Bulgarian descent. Other conditions: no convictions for an intentional crime and no criminal proceeding initiatives against the person.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has a recognised refugee status with at least 3 years of residence prior to the application or person has humanitarian status with at least 5 years of residence prior to the application. No renunciation requirement. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has had at least 3 years of residence with a permanent residence permit prior to the application. No renunciation requirement. Other conditions: see A06.
Person has special achievements in the social and economic sphere, in science, technology, culture or sports. Exemption from A06 material conditions.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)
Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
4(a): Person is born in Bahrain to a male citizen. The father has to be Bahraini citizen at the time of the child's birth.
4(b): Person is born in Bahrain to a female citizen, providing that his father was either unknown or not legally to be related to his father. The mother has to be Bahraini citizen at the time of the child's birth.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification:
4(a): Person is born abroad to a male citizen, and the father or grandfather was born in Bahrain. The father has to be Bahraini citizen at the time of the child's birth.
4(b): Person is born in Bahrain to a female citizen, providing that his father was either unknown or not legally to be related to his father. The mother has to be Bahraini citizen at the time of the child's birth.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born in Bahrain to unknown parents. a foundling shall be deemed to have born in Bahrain, unless proved to be otherwise.
Person has been resident in Bahrain for at least 25 years or 15 years if the person is Arab. Other conditions: speak Arabic, have good character, and own real estate.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has resided in the country for 25 years.

category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Naturalisation is possible for female spouses of male nationals only.
category: Group restriction: only if spouse of a citizen is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is the minor child of a male citizen who has naturalised.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: A female spouse of a naturalised man may have facilitated naturalisation.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is the child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Child acquires citizenship at the same time as the parent.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
A Bahraini woman who lost her citizenship because she adopted the citizenship of her foreign husband, may reacquire her Bahraini citizenship if marriage ties are broken and she expresses her wish to acquire her original citizenship, and makes Bahrain her usual residence or if she returns to live in Bahrain.;
Citizenship may be restored to any person who has lost citizenship under the provisions of the Bahraini Citizenship Act by virtue of an order issued by the King, without prejudice to the provisions of Article (7), Paragraph (1) of this law.
Person who has Arab affiliation has access to facilitated naturalisation. Other conditions: see A06 (but residence reduced to 15 years).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is an Arab person who has rendered Bahrain great services. Acquisition is by Order of His Majesty the Governor upon the person's request.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in the Bahamas to a citizen parent in wedlock or to a citizen mother out of wedlock.

Person is born abroad to a father who himself is a citizen otherwise than by mode A01b.;                                       Person is born abroad to a mother who is a citizen married to a foreigner or to a citizen mother who is not married to the foreign father, and registers between the age of 18 and 21. Other conditions: renunciation of another citizenship (unless this is legally impossible), and oath of allegiance. Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy, or if the person within a period of 5 years immediately preceding the application was sentenced to death or a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good behaviour, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means to support him/herself.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person's father marries the mother.;               Paternity established through a court, Justice of the Peace, notary public, birth registration, a deed deposited with the Registrar General, written consent of name change establishing paternity, and through consistent acknowledgment that person is the father of the individual.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person is born in the Bahamas to foreign citizens and submits an application within 1 year after reaching the age of majority. Other conditions: renunciation of another citizenship and oath of allegiance.  Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy, if the person within a period of 5 years immediately preceding the application was sentenced to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good behaviour, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means for self-support.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in the Bahamas for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in the country, in the service of the government, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 6 out of 9 years prior to the 12-month period.  Other conditions: renunciation of another citizenship, good character, full capacity, sufficient knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, intent to make the Bahamas his/her permanent home (either by residence or government service), and oath of allegiance. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the Bahamas for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in the country, in the service of the government, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 6 out of 9 years prior to the 12-month period and intent to make the Bahamas his/her permanent home (either by residence or government service).
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Condition of sufficient knowledge of English.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Condition of sufficient knowledge of the duties of a citizen and oath of allegiance required.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the female spouse of a male citizen. Other conditions: oath of allegiance. Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy, or if the person within a period of 5 years immediately preceding the application was sentenced to death or a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good behaviour, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means for self-support.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: One parent must be a citizen and person must be under age 18.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen or, in case of joint adoption, by a male citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the child of a deceased male citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is the female spouse of someone who a person who becomes citizen. Other conditions: oath of loyalty. Must renounce other citizenship. Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy, or if the person within a period of 5 years immediately preceding the application was sentenced to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good behaviour, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means for self-support.
