category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen or a British protected person. Other conditions: full capacity, renunciation of another citizenship (unless this is legally impossible), and oath of allegiance (only for British protected persons). Other conditions: see A06.
Person is born in BiH to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to a citizen and would otherwise be stateless.;

Person is born abroad to a citizen on the condition that before the age of 23 he or she is registered as a citizen before the competent authorities.
Person is found in BiH of unknown parentage.
Person is born in BiH to parents of unknown citizenship or without citizenship, or the child would otherwise be stateless.

Person has been resident in BiH for 3 years immediately before the application. Other conditions: sufficient command of one of the official languages of BiH, was not expelled from BiH by the competent authority, was not sentenced to imprisonment for more than 3 years within the 8 years preceding the request, renounces or loses in any other way another citizenship, unless regulated otherwise by a bilateral agreement with the country in question (renunciation or loss of another citizenship will not be required if it is not allowed, or is unreasonable to request), no ongoing criminal procedure against the person (unless unreasonable to request a proof thereof), no threat to security of BiH, have sufficient permanent source of income or be able to provide evidence of sufficient funds, has no tax or other financial obligations, signs a statement accepting the legal system and constitutional order of BiH, and possesses a valid guarantee of acquiring citizenship of BiH.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in BiH for 3 years immediately before the application.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Person renounces or loses in any other way another citizenship, unless regulated otherwise by a bilateral agreement with the country in question (renunciation or loss of another citizenship will not be required if it is not allowed, or is unreasonable to request).
Person has sufficient command of one of the official languages of BiH.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person signs a statement accepting the legal system and constitutional order of BiH.

Person was not expelled from BiH by the competent authority, was not sentenced to imprisonment for more than 3 years within the 8 years preceding the request, no ongoing criminal procedure against the person (unless unreasonable to request a proof thereof), no threat to security of BiH.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has sufficient permanent source of income or be able to provide evidence of sufficient funds, has no tax or other financial obligations.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for at least 5 years (including the time of application), has been granted permanent residence in BiH, and does not pose a threat to security of BiH. Other conditions: renounces or loses in any other way another citizenship, unless regulated otherwise by a bilateral agreement with the state in question (renunciation or loss of another citizenship will not be required if that is not allowed, or is not reasonable to request).
Person is a minor who is a permanent or temporary resident of BiH and whose parent acquired citizenship. If older than 14, the child's consent is needed.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen (full adoption).
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person has been a citizen of BiH and renounced citizenship for the purpose of acquiring or keeping another citizenship, and was granted either permanent residence or temporary residence for at least 1 year prior to submitting a request. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is an emigrant from BiH, or first or second generation descendant of a former emigrant. Other conditions: proficient in one of the official languages of BiH, was not expelled from BiH by a competent authority, was not sentenced to imprisonment for more than three years.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a registered refugee and has continuously resided for 5 years BiH (minors are exempted from this temporal requirement). Other conditions: no expulsion from BiH by the competent authority, no sentence to imprisonment for more than 3 years, no ongoing criminal procedure against the person (unless unreasonable to request a proof thereof), and no threat to security of BiH. If older than 14, the child's consent is needed.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a registered stateless person and has continuously resided for 5 years BiH (minors are exempted from this temporal requirement). Other conditions: no expulsion from BiH by the competent authority, no sentence to imprisonment for more than 3 years, no ongoing criminal procedure against the person (unless unreasonable to request a proof thereof), and no threat to security of BiH. If older than 14, the child's consent is needed.

Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the special interest of BiH. Other conditions: proficient in one of the official languages of BiH, was not expelled from BiH by the competent authority, was not sentenced to imprisonment for more than three years.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Belarus to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is a child found in Belarus whose parents are unknown.

Person is born in Belarus to stateless parents (or a stateless single parent) and the child cannot acquire another citizenship by descent or parents are foreign citizens and cannot transfer citizenship to their child.

Person has had 7 years of uninterrupted residence in the country. Other conditions: commitment to respect the Constitution and the laws of the country, knowledge of at least one the official languages, regular employment or source of income, renunciation of other citizenship (unless it is impossible), no criminal record.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has had 7 years of uninterrupted residence in the country.
Person has renounced other citizenship (unless it is impossible).
Person has knowledge of at least one the official languages.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person commits to respect the Constitution and the laws of the country.
Person does not have a criminal record.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has regular employment or source of income.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a child, permanently resides in Belarus and at least one parent is a citizen.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is a child residing permanently in the country and a parent acquired citizenship. Other conditions: commitment  to respect the Constitution and the laws of the country, knowledge of at least one of the official languages, renunciation of other citizenship (unless it is impossible).
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a child whose parent is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a foreign citizen or stateless person and previously was a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (but residence requirement may be reduced or waved).
Person is a citizen of Russia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan or Ukraine. Other conditions: former USSR citizenship, permanent residence in Belarus, relatives are permanently living in the country.

Person is a 'Bielorussian' and identifies as Bielarussian, or the applicant is the descendant (up to great grandchildren) of such a person. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement may be reduced or waved).; 
Person was born in Belarus before 12 November 1991 and permanently resides in Belarus or is the spouse or descendant of such a person.  Other conditions: see A06 (except for residence requirement and income requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person permanently resides in Belarus and also permanently resided in Belarus before 12 November 1991. Other conditions: see A06 (except for residence requirement and income requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person contributed outstanding merits to the country or possesses a profession or qualification of public interest. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement may be reduced or waved).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person is born in Belize unless the child is born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.
Person is a newborn infant found in Belize of unknown and unascertainable parentage.

Person has been ordinarily resident in Belize for 5 years immediately prior to the application, and intends to continue to do so. Other conditions: sound mind, good character, no conviction for serious criminal offences, no threat to safety or public order of Belize, not been declared bankrupt, sufficient means for self-support.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been ordinarily resident in Belize for 5 years immediately prior to the application, and intends to continue to do so.
Conditions of good character, no conviction for serious criminal offences, no threat to safety or public order of Belize.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person must have sufficient means for self-support and not been declared bankrupt.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse, or the widow or widower, of a citizen by descent or registration, and has been resident in Belize for 1 year immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: sound mind and intent to continue to reside in Belize. Note, Constitution does not postulate these conditions.
Person is born to a deceased citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person whose spouse acquires citizenship by registration can acquire citizenship by registration at the same time as his/her spouse or a subsequent time thereafter.
Person is a minor whose parent includes the child in his/her registration application. After age 18 person is entitled to apply, irrespective of residency requirements stipulated elsewhere in Act.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: A person who had been a citizen via descent is able to reacquire Belizean citizenship if the following conditions hold: renunciation of other citizenship (if that country so requires it) and residency or intent to reside in Belize. The Minister may refuse to reissue citizenship on ground of public policy. Oath required.
n.a. (Note: Act states that a refugee will cease to be such if s/he acquires Belizean citizenship. Procedure to do so is not included in the Act.)
n.a. (But Minister decides whether individual whose citizenship is in doubt is in fact a Belizean based on 'fact or law.')

article: Const 141, Law no. 584, 94, Supreme Decree no. 216, 2
specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen and is registered with the Bolivian consulate in the country of birth.
Person is born in Bolivia. Unless parents are foreign diplomats.
Person has been legally resident in Bolivia for a continuous period of 3 years, passed a written examination of general knowledge concerning Bolivian history, and no criminal record.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been legally resident in Bolivia for a continuous period of 3 years
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Person has passed a written examination of general knowledge concerning Bolivian history.

category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement is reduced to 2 years).
Person is the child of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement is reduced to 2 years, and children until the age of 12 are exempt from test regarding Bolivian history).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person has children or foster parents who are citizens. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement is reduced to 2 years).
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to relatives in ascending and descending line)

specification: Person is a former citizen who previously renounced citizenship. Children born abroad to parents who previously renounced citizenship have an independent right to apply for citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person obtains citizenship for his/her service to the country. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement is reduced to 2 years).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person provides military service in Bolivia. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement is reduced to 2 years).

category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Brazil. Unless parents are in the service of their country (e.g. diplomats).

Person has been permanently resident in Brazil for at least 4 years immediately prior to the application and continues to do so. Other conditions: legal capacity, knowledge of the Portuguese language (applicant's conditions are taken into account), no convictions in Brazil or abroad unless person has been rehabilitated.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Brazil for at least 4 years immediately prior to the application and continues to do so.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Knowledge of the Portuguese language required (applicant's conditions are taken into account).
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person may not have been convicted in Brazil or abroad unless person has been rehabilitated.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person took up residence in Brazil before the age of 10 (discretionary grant of 'provisional citizenship'). Application for the (non-discretionary) grant of 'full citizenship' must be made within  2 years after reaching the age of majority.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is the spouse or a partner of a citizen, has been continuously resident in Brazil for at least 1 year. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
Person is adopted by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person has a Brazilian child, has been continuously resident in Brazil for at least 1 year immediately prior to the application and continues to do so. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is the spouse or a partner of a citizen, has been continuously resident in Brazil for at least 1 year. Other conditions: see A06.
Person lost citizenship by acquiring citizenship of another country.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen of a Portuguese-speaking country, has been resident in Brazil for a continuous period of at least 1 year immediately prior to the application and continues to do so. Other conditions: good morals.
Person has been resident in Brazil for at least 15 years immediately prior to the application and continues to do so. Other conditions: no criminal record.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has special professional, scientific or artistic merits or has rendered relevant services to Brazil, has been resident in Brazil for a continuous period of at least 1 year immediately prior to the application and continues to do so.  Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen in active service of Brazil for at least 5 years, or is a foreigner who has been continuously in the service of Brazil for at least 10 years. Person is exempt from the residence requirement.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Child is born outside of Barbados in wedlock to a father who became a citizen through means other than operation of Article 2(2) of the Constitution or is born to a mother who was born in Barbados. If the child is born out of wedlock, the mother must have been born in Barbados. Person born overseas to a diplomat considered to have been born in Barbados (BAR (2)9.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person automatically acquires citizenship through birth in Barbados unless the child is born to a father who is a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under enemy occupation.
Person is a newborn infant found in Barbados of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Barbados and has always been stateless.

category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has been resident in Barbados for 12 months immediately prior to the application (exemption for British protected persons), as well as during 5 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, intent to reside in Barbados, and oath of allegiance. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Barbados for 12 months immediately prior to the application (exemption for British protected persons), as well as during 5 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Intent to reside in Barbados required.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is a woman married to a male citizen or to a male who becomes a citizen. Other conditions: oath of loyalty (only for British protected persons and persons who are not Commonwealth citizens or citizens of Ireland). Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen or, in case of joint adoption, by a male citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Child born to a deceased citizen father.;Widow of deceased male citizen or someone who, but for his death, would have become a citizen of Barbados.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is the female spouse of someone who becomes a citizen. Other conditions: oath of loyalty (only for British protected persons and persons who are not Commonwealth citizens or citizens of Ireland). Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor and parent is already a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of Ireland been ordinarily resident in Barbados, or has been in the service of the government, or has had partly such residence and partly such service for at least 5 out of 7 years immediately prior to the application. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements. Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy, if the person has been sentenced to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good character, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means to support him/herself.

Person is and has always been stateless and was born before 29 November 1966 to a mother who was a citizen jus soli, or was born after that date to a mother who was a citizen, or was born in Barbados (regardless of parental citizenship). Registration can be denied in the interests of national security or public policy, if the person has been sentenced to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months, is not of good character, is a danger to public safety, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means to support him/herself.
category: Additional restrictions apply (eg citizenship status of parent)

specification: Person is a citizen of a First Schedule country or the Republic of Ireland has either been in government service or been partly in government service while resident in Barbados.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person is born in Brunei to a father who is a citizen.
category: Group restriction: only if citizen parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born abroad to a father who (1) was born in Brunei and belongs to one of the specified indigenous groups of the Malay race and (2) is employed abroad in the service of the Brunei government or a Brunei company. Or person is born to a father who was born abroad and who in turn was born to a father who was born in Brunei and belongs to one of the specified indigenous groups of the Malay race. Child needs to be registered within 6  months after birth.; Person is born abroad to a father who (1) was born in Brunei to a mother and father who were both born in Brunei and are members of any of the groups of people specified in the 1st Schedule (i.e. people who are indigenous to Brunei, but note that the list is longer than the indigenous people referred to under BRU 4(1)a) and (2) is employed abroad in the service of the Brunei government or a Brunei company.  Or person is born abroad to a father and mother who were both born in Brunei and are members of any of the groups specified in the 1st Schedule. Child needs to be registered within 6  months after birth.; Person is born abroad to a father who is a citizen and is employed abroad in the service of the Brunei government or a Brunei company. Child needs to be registered within 6  months after birth.; Person is born abroad to a father who is a citizen by registration or naturalisation. Child needs to be registered within 6  months after birth.
category: Group restriction: only if citizen parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born in Brunei and belongs to one of the specified indigenous groups of the Malay race.
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born in Brunei to a father and mother who were both born in Brunei and are members of any of the groups of people specified in the 1st Schedule (i.e. people who are indigenous to Brunei, but note that the list is longer than the indigenous people referred to under BRU 4(1)a).
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born in Brunei and has been lawfully resident there for at least 12 years in the aggregate within a period of 15 years immediately prior to the application, as well as throughout the 2 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: able to speak the Malay language with proficiency (unless person has physical or speech/hearing impediment), good character, and oath of allegiance.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been lawfully resident in Brunei for at least 20 years in the aggregate within a period of 25 years immediately prior to the application, as well as throughout the 2 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: able to speak the Malay language with proficiency (unless person has physical or speech/hearing impediment), good character, unlikely to become a charge on Brunei, intent to settle permanently in the country, and oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident in Brunei for at least 20 years in the aggregate within a period of 25 years immediately prior to the application, as well as throughout the 2 years immediately prior to the application. Intent to settle permanently in the country required.
category: More than 10 years of residence required

specification: Ability to speak the Malay language with proficiency (unless person has physical or speech/hearing impediment).
category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is unlikely to become a charge on Brunei.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a citizen and irrespective of whether she is of full capacity. Other conditions: good character and oath of allegiance.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Former citizens who have renounced or been deprived of citizenship are in principle not eligible for reacquisition, but may reacquire citizenship by discretionary approval of the Sultan.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in Bhutan to two citizens.
Person is born abroad to two citizens.

Person is 21 years or older, has been resident in Bhutan for 20 years, and this period of residence has been registered in the census. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, proficiency in Dzongkha language (oral, written and passive), good knowledge of culture, customs, traditions and history of Bhutan, no record of imprisonment for criminal offences in Bhutan or abroad, no record of having spoken or acted against the king, country and people of Bhutan, and oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Bhutan for 20 years, and this period of residence has been registered in the census.
category: More than 10 years of residence required

specification: Proficiency in Dzongkha language (oral, written and passive).
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Good  knowledge of culture, customs, traditions and history of Bhutan.
Good character, no record of imprisonment for criminal offences in Bhutan or abroad, no record of having spoken or acted against the king, country and people of Bhutan.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is 15 years or older, one of the parents is a citizen, and the person has been resident in Bhutan for 15 years and this period of residence has been registered in the census. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is 21 years or older, is a government employee, and has been resident in Bhutan for 15 years and this period of residence has been registered in the census. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person is born in Botswana to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person has been resident in Botswana for a continuous period of 12 months prior to the application, and has been resident for at least 10 out of the previous 12 years.
Other conditions: good character, sufficient knowledge of Setswana or other language spoken by a 'tribal community' in Botswana.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Botswana for a continuous period of 12 months prior to the application, and has been resident for at least 10 out of the previous 12 years.
sufficient knowledge of Setswana or other language spoken by a 'tribal community' in Botswana.
category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is married to a citizen, has been resident in Botswana for 5 years, and has lodged a declaration of intention to naturalise 2 and a half years earlier. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is under the age of 21 years and his/her parent has become a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a child under the age of 3 years.; Person is a child over the age of 3 years and other conditions apply: good character (if sufficiently mature to have formed character).
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who lost citizenship because of acquiring another citizenship or renouncing Botswana citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in CAR to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a parent who is a citizen.
Person found in CAR of unknown parents is presumed born there.
Person has been the object of a legitimating adoption by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person is born in CAR to two foreign parents, has been resident for at least 5 years, and makes a declaration during his/her minority.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been legally and habitually resident for 5 years. No other conditions.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been legally and habitually resident for 5 years.

Person is a child looked after by a public or private children's home or brought up by a person who is a citizen, has been resident for at least 5 years, and makes a declaration during his/her minority. Other conditions: government may oppose acquisition within 6 months of the declaration.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is a woman married to a citizen. Citizenship is acquired at the moment of marriage, unless she declares that she declines acquisition. Other conditions: government may oppose acquisition within 6 months of the marriage.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of a parent who has acquired citizenship if the child has not acquired citizenship automatically under mode A14.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a child adopted by a citizen, has been resident for at least 5 years and makes a declaration during his/her minority. Other conditions: government may oppose acquisition within 6 months of the declaration.; Person is an adult adopted by a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period may be waived).
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the wife of a person who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period can be waived).
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person who is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship, providing that descent is established by civil registration or judgement.; Person is the child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship from the other while alive. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period can be waived).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a former citizen who was not deprived of citizenship and is resident in CAR.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has made important real estate investments. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period can be waived.)
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen otherwise than by descent. Exempt from this first generation limitation are those born abroad to parents engaged in Canada's armed forces or public service.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Canada. Unless parents are foreign diplomats.
Person is found in Canada of unknown parentage and is younger than 7 years.

Person has been resident for 3 out 5 years immediately preceding the application. Other conditions: meet the Income Tax Act requirements to file income tax returns for 4 of those 6 years, language (in French or English) test and knowledge of Canada and the responsibilities and privileges of citizenship, no extradition order issued against the person, no danger to public security (as defined in CAN 22), attend a citizenship ceremony and take a citizenship oath
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident for 3 out 5 years immediately preceding the application.
Language (in French or English) test required.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Knowledge of Canada and the responsibilities and privileges of citizenship required. Person must attend a citizenship ceremony and take a citizenship oath.
No extradition order may have been issued against the person, no danger to public security (as defined in CAN 22).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person must meet the Income Tax Act requirements to file income tax returns for 4 of those 6 years.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: In the case of a minor, the Minister may waive on compassionate grounds the ordinary residence requirements regarding length of residence, the requirement to take the oath of citizenship, or the requirement respecting who may make an application in respect of a minor.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is a minor and adoption is in the child's best interests, created a genuine relationship of parent and child, was in accordance with laws, did not circumvent legal requirements for international adoption, was not entered into primarily  acquiring immigration status or citizenship. Or person is an adult and a genuine relationship of parent and child existed before the person attained the age of 18 years as well as at the time of the adoption. Adult adopted person must fulfil ordinary residence requirements  (see A06) and have an adequate knowledge of one of the official languages of Canada.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Where a child is born after the death of either of his parents, the child shall be deemed to have been born before the death of that parent.  Also applies in cases where the deceased parent was no longer a citizen, but would have been granted citizenship retroactively as a 'lost Canadian'.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is a minor who is permanently resident in Canada, and whose parent is acquiring citizenship and has parental authority over the child.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen and has been permanently resident in Canada for 1 year immediately preceding the application. Reacquisition can be refused on grounds relating to previous criminal behaviour or public security.

Person is born to a citizen by descent, is under the age of 23 years, has resided in Canada for at least 3 out of 4 years immediately predating the application, has always been stateless, and has not been convicted for certain offences.
category: Additional restrictions apply (eg citizenship status of parent)

specification: Person has rendered exceptional services to Canada.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a permanent resident who completed two years of service in the Canadian Armed Forces, or who was attached or seconded to the Canadian Armed Forces for the same duration. Other conditions:  see A06 (except residency requirement).
Person is born in Switzerland to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Switzerland of unknown parentage.
Person is a minor who is born out of wedlock to a father who is a citizen and whose paternity has been established, and a mother who is a citizen of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person is born in Switzerland, has a permanent residence permit, attended compulsory schooling in Switzerland for at least five years, has at least one grandparent who was born in Switzerland or acquired a right of residence in Switzerland, and at least one parent who has a permanent residence permit, resided in Switzerland for at least ten years and attended compulsory schooling in Switzerland. Person must be less than 25 years old at the moment when the application is submitted. Other conditions: person is successfully integrated (see mode A06) and does not pose a risk to Switzerland's internal or external security.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has a permanent residence permit, resided in Switzerland for 10 years (3 of these must have been in the 5 years preceding the application). Other conditions: successfully integrated (entails showing respect for public security and order, respecting the values enshrined in the Constitution, able to communicate in a national language (certification), participating in economic life or acquiring an education, and encouraging and supporting the integration of one<d5>s spouse, partner or minor children), familiar with Swiss way of life, and not pose a risk to Switzerland<d5>s internal or external security. Canton may provide for additional criteria for integration. Various cantons also require an oath of allegiance at the citizenship ceremony.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has a permanent residence permit, resided in Switzerland for 10 years  (3 of these must have been in the 5 years preceding the application).
Person is  successfully integrated (entails being able to communicate in a national language (certification)).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person is  successfully integrated (entails showing respect for public security and order, respecting the values enshrined in the Constitution, participating in economic life or acquiring an education, and encouraging and supporting the integration of one<d5>s spouse, partner or minor children), familiar with Swiss way of life. Canton may provide for additional criteria for integration. Various cantons also require an oath of allegiance at the citizenship ceremony.
Person may not pose a risk to Switzerland<d5>s internal or external security.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is successfully integrated (entails showing respect for public security and order).
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person has been in a marriage with a citizen for 3 years and has resided in Switzerland for at least 5 years, including one year immediately prior to making the application. If the person married to a citizen is resident abroad, only after 6 years of marriage and 'strong ties to Switzerland'. Other conditions: person is successfully integrated (see mode A06) and does not pose a risk to Switzerland's internal or external security.; 
Person is in a civil partnership with a citizen for 3 years and has resided in Switzerland for at least 5 years, including one year immediately prior to making the application. Other conditions: see A06 (i.e. person has to go through the three-level naturalization procedure at the federal, cantonal and communal level).

Person was a minor when his parent acquired citizenship by naturalisation, is under 22 years and has resided in Switzerland for at least five years, including at least three years immediately prior to making the application. Other conditions: person is successfully integrated (see mode A06) and does not pose a risk to Switzerland's internal or external security.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. The applicant's minor children are normally included in the naturalisation application. If over the age of 16 the child's consent is required. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement)
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost Swiss citizenship, is successfully integrated (if he or she lives in Switzerland) or has close ties with Switzerland (if he or she lives abroad), shows respect for public security and order, respects the values enshrined in the Constitution, and is not a risk to Switzerland<d5>s internal or external security. If loss of citizenship occurred more than ten years ago, three years of residence in Switzerland is required.
Person has acted as a citizen in good faith for 5 years. Other conditions: person is successfully integrated (see mode A06) and does not pose a risk to Switzerland's internal or external security.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a stateless minor who has been resident in Switzerland for 5 years. Other conditions: person is successfully integrated (see mode A06) and does not pose a risk to Switzerland's internal or external security.
category: Additional restrictions apply (eg citizenship status of parent)

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen. Other conditions: at least one parent or grandparent acquired citizenship by birth in Chile, by ordinary naturalisation, or by naturalisation granted as a special favour.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Chile. Unless parents are foreign diplomats or foreigners in transit. Children of migrants in an irregular situation who are residing in the country also obtain Chilean nationality at birth.

Person is born in Chile to foreign diplomats or parents in transit. Other conditions: declaration is made within 1 year after reaching the age of 18, in front of the competent public authority, and the person must prove beyond doubt to fall in one of the two categories.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person is 18 years or older, has lived for a period of at least 5 years in Chile, and was granted permanent residence. Other conditions: oath of renunciation of citizenship of another country,  no convictions for delicts or crimes and no criminal proceedings initiatives against the person for such offences, source of income sufficient for support, no danger to social and political order, good morals, and no threat to Chilean interests and security.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has lived for a period of at least 5 years in Chile, and was granted permanent residence.
Oath of renunciation of citizenship of another country required (proof of renunciation is not required).

No convictions for delicts or crimes and no criminal proceedings initiatives against the person for such offences. No danger to social and political order, good morals, and no threat to Chilean interests and security.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person must have source of income sufficient for support.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is 14 years or older, has lived for a period of at least 5 five years in Chile, and was granted permanent residence. Permission of parent/caretaker is required.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person's parent has become a citizen by naturalisation. Other conditions: person has reached the age of majority, has lived for a continuous period of at least 5 years in Chile, is entitled to permanent residence. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person lost Chilean citizenship under modes L01, L03, or L15.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is under 18 years of age, one of whose parents has naturalised and is a recognised refugee.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has rendered outstanding services to the country and is accordingly awarded citizenship 'by grace'.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in China to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen. Unless the parent is settled abroad and the child consequently acquired another citizenship at birth.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in China to parents who are stateless or of uncertain citizenship and who are settled in China.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is a close relative of a citizen. Other conditions: willing to abide by China's Constitution and laws, and renunciation of citizenship of another country.
Person is a close relative of a citizen. Other conditions: willing to abide by China's Constitution and laws, and renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a former citizen and has legitimate reasons for reacquiring Chinese citizenship. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country.
Person is stateless. Other conditions: see A06.

Person must be settled in China (residence requirement not specified) or other legitimate reasons for naturalisation must be present. Other conditions: willing to abide by China's Constitution and laws, and renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Cote d'Ivoire in wedlock or descent to a citizen is established (unless descent is established to one or both parents who are foreigners).
Person born abroad to a citizen in wedlock, or out of wedlock and descent is established to a parent who is a citizen.
Person is born in Cote d'Ivoire. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period is reduced to 2 years).
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been habitually and legally resident in Cote d'Ivoire for 5 years. Other conditions: good conduct, sound mental health and physical health would not make a burden or danger to the public. Any expulsion or house arrest must have been annulled, and house arrest or period of imprisonment does not count towards residence period.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually and legally resident in Cote d'Ivoire for 5 years.
Person is of good conduct. Any expulsion or house arrest must have been annulled, and house arrest or period of imprisonment does not count towards residence period.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person has sound mental health and physical health, would not make a burden or danger to the public.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person marries a citizen, unless s/he declares in advance that s/he declines citizenship. Government may oppose within 6 months.
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the wife of a person who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor whose father (or mother if a widow) or parent to whom descent is established when born out of wedlock is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation.; Person is a minor child born abroad if one parent is acquiring citizenship from the other while alive, and person does not meet the conditions for automatic acquisition (eg because the child is married), or person is adult child of a person who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who is habitually resident in Cote d'Ivoire. Reacquisition is granted by decree. Not available if citizenship was withdrawn under IVO 54 (on grounds of crime against security of state or ordinary crime) unless person rendered exceptional services to Cote d'Ivoire.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person renders 'important services' of an artistic, scientific or literary nature, or introduces a useful industry or invention. Other conditions: see A06 (period of habitual residence is reduced to 2 years). Residence requirement is waived altogether for person who has rendered 'exceptional services' or whose naturalisation represents an 'exceptional interest' for the country. Other conditions: see A06 (residence period may be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Cameroon in wedlock and either parent is a citizen.
Person is born abroad in wedlock and either parent is a citizen.
Person is born in Cameroon of one parent who was also born there.
Person is born in Cameroon of unknown parents. Newborn found in Cameroon is presumed born there.
Person is born in Cameroon and cannot claim any other citizenship at birth.
Person is born out of wedlock and descent is established during childhood to one parent who is a citizen.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is born in Cameroon and has been habitually resident for at least 5 years. Other conditions: claim must be made within 6 months before reaching majority.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for 5 years preceding the application. Other conditions: 21 years or older, Cameroon is his/her centre of principal interests, good character, not convicted of crime, sound mind and body. No residence period required if born in Cameroon.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for 5 years preceding the application.
Person is of good character, not convicted of crime.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person has sound mind and body.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a citizen. Cameroonian citizenship can be declined or acquired at the moment of marriage. Other conditions: government may oppose acquisition of citizenship by decree within 6 months of marriage.; Person is the husband of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence period).
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Person is the minor or adult child of a person who has reacquired Cameroonian citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person was adopted by a citizen as a child and is habitually resident in Cameroon. Other conditions: declaration must be made within 6 months preceding majority.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person provides evidence that has been a Cameroonian citizen and that s/he is resident in Cameroon.
Person has rendered exceptional services to Cameroon or naturalisation represents an exceptional interest for Cameroon. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence period).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in DRC to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is a newborn child and his/her parents are unknown, unless his/her filiation is established during minority and he/she acquires citizenship of the parent according to the law of that country.
Person is born in DRC to parents of unknown citizenship or without citizenship.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born in DRC of foreign parents, is at least 18 years old, resides permanently in DRC and manifests the will to obtain DRC citizenship in a written manner. Other conditions: renounce other citizenship, speak one of the Congolese languages, be of good character, reside permanently in DCR for at least seven years, not having committed acts that are incompatible with Congolese citizenship or against the interests of DRC, not being convicted for certain serious crimes.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for at least 7 years. Citizenship is granted by decree. Other conditions: renounce other citizenship, speak one of the Congolese languages, be of good character, reside permanently in DCR for at least seven years, not having committed acts that are incompatible with Congolese citizenship or against the interests of DRC, not being convicted for certain serious crimes.

Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.;Person has reached the age of majority and has been adopted by a citizen. Person must have resided in DRC for at least five years, speak a national language, and renounce foreign citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the child of a former citizen.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor child and parent acquires citizenship by option.; Person is a minor child who has been adopted by a parent who voluntarily acquires citizenship.; Person is a minor child whose parent acquires citizenship by marriage.; Person is a minor child whose parent voluntarily acquires citizenship.; Person is a minor child whose parent reacquires citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person proves that he/she has possessed DRC citizenship.
Person has delivered distinguished services to DRC or DRC has as significant interest in naturalisation.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person born in the country to a citizen.
Person born abroad from a citizen mother or a citizen father.
Person is born in the country and either one of the parents or both parents were also born in the country.
Person is born in the country to unknown parents.

Person is born in the country and has resided in the country since he/she attained the age of 16 and still resides there when he/she attains the age of majority. Person has the right to repudiate citizenship. Government may oppose acquisition on grounds of indignity, lack of assimilation, or serious physical or mental handicap. Provision is not applicable is person has been subjected to an expulsion order or house arrest.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has resided in the country for 10 years. Other conditions: age of majority, sound mind, good health, good character, not convicted to imprisonment for more than one year or for certain crimes, assimilated to the Congolese community, oath of loyalty.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has resided in the country for 10 years.
Assimilation to the Congolese community required.
Assimilation to the Congolese community required.
Person must have good character, not convicted to imprisonment for more than one year or for certain crimes.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen. Five years of communal residence in the country after the registration of the marriage required. Person has the right to repudiate citizenship. Government may oppose acquisition on grounds of indignity, lack of assimilation, or serious physical or mental handicap. Provision is not applicable is person has been subjected to an expulsion order or house arrest.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation (security-related exceptions apply).;Person is a major child or a child who has not obtained citizenship automatically on the basis of the previous provision.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a former citizen. Person may not have been subjected to an expulsion order or house arrest. Request can be refused at the discretion of the authorities.;Person has lost citizenship as a child due to the involuntary loss of citizenship by one of his/her parents. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).

Person has rendered exceptional services to the country or his/her naturalisation is of particular interest to the country and beneficial for its economic, social, cultural and scientific development.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Colombia to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen and establishes residence in Colombia or registers with a Colombian consulate.

Person is born in Colombia to non-citizens who are domiciled in the country at the time of birth (Article 1 of Law 1997 of 2019 establishes that the children of Venezuelan nationals born in Colombia between 1 January 2015 and 16 September 2021 will be Colombians  by birth. This is regardless of whether the parents were regular or irregular in the country at the moment of birth.)

Person is born in Colombia and is not entitled to citizenship of another country. Legal residence is not required for the child, but the parents have to prove that their country of citizenship does not grant citizenship by descent to the child.

Person has been legally and continuously resident in Colombia for 5 years immediately preceding the application. Other conditions: proficiency in Spanish (except for those who know an indigenous language spoken in Colombia, who have had secondary or university education in Colombia, or who are older than 65 years), knowledge of basic principles of the Constitution, history and geography of Colombia (except for those who have had secondary or university education in Colombia, or who are older than 65 years), proof of employment in the country, and oath of loyalty.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been legally and continuously resident in Colombia for 5 years immediately preceding the application.
Proficiency in Spanish (except for those who know an indigenous language spoken in Colombia, who have had secondary or university education in Colombia, or who are older than 65 years).
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of basic principles of the Constitution, history and geography of Colombia (except for those who have had secondary or university education in Colombia, or who are older than 65 years).
Proof of employment in the country.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen, or is in a long term relationship with a citizen and has been legally and continuously resident in Colombia for 2 years immediately preceding the application. Other conditions: see A06.
Person has Colombian children and has been legally resident in Colombia for a continuous period of 2 years immediately preceding the application. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation, has parental authority over the child, and the child is included in the naturalisation certificate. Person can express his or her wish to remain a citizen upon reaching the age of majority by taking an oath of loyalty.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who lost citizenship due to naturalisation abroad when this was still a ground for loss under Article 9 of the Constitution of 1886. Reacquisition can be extended to minor children but not to spouse. One year's residence and proof of good conduct is required for naturalised citizens who lost their citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a Latin American or Caribbean national by birth and has been continuously resident in Colombia for 1 year immediately preceding the application. Any reciprocity through operative international treaties is taken into account.
Person is a member of an indigenous people living in a border region with Colombia (acquisition is on the basis of the reciprocity principle under public treaties).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Comoros to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to one parent who is a citizen.
Person found in Comoros as a child is presumed born there.
Definition of mother or father extends to any parent whose connection is established by legal means.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person is a child born in Comoros to foreign parents if s/he has been resident for 5 years and birth has been formally registered. Government can oppose acquisition within 1 year.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been legally resident for 10 years. Other conditions: good character, sound mind, good physical health, assimilation to Comorian community.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been legally resident for 10 years.
Person must be assimilated to Comorian community.
Person must be assimilated to Comorian community.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person must have sound mind, good physical health.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been looked after for at least 5 years as a child by a public of private institution or by a person who is a citizen and makes a declaration before the child reaches majority. Government can oppose acquisition within 1 year.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is a woman who marries a citizen. Acquires automatically unless she declines to do so.; Person is a man married to a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period is reduced to 5 years).
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Person is the wife of a foreigner who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period may be waived).
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of two parents who are acquiring citizenship (or one if the other is dead).; Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship from the other parent or by naturalisation. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period may be waived).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who is habitually resident in Comoros and who was not deprived of citizenship, unless reacquisition represents an exceptional interest for Comoros.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered exceptional services to Comoros or naturalisation represents an exceptional interest. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period may be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Cape Verde to a citizen.
Person is born abroad and one parent is a citizen in the service of the state.; Person is born abroad and one parent is a citizen from birth.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Cape Verde to parents who have been habitually resident for at least 5 years and are not in the service of another state.
Person found as a newborn in Cape Verde is presumed born in the country.
Person is born in Cape Verde and does not have another citizenship, or both parents are stateless or of unknown citizenship and are resident in Cape Verde.
Person is born in Cape Verde to foreign parents who have been habitually resident for at least 5 years and are not in the service of a foreign state.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Cape Verde for at least 5 years. Other conditions: good character, capacity to make decisions and support him/herself.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Cape Verde for at least 5 years.

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person has capacity to support him/herself.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is married to a citizen.
Person is a stateless minor adopted by a citizen.; Person is a minor of foreign or unknown citizenship who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is born abroad and one grandparent is a citizen from birth.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a grandchild of a citizen

specification: Person is a minor or incapacitated child of a person who is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who lost citizenship through a declaration made during his/her minority, provided that s/he establishes residence in Cape Verde for at least 6 months, or person lost citizenship because s/he renounced, provided that s/he establishes residence in Cape Verde for at least 3 years. Decreto-Lei 53/93 clarifies that procedure is declaration.; Person is a former citizen due to voluntary acquisition of foreign citizenship. Other requirements: see A06 (except residence requirement)
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a descendant from Cape Verdeans. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period may be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has rendered relevant services to the state. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period may be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has realised investments or offers guarantees that he/she will make investments that will unequivocally increase the opportunities for employment and contribute to the development of the country. Naturalisation under this provision does not grant political rights, including to vote or be elected or to exercise public functions on a permanent basis.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Costa Rica to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen by birth and is registered in the Civil Register by the parent during minority, or registers him/herself before reaching the age of 25.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Costa Rica to non-citizens and is registered as a citizen by a parent during minority, or registers him/herself before reaching the age of 25.
Person is an infant found in Costa Rica of unknown parentage.

Person is born in Costa Rica, older than 25 years and does not meet the conditions under A02a. Other conditions: seven years' residence [assuming that the period can only start to run at age 18], good behaviour, means sufficient for self-support.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in Costa Rica for at least 7 years (5 years for citizens by birth of Spain, a Central American country or an Iberoamerican country). Other conditions: good behaviour, known source of income or occupation sufficient for self-support and that of his/her family, clean criminal record, knowledge of Spanish (oral, written and passive), knowledge of the history of Costa Rica and its values, promise to reside within the national territory on a permanent basis, oath of loyalty,  not being a citizen of a country with which Costa Rica is at war, no conviction in Costa Rica or abroad for any of the listed offences (including drug smuggling).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Costa Rica for at least 7 years. If citizen by birth of Spain, a Central American country or an Iberoamerican country, residence for at least 5 years.
Knowledge of Spanish (oral, written and passive).
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of the history of Costa Rica and its values.
Good behaviour, clean criminal record, no conviction in Costa Rica or abroad for any of the listed offences (including drug smuggling).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Known source of income or occupation sufficient for self-support and that of his/her family.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and loses his/her original citizenship upon marriage, or has been married and resident in Costa Rica with a citizen for 2 years.
Person is a minor who is resident in Costa Rica and whose parent is acquiring citizenship. Acquisition can be revoked by the person after reaching the age of majority (until the age of 25).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a citizen by birth of Spain, a Central American country, or an Iberoamerican country, and been resident in Costa Rica for 5 years. Other conditions: see A06.

category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person is born abroad to a citizen who carries out an official mission in the service of Cuba.;
Person is born abroad to a citizen and citizen parent applies for citizenship on behalf of his/her child or person applies after reaching the age of majority. Application can be refused if person or his/her parent (if minor) has committed acts against the political, social and economic foundations of Cuba. A person born abroad whose parent also acquired citizenship on the basis of this provision can acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority if he/she demonstrates that he/she has established permanent ties and stable relations with Cuba for at least two years and passes a citizenship test, demonstrating that he/she has sufficient knowledge of the Spanish language and Cuban constitutional regulations, the country's administrative and social organisation, citizen's rights and duties, the country's history, geography and national events.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Cuba. Unless parents are foreign diplomats or employees of an international organization.
Person has been resident in Cuba for 5 years and knows the Spanish language. Note: in practice naturalisation is very rare and only occurs in exceptional cases.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Cuba for 5 years.

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and the union either resulted in offspring or the person has been resident in Cuba for 2 years uninterrupted since the marriage was celebrated. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country.
Person is a minor born abroad whose parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship due to acquisition of another citizenship or holding dual citizenship and establishes residence in Cuba. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born on or after 16 August 1960 in Cyprus to a citizen o  to parents entitled to citizenship (in case of death).

Person is born on or after 16 August 1960 abroad to a citizen or to parents entitled to citizenship (in case of death). If person is permanently resident abroad, the birth must also be registered in Cyprus.
Person's descent from a citizen of Cyprus is established through a judicial decision.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person was resident in Cyprus for a total period of 5 years within a period of 7 years, of which the year immediately prior to the submission of the application must be continuous. By way of exception, certain categories of persons (e.g. domestic workers, students) must have been resident in Cyprus for a total period of 7 years before the submission of the application, of which the last 12 months should be continuous. Other conditions: good character, intention to remain in Cyprus or at service of Cyprus, mental capacity written and published loyalty oath to the country.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person was resident in Cyprus for a total period of 5 years within a period of 7 years, of which the year immediately prior to the submission of the application must be continuous. By way of exception, certain categories of persons (e.g. domestic workers, students) must have been resident in Cyprus for a total period of 7 years before the submission of the application, of which the last 12 months should be continuous. Person must have intention to remain in Cyprus or at service of Cyprus.
Published loyalty oath to the country required.

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the spouse or widow(er) of a citizen,  and has resided in Cyprus, with common household for 3 years (i.e. cohabitation must not be less than 6 months per year and the aggregate of cohabiting years must not be less than 2 years in total within the 3-year period). Other conditions: good character, mental capacity, intention to continue to reside in Cyprus. Minister may reduce residence and cohabitation requirements but not below 2 years.
Person is a minor child of a parent or guardian who is a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor
