Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is the spouse or widower or widow of a citizen, or was the spouse of a person who, if he or she had not passed away, would have become or would have been
Person is a former citizen who previously renounced citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen of the United Kingdom and Colonies or a citizen of a commonwealth country, is of Cypriot descent (i.e. person is born in Cyprus to parents residing there at the time of birth) and has been resident or resided at any point in Cyprus for at least 12 consecutive months. Periods shorter than 12 months are accepted if deemed appropriate to the Minister, or if the person is employed in the civil service of Cyprus, is of good character and will continue to reside in Cyprus or be employed in the civil service of Cyprus.
Person has performed special services to Cyprus for reasons of public interest. No required period of residence. Other conditions: declaration of faith.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has donated 75.000 euro to the Research and Innovation Fund and 75.000 euro to the Cyprus Land Development Corporation and invested 2 million euro in real estate, land development or infrastructure, a Cypriot company or business, or a (Registered) Alternative Investment Fund or a company or organisation that is licensed by the Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission. Other conditions: clean criminal record, Schengen visa, Cypriot residence permit, own real estate (min. 0.5 million euro).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in the Czech Republic to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is under the age of 3, found in the Czech Republic, and his/her identity cannot be established.

Person is born in the Czech Republic to parents who are both stateless, if at least one of them holds a residence permit (permitting stay longer than 90 days), and provided that the child would otherwise be stateless.;

Person is born in the Czech Republic, did not acquire the citizenship of either of his/her parents and would otherwise remain stateless, provided that at least one of the parents holds a residence permit at the time of the child's birth (permitting a stay longer than 90 days). Provision does not apply if parents can transmit their nationality by contacting the authorities of their home country but fail to do so.

Person is a minor and descent from a citizen is established by a court decision. Or paternity of a citizen has been established by parents through a joint declaration provided that the mother is not a citizen, but is a citizen of an EU country, Switzerland or an EEA country, or is a permanent resident in the Czech Republic or a stateless person (if the mother does not fall in any of these categories, the parents additionally have to prove paternity through a DNA test).;

Person is a minor whose descent has not been established through a DNA test. The declaration of paternity may not be made with the sole intent to acquire a resident status in the Czech Republic for the child and the mother or with the intent to abuse the Czech welfare system.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is born in the Czech Republic and holds a permanent residence permit. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement can be waived).
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in the Czech Republic for 5 years and has a permanent residence permit. Other conditions: clear criminal record, proficiency in language of the Czech Republic, civic knowledge test, integrated in society, no risk to security of the state, life, health or material values, fulfilment of obligations under immigration law and other laws (e.g. payment of health and social security insurance, taxes etc), proof of sufficient legal income and proof that he/she has not been a public burden during the last 3 years.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the Czech Republic for 5 years and has a permanent residence permit.
Proficiency in language of the Czech Republic.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Civic knowledge test and integration in society.
Clear criminal record, no risk to security of the state, life, health or material values.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Fulfilment of obligations under immigration law and other laws (e.g. payment of health and social security insurance, taxes etc), proof of sufficient legal income and proof that he/she has not been a public burden during the last 3 years.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has permanent resident status and has had actual stay in the Czech Republic from the age of 10 to the moment of lodging the declaration for at least 2/3 of the period. Other conditions: clean criminal record and declaration must be lodged with 3 years of reaching the age of majority.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is the spouse or registered partner of a citizen with common household.
Person is the child of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement can be waived). Other conditions can be waived at the discretion of the authorities if the child is a minor.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor, adopted by citizen of the Czech Republic, and the adoption was decided by the Czech authorities. If the adoption took effect through the decision of a foreign authority, citizenship is acquired upon the recognition of the foreign adoption.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification:
Person is a direct descendant of a person who was a Czechoslovak citizen as of 31 December 1992, but was neither a citizen of the Czech Republic nor a citizen of the Slovak Republic.; Person whose at least one parent or one grandparent is or was a former Czechoslovak or Czech citizen provided that  the person is not a Slovak citizen on the date of the declaration. 
The provision covers only children and grandchildren of former citizens defined in Section 31(1) See A 16 bellow. (CZE31(3))
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Spouses can submit a joint application for naturalisation. Other conditions: see A06 (both spouses must meet the conditions).

Person is a minor whose parents are jointly acquiring citizenship and include the child in their application. If only one parent applies for citizenship, the other parent's approval for including the child in the application is required. Consent is required if the child is over the age of 15.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost Czech or Czechoslovak citizenship prior to 1 January 2014. Excluded are those who lost Czechoslovak citizenship under the President Constitutional Decree No. 33/1945 Coll., under the Treaty between Czechoslovakia and the Soviet Union  (No. 186/1946 Coll.) and those who as of 1 January 1969 became citizens of the Slovak Republic or acquired the citizenship of the Slovak Republic after 1 January 1969 provided they are still Slovak citizens. Or the person is a former Czechoslovak citizen who had resided in the territory of the Czech Republic before emigrating abroad, provided that he/she is not a citizen of the Slovak Republic. Or the person was a Czechoslovak citizen as of 31 December 1992, but was neither a citizen of the Czech Republic nor a citizen of the Slovak Republic (persons who are Slovak citizens are excluded).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen of an EU country, Switzerland or an EEA country, has been resident in the Czech Republic for 3 years and has a permanent residence permit. Other conditions: see A06.
Person was wrongly issued a citizenship certificate but he/she was in a good faith and the certificate was not repealed within 10 years of its issuance.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person was granted asylum and holds a permanent residence permit.  Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement can be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is stateless and holds a permanent residence permit. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement can be waived).

Person whose naturalisation would be a great benefit to the Czech Republic in the fields of science, education, culture, sports, or if it serves to implement the international commitments of the Czech Republic, humanitarian purposes, or another state interest. Other conditions: permanent residence and clean criminal record.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Germany to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to a citizen.;
Person is born abroad to a citizen who was born abroad after December 31, 1999 and is resident abroad (by registration within one year of person's birth).
Person is born in Germany to a citizen of another country who has been resident in Germany for 8 years, or to a citizen of Switzerland who holds a permanent residence permit.
Person is found in Germany of unknown parentage.
Person is under 21 years of age, stateless since birth, lawfully and habitually resident in Germany for five years, and not convicted for a crime which carries a prison sentence of 5 years or more.

Person is under 23 years of age, born out of wedlock to a male citizen who recognises the person or whose paternity is legally established.; 
Person is under 23 years of age, born out of wedlock to a male citizen and a female citizen of another country before July 1, 1993, and has been resident in Germany for 3 years.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

article: GER 10-12, 37, GER 8 in conjuction with 8.1.1. and 8.1.2. administrative regulation
specification: Person is over the age of 16, has been resident in Germany for 8 years and is entitled to permanent residence (without permanent residence, naturalisation is not an entitlement, but can be acquired on a discretionary basis). Other conditions: express commitment to the Constitution (declaration of loyalty), no activities hostile to the Constitution, ability to support oneself and one's family without social security or unemployment benefit, no criminal convictions (minor offenses excepted), renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country (unless this is legally impossible or unreasonable or if person is a citizen of an EU Member State or Switzerland). Proficiency in German language and knowledge of the German legal and societal system required (if person naturalises on a discretionary basis, he/she has to be integrated into German living conditions and naturalisation by discretion (<a4> 8 StAG) can only take place if identity and nationality of the applicant are settled).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

article: GER 10-12, 37, GER 8 in conjuction with 8.1.1. and 8.1.2. administrative regulation
specification: Person is over the age of 16, has been resident in Germany for 8 years and is entitled to permanent residence (without permanent residence, naturalisation is not an entitlement, but can be acquired on a discretionary basis).

article: GER 10-12, 37, GER 8 in conjuction with 8.1.1. and 8.1.2. administrative regulation
specification: Renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country (unless this is legally impossible or unreasonable or if person is a citizen of an EU Member State or Switzerland).

article: GER 10-12, 37, GER 8 in conjuction with 8.1.1. and 8.1.2. administrative regulation
specification: Proficiency in German language required (if person naturalises on a discretionary basis, he/she has to be integrated into German living conditions and naturalisation by discretion (<a4> 8 StAG) can only take place if identity and nationality of the applicant are settled).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

article: GER 10-12, 37, GER 8 in conjuction with 8.1.1. and 8.1.2. administrative regulation
specification: Express commitment to the Constitution (declaration of loyalty), knowledge of the German legal and societal system required (if person naturalises on a discretionary basis, he/she has to be integrated into German living conditions and naturalisation by discretion (<a4> 8 StAG) can only take place if identity and nationality of the applicant are settled).

article: GER 10-12, 37, GER 8 in conjuction with 8.1.1. and 8.1.2. administrative regulation
specification: No activities hostile to the Constitution, person may not have been convicted for certain crimes (minor offenses excepted).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

article: GER 10-12, 37, GER 8 in conjuction with 8.1.1. and 8.1.2. administrative regulation
specification: Person must have the ability to support oneself and one's family without social security or unemployment benefit.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has resided in Germany, with common household, for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person descends from a former citizen and is resident abroad. Other condition: no reason for expulsion.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of someone who acquires citizenship by naturalisation. Person must be entitled to permanent residence. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is the minor child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Child must be entitled to permanent residence. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who is resident abroad. Other conditions: no reason for expulsion, entitlement to naturalisation if person is a former citizen who lost citizenship between 1933 and 1945. Acquisition extends to descendants.
Person is a citizen of an EU Member State or Switzerland has been resident in Germany for 8 years. Exemption from renunciation requirement. Other conditions: see A06.

article: GER 7; GER 8, Art. 9(1) StAngRegG; Art. 9(2), 11 StAngRegG
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: GER 8 in conjunction with 8.1.3.8. administrative regulation
specification: Person is not able to prove his or her German citizenship but was until now treated as a citizen by the German authorities.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: GER 8 in conjunction with administrative regulations, 12.1.6
specification: Person is a recognised refugee who has been resident in Germany for 8 years. Exemption from renunciation requirement. Other conditions: see A06
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: GER 8 in conjunction with administrative regulations, 8.1.3.1.
specification: Person is stateless and has been legally and habitually resident in Germany for 6 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation requirement).

Person has been resident in Germany for 3 years and his or her acquisition of citizenship is in the special interest of the country, e.g. in the field of science, research, trade and industry, arts, culture, media, sports or public service. Other conditions: see A06
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: GER 8 in conjunction with administrative regulations, 8.1.3.5.
specification: Person has been resident in Germany for 3 years, active in the German public service and his or her acquisition of citizenship is in the special interest of Germany. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person is born in Djibouti to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Djibouti to unknown parents.

Person has been habitually resident in Djibouti for at least 10 years. Other conditions: good character, good health, assimilation demonstrated by one of the languages used in Djibouti, no convictions for crime against state security, no convictions for various other offences (including related to fraud) and sentenced to more than 6 months imprisonment, not subject to expulsion or house arrest.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Djibouti for at least 10 years.
Assimilation demonstrated by one of the languages used in Djibouti,
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person is of good character, no convictions for crime against state security, no convictions for crime against state security, no convictions for various other offences (including related to fraud) and sentenced to more than 6 months imprisonment, not subject to expulsion or house arrest.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is married to a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period is reduced to 5 years if there are children of the marriage).
Person is the minor child of married parents who are naturalising.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person has rendered or could render important services to Djibouti. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence period is reduced to 5 years).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen who was either born in Dominica or who was a recognised UK and Colonies citizen prior to Independence.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Dominica. Unless born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.

Person is under 18 years old and has been recognised as a citizen's child 'in a manner recognised by law,' and has resided for at least 3 years in Dominica (unless the Minister waives the residency requirement).
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has been resident in Dominica for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in Dominica, in the service of the government, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 7 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, intent to reside in Dominica or to continue government service, and oath of allegiance. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Dominica for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in Dominica, in the service of the government, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 7 years predating the 12-month period.

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Adequate knowledge of the duties of a citizen.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen or was married to a citizen who has since passed. Or person has been resident in Dominica, or in the service of the government, or had partly such residence and partly such service, for 3 years immediately prior to the application. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, intent to reside in Dominica or to continue government service, and oath of allegiance.
Person is the child of a citizen. Other conditions: must have resided in Dominica for at least 3 years preceding date of application. Oath of allegiance. Section 100(1)c of Constitution cannot apply.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification:
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen born in Dominica.;



Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen but does not acquire citizenship automatically [under Const 100(1)c in conjunction with DOM 5]. Other conditions: 3 years' residence in Dominica and oath of loyalty. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the parent or grandparent of the main citizenship by investment applicant. Other conditions: person is over 65 years, lives with, and is fully dependent on the main applicant.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to relatives in ascending and descending line)

article: Const 100(1)c, 102(3) and DOM 6(1)b and 7, DOM 6(1)a and 7
specification: Person is the child (biological, step or adopted) of a deceased citizen. Other conditions: under 18 years old, has resided at least 3 years in Dominica, and oath of allegiance. Or person is the spouse of a deceased citizen. Other conditions: person must be of full age, capacity and good character, have adequate knowledge of citizenship responsibilities and of English, have resided in Dominica or partly resided and partly been in government service for at least 3 years preceding date of application, and intends to continue to reside in Dominica or to work for the government. Oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Must be the child or dependent of a person who acquires Dominican citizenship via the Citizenship by Investment program. Child must be under age 18 or, if older than 18, be physically or mentally challenged or enrolled in an institution of higher learning, or in the case of a female child under the age of 25, unmarried and living with the CBI parent. Other condition: fee must be paid.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a former citizen who was born in Dominica and had to renounce citizenship in order to acquire or retain citizenship of another country. Citizenship Act stipulates the person must satisfy the Minister that s/he had to renounce Dominican citizenship to remain or become a citizen of another country. Citizenship Act also states that those who have 'qualifying' connections with Dominica (were born there, or were previously citizens through naturalisation or registration), or were married to a Dominica, can reapply for citizenship. Other conditions: oath of loyalty, must be at least 18 years of age.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification:
Person is a Commonwealth citizen and has been resident in Dominica for 7 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: oath of loyalty.;
Person is a Commonwealth citizen and has been resident in Dominica, or in the service of the government, or had partly such residence and partly such service, for 5 years immediately prior to the application. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, intent to reside in Dominica or to continue government service, and oath of allegiance.

Person is at least 18 years old, has either been in government service, or partly in government service and partly in residence for at least 3 years preceding date of application (and has intent to continue to reside or to be in government service). If a Commonwealth citizen, five years service required. Minister may waive requirements. Other conditions: knowledge of citizenship responsibilities and the English language. Oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person must be at least 18 years of age, undergo an interview, and have invested in real estate, an 'Approved [development] Project', or made a direct monetary investment into the country. If a person provides false information, has a criminal record other than a minor offence, is the subject of a criminal investigation, is a security risk to Dominica or has been involved in any activity likely to bring disrepute to Dominica, then that person's application is automatically denied. Approved real estate or other development project must have been owned or in operation for at least 3 years.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Denmark to a citizen (father, mother or co-mother).
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Denmark of unknown parentage.

Person is a stateless minor who lawfully resides in Denmark. No further requirements. Additional conditions for persons between the age of 18-21: s/he must have resided habitually in the country for 5 years immediately preceding the application (or 8 years in total), not been sentenced for any offence carrying a sentence of five years or more, and not been convicted for offences against national security.

Person is an unmarried minor whose father is a citizen who marries the person's mother.;

Person is an unmarried minor who is born abroad and out of wedlock to a father who is a citizen. No other conditions.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has been resident in Denmark for 9 years with a permanent residence permit at the time of application. Other conditions: self-support (meaning no receipt of social assistance within the last 2 year before the application and not more than 4 months receipt of social assistance within the last 5 years), no due debts to the state, no criminal indictments or convictions, language certification, knowledge of society (citizenship test), and oath of loyalty to society, laws and legal principles of Denmark plus obligatory participation in a citizenship ceremony following the Parliament's adoption of the naturalisation act.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Denmark for 9 years with a permanent residence permit at the time of application.

category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Knowledge of society (citizenship test), and oath of loyalty to society, laws and legal principles of Denmark plus obligatory participation in a citizenship ceremony following the Parliament's adoption of the naturalisation act.

category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Self-support (meaning no receipt of social assistance within the last 2 year before the application and not more than 4 months receipt of social assistance within the last 5 years), no due debts to the state.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person residing in Denmark from the age of 15 may naturalise at the age of 18. If educated in Denmark, the education must be of Danish character. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for 3 years (and the spouse has been citizen for 3 years), with common household, and has been resident in Denmark for 6 years (if 2 years marriage: 7 years residence, if 1 year marriage: 8 years residence). Other conditions: see mode A06.

Person is under the age of 12 and is adopted by a citizen.;
Person is 12 years or older and is adopted by a citizen. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person entered Denmark before the age of 20, is the child of a person who was a citizen by birth, has turned 18 at the time of application, and resided in Denmark for 2 years. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person is an unmarried minor who is resident in Denmark and whose parent (with custody) is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: no criminal record.;
Parent is a citizen of a Nordic country or a former citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

article:
DEN 4, Sect. 3 in law 1496 of 23-dec-14 (dual citizenship);
DEN 6
specification:
Person is a former citizen by birth who resided in Denmark until the age of 18, and who has resided there for 2 years immediately before submitting the declaration.; exemption from the 2 years residence requirement for former citizens with Nordic citizenship. Or person is a former citizen and lost Danish citizenship by acquisition of another citizenship: if no criminal record, reacquisition by declaration until 31 August 2020.;
Person is a former citizen by birth (Danish born and both parents were citizens or, if only one citizen parent, person was raised by that parent until the age of 18) resided in Denmark until the age of 12 and has been resident in Denmark for 1 year. Other conditions: see mode A06. Person is a former citizen, but not 'Danish born'. The applicant may be exempted from residence requirements. Other conditions: see mode 06.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification:
Person is a citizen of a Nordic country, under the age of 23 and resident in Denmark for 10 years in total, of which 5 within the last 6 years, or person is a citizen of a Nordic country who acquired citizenship of a Nordic country other than by naturalisation and has been resident in Denmark for 7 years immediately before the application. Other conditions: no criminal convictions, no court decisions about other legal consequences of a punishable act, no indictments.;
Person has been resident in Denmark for 2 years. No need to document knowledge of language and culture of Denmark if the person has completed elementary schooling in Norway or Sweden. Other conditions: see mode A06.

Person born in South Schleswig, has been resident in Denmark for 2 years, attended school there and demonstrates affinity with Danish society. Other conditions: see mode A06. Person born or raised in South Schleswig who has attended Danish school or fulfils general language requirements may naturalise without residence  in Denmark, if said person fulfil one of the following three conditions: has at least one Danish ancestor by birth within 4 former generations, has formerly resided in Denmark for 3 years (or possibly, in another Nordic country) or has demonstrated active citizenship for at least 10 years in organisations of the Danish minority.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person who in good faith who mistakenly has been issued a Danish passport or registered as a Danish citizens in the CPR-register may receive dispensation to naturalise.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee (or has a similar status) and has been resident in Denmark for 8 years. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a stateless person and has been resident in Denmark for 8 years. Other conditions: see mode A06.
Person is born in the DR to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen. If person also obtains another citizenship at birth, citizenship can either be retained or renounced by declaration when he/she reaches the age of majority.
Person is born in the DR. Unless born to foreign diplomats, foreigners 'in transit', and those residing illegally in the country.

Person has been resident in the DR for at least 2 years uninterrupted. Age at which naturalisation can be requested can be lowered from 18 to 16 if the person is married or authorized by his/her parents/legal representative.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the DR for at least 2 years uninterrupted.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Person is the male spouse of a female citizen and has been resident in the country for at least 6 months uninterrupted (no requirement of common household during that period). The female spouse of a male citizen is exempt from the residence requirement.
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen. Person can definitively opt for Dominican citizenship within 2 years after reaching the age of majority. No further requirements.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the female spouse of a man who acquires citizenship by naturalisation. No further requirements apart from presence in the country at the time of the application.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (with residence requirement)

specification:
Person is the minor, unmarried and legitimate or recognised child of a male parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation.  Citizenship can be renounced after reaching the age of majority (time limit: 1 year). The provision applies to children of a female parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation only if the father is unknown or if the mother is their legal guardian.;

Person is the adult child of a father who acquires citizenship by naturalisation, has been resident in the DR for 1 year and submits his/her request together with that of the mother.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is, with exemption from all ordinary naturalisation requirements, granted citizenship by the President for having rendered eminent services to the country or to humanity in general. Maximum of 5 persons per year to which this form of citizenship can be granted.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been resident in the DR for 6 months and rendered technical or special services to the country's armed forces. No further requirements.

Person has been resident in the DR for at least 6 months uninterrupted, and has founded urban or rural industries or owns real estate in the country. No residence requirement if person owns more than 30 hectares of land in the country, but permission must be granted to establish domicile in the country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Algeria to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person born in Algeria to unknown parents.

Person has lived in the country for a minimum of 7 years directly preceding the application. Other conditions: integrated in the Algerian society., receive an income, be of good character, not have been condemned to any sentence that involves the loss of civil rights, be of sound mind and body.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has lived in the country for a minimum of 7 years directly preceding the application.
Person must be integrated in the Algerian society.
Person must be integrated in the Algerian society.
Person must be of good character, not have been condemned to any sentence that involves the loss of civil rights.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Receive an income, be of sound mind and body.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen. Other conditions: has been married for 3 years and resident for 2 years, good behavior, and a sufficient income.
category: Group restriction: only if spouse of a citizen is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is the child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Child acquires the citizenship at the same time as the parent.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Re-establishment of Algerian citizenship may be granted by decree to any person who, having possessed this citizenship by origin and having lost it, applies for re-establishment after at least 18 months of habitual and regular residence in Algeria.
Person has rendered exceptional services to Algeria, has contracted infirmity or illness in the service or in the interest of Algeria, or his/her naturalization is of exceptional interest to Algeria.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person (and his/her descendants up to the third degree) is born abroad to a citizen who was born in Ecuador.;
Person is a minor and born abroad to a citizen by naturalisation.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person has been resident in Ecuador for at least 3 years. Other conditions: full capacity, ability to support oneself as well as family, knowledge of the national symbols, and no convictions for a crime as established in the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court or a crime that is punishable under Ecuadorian law with a prison sentence of five years or more.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Ecuador for at least 3 years.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: No convictions for a crime as established in the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court or a crime that is punishable under Ecuadorian law with a prison sentence of five years or more.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Ability to support oneself as well as family.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen or is in a factual relationship with a citizen. Residence requirement is reduced to 2 years. Other requirements: see A06.
Person is a minor adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship and has parental authority over the child (the opinion of children and adolescents shall be heard).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person belongs to a community, people or nationality (in an ethnic sense) recognised by Ecuador and present in the border region.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has performed special services to Ecuador and has regularly resided in Ecuador for at least one year.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Egypt after entry into force of the law to a citizen.; Person is born in Egypt before entry into force of the law to a citizen and declares wish for Egyptian citizenship.
Person is born abroad after entry into force of the law to a citizen.

Person is born in Egypt of unknown parents. Foundling in Egypt shall be considered born there unless otherwise established. If a declaration is made to renounce Egyptian citizenship when another citizenship is established during childhood (mode L14), the person may reacquire citizenship by declaration within 1 year after reaching the age of majority.
Person is born in Egypt, ordinarily resident there, and applies within 1 year of reaching the age of majority. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in Egypt for 10 years. Other conditions: mental health, no disability making a burden on society, good conduct and reputation, no criminal penalty restricting freedom for a crime of honour, acquainted with Arabic language, legal means of earning a living.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Egypt for 10 years.
Person must be acquainted with Arabic language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Good conduct and reputation required, no criminal penalty restricting freedom for a crime of honour.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Good mental health, no disability making a burden on society
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen, notifies the minister of interior of wish to acquire citizenship, and the marriage lasts for at least 2 years thereafter (unless terminated by husband's death). Minister may oppose during the 2 year period.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is a woman married to a man who is acquiring Egyptian citizenship and notifies the minister of interior on same terms as for mode A08.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of a father who is acquiring citizenship, unless normal residence is abroad and he/she retains the original citizenship of the father by the law of that country.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost or was deprived of citizenship and 5 years have elapsed since that event.; Person lost citizenship during childhood because the father changed citizenship and the person elects to reacquire citizenship within 1 year of reaching the age of majority.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in Egypt to a father of Egyptian origin, is ordinarily resident in Egypt, and is now an adult.; Person is of Egyptian origin, has been ordinarily resident for 5 years, and is now an adult.; Person is born in Egypt to a foreign father also born there, his father belongs to the majority of inhabitants in a country whose language is Arabic or religion is Islam, and the person applies within 1 year of reaching the age of majority.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a foreigner who has rendered honourable services to Egypt or to the Egyptian religious sects.; person is a foreigner who has resided in Egypt for five consecutive years in accordance with Art. 20bis of Law No. 89 of 1960 regarding the entry and residence of foreigners in the Republic of Egypt  ('deposit residency' category).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Eritrea to a father or mother of 'Eritrean origin' (tracing ancestry to a person resident in Eritrea in 1933). Person is born of an Eritrean father or mother.
Person is born abroad to a father or mother of 'Eritrean origin' (tracing ancestry to a person resident in Eritrea in 1933). Person is born of an Eritrean father or mother.
Person is born in Eritrea to unknown parents.

Person is not of 'Eritrean origin' and has been legally resident in Eritrea for at least 10 years before 1974 or at least 20 years while making visits abroad. Other conditions: high integrity and not convicted of any crime, understands and speaks one of languages of Eritrea, free of any mental or physical handicap, will not become a burden on Eritrean society and can provide for own and family's needs, has renounced citizenship of any other country, will be permanently domiciled in Eritrea, has not committed anti-people acts during the Eritrean liberation struggle.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person is not of 'Eritrean origin' and has been legally resident in Eritrea for at least 10 years before 1974 or at least 20 years while making visits abroad.
category: More than 10 years of residence required

specification: Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Person understands and speaks one of languages of Eritrea.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: High integrity and not convicted of any crime required, may not have not committed anti-people acts during the Eritrean liberation struggle.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Free of any mental or physical handicap, will not become a burden on Eritrean society and can provide for own and family's needs.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is legally married to an Eritrean citizen. Other conditions: person has lived in Eritrea with the spouse for at least 3 years, has renounced other citizenship, and signs oath of allegiance.
Person is legally adopted by an Eritrean citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation and the name of the child is included in the application.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is born to a citizen.
Person is born to a citizen.
Person is born in Spain to a person who was also born there.
Person is found in Spain of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Spain to a stateless person, or would otherwise be stateless.

Person's descent from a citizen was established while the person is an adult. Declaration must be made within two years after establishment. Other conditions: loyalty to the head of state and obedience to the constitution and the laws of Spain, and renunciation of another citizenship (except for citizens of Latin American countries, Andorra, Philippines, Equatorial Guinea or Portugal).
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person (minor or adult) is born in Spain and has been resident there for 1 year. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in Spain for 10 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: good civic conduct, adequate social integration (by means of language and civic tests), oath of loyalty to the King and obedience to the constitution and the laws, renunciation of another citizenship (except for citizens of Latin American countries, Andorra, Philippines, Equatorial Guinea, Portugal and Sephardic Jews originally from Spain) and inscription in the Civil Registry. Denial of citizenship must be based on reasons of public order and national interest.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Spain for 10 years immediately prior to the application.
Oath of renunciation of another citizenship (except for citizens of Latin American countries, Andorra, Philippines, Equatorial Guinea, Portugal and Sephardic Jews originally from Spain) required.
Adequate social integration (by means of language and civic tests) required.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Adequate social integration (by means of language and civic tests) required.
Good civic conduct required.  Denial of citizenship must be based on reasons of public order and national interest.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has been married and resident in Spain for 1 year immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: see mode A06 (except renunciation requirement).

category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a minor born in Spain to a former citizen. Other conditions: see mode A06
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a widow or widower of a citizen, or is a child or grandchild who is born abroad to a former citizen and has been resident in Spain for 1 year. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is a former citizen 'by origin' and resident in Spain. Retention of another citizenship is allowed and exemptions to legal residence include emigrants and their children and others for whom the Ministry of Justice decides in exceptional circumstances.

Person is a citizen of a Latin American country, Andorra, Philippines, Equatorial Guinea or Portugal and has been resident in Spain for 2 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: see mode A06 (except renunciation requirement).
Person is a Sephardic Jew who has been resident in Spain for 2 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: see mode A06 (except renunciation requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has held and uninterruptedly used citizenship for 10 year in good faith and the title was inscribed in the Civil Registry.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee who has been resident in Spain for 5 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: see mode A06 (except renunciation requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Estonia to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Estonia of unknown parentage.

Child must be born and permanently resident in Estonia after 26 February 1992 (or before August 20, 1991 as citizen of the USSR) and 'not deemed by any State to be citizens of that State on the basis of any Act in force'. Child under 15 must be born and permanently resident in Estonia. Parents must have been legally resident in Estonia for 5 years and are 'not deemed by any State to be citizens of that State on the basis of any Act in force' (including citizens of the USSR before August 20, 1991). Until the age of 1 (or until 1 Jan 2017), an application can be submitted by the child's parents (or single or adoptive parent) if they do not want Estonian citizenship for their child.

Person has been resident in Estonia for 8 years, of which the last 5 years permanently. Other conditions: permanent legal income, knowledge of the language of Estonia, knowledge of the Constitution and the Citizenship Act (citizenship test), loyalty to the country, and renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Estonia for 8 years, of which the last 5 years permanently.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Knowledge of the language of Estonia required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of the Constitution and the Citizenship Act (citizenship test), loyalty to the country required.

category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor under the age of 15 whose parents are citizens who apply for naturalisation of the child (or the child's single parent who is a citizen applies for naturalisation). If only one parent is a citizen, the parent who is not a citizen must officially agree.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen. Renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor under the age of 15, resident in Estonia and mentioned in the parent's application for citizenship (consent needed from the other parent). Other condition: renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person has lost citizenship as a minor and is resident in Estonia. Other condition: renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person was issued with a passport of Estonia without legal basis or was erroneously defined as a citizen as a result of the grant or recognition of citizenship other than as a result of falsified documents or false information provided by the person.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has special merits in the area of science, culture, sports or in other areas. Conditions under A06 may be waived. Applies to a maximum of 10 persons per year.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Ethiopia to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Ethiopia as an abandoned infant.

Person has been domiciled in Ethiopia for at least 4 years. Other conditions: able to communicate in any of national languages, sufficient lawful source of income, good character, no criminal convictions, renounce citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been domiciled in Ethiopia for at least 4 years.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Person must be able to communicate in any of national languages
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must be of good character, no criminal convictions.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Sufficient lawful source of income required.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is married to a citizen. Other conditions: marriage took place at least 2 years previously, person has lived in Ethiopia for at least 1 year, and renounces citizenship of another country.

Person is a child adopted by an Ethiopian citizen who lives in Ethiopia with the adopting parent, the other parent has expressed consent if a foreigner, and child renounces citizenship of another country.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship and the child is included in the application. Provided that the child also renounces citizenship of another country and the other parent consents if a foreigner.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who acquired another citizenship by law. Other conditions: returns to domicile in Ethiopia, renounces citizenship of another country.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has made an outstanding contribution in the interest of Ethiopia. Other conditions: see A06 (except that the person need not be domiciled in Ethiopia nor speak a national language).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Finland in wedlock to a citizen, or out of wedlock to a mother who is a citizen. If the child has two mothers under the Maternity Act (253/2018), provision regarding the mother applies to the mother who gave birth and provision regarding the father whose paternity is established applies to the mother whose maternity is established.
Person is born abroad and in wedlock to a citizen, or out of wedlock to a mother who is a citizen.
Person is found in Finland citizenship of a foreign State has not been established before the child reaches the age of 5.

Person is born in Finland is not able to acquire the citizenship of another country at birth. Or person is born in Finland to parents with unknown citizenship or out of wedlock to a mother with unknown citizenship and citizenship of another country has not been established before reaching the age of 5.;
Person is born in Finland to parents who have refugee status (or similar status) there and the person does not acquire citizenship of either parent except through registration of his/her birth with the state of citizenship of the parents or through another procedure requiring the assistance of the authorities of that country. Additional requirement in case only one parent has refugee status in Finland: the person does not acquire citizenship of the other parent by birth, nor has a secondary right through birth to acquire it.

category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is born in Finland, is an adult under the age of 23, and has had permanent residence in Finland for 6 years with the last 2 years uninterrupted. Residence in a Nordic country is equivalent to residence in Finland for the 5 years before the declaration was made to the extent that residence occurred before the age of 16. Person must not have been sentenced to imprisonment.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in Finland for 5 years uninterrupted, or 7 years since the age of 15 with the last 2 years uninterrupted. (In both cases the residence requirement can be shortened with 1 year if applicant meets language requirements.) Other conditions: Person's identity is established in the meaning of FIN 6. Person has not committed a punishable act (unless the punishment has been a summary penal fee) nor has a restraining order been issued against him/her, has not materially failed to provide maintenance or meet pecuniary obligations under public law, can provide a reliable account of livelihood, has satisfactory oral and written skills in the Finnish or Swedish language or similar skills in the Finnish or Finland-Swedish sign language (language skills requirement). Exceptions to these requirements are possible only on grounds that have explicitly been laid down in the Nationality Act. A person meeting these requirements will not be naturalised if there is a justified reason for suspecting that naturalising the person jeopardises the State's security or public order, or the main aim of naturalisation is to take advantage of a benefit related to Finnish citizenship without any purpose to reside in Finland, or if naturalisation is otherwise against the interest of the State for a weighty reason and in light of the overall consideration of the person's situation.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Finland for 5 years uninterrupted, or 7 years since the age of 15 with the last 2 years uninterrupted. (In both cases the residence requirement can be shortened with 1 year if applicant meets language requirements.) Section 18: Exceptions to the period of residence. Section 18a: Exceptions to the period of residence when the language requirement is fulfiled.

Person has satisfactory oral and written skills in the Finnish or Swedish language or similar skills in the Finnish or Finland-Swedish sign language (language skills requirement). Section 18b: Exceptions to the language requirement.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person has not committed a punishable act (unless the punishment has been a summary penal fee) nor has a restraining order been issued against him/her. A person meeting all requirements will not be naturalised if there is a justified reason for suspecting that naturalising the person jeopardises the State's security or public order, or the main aim of naturalisation is to take advantage of a benefit related to Finnish citizenship without any purpose to reside in Finland, or if naturalisation is otherwise against the interest of the State for a weighty reason and in light of the overall consideration of the person's situation. Section 19: Exceptions to the integrity requirement.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has not materially failed to provide maintenance or meet pecuniary obligations under public law, can provide a reliable account of livelihood.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is an adult under the age of 23 and has had permanent residence in Finland for 10 years, with the last 2 years uninterrupted. Residence in a Nordic country is equivalent to residence in Finland for the 5 years before the declaration was made to the extent that residence occurred before the age of 16. Person may not have been sentenced to imprisonment.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for 3 years, with common household (in case the citizen has died, the spouses must have lived together for 3 years before death), and has 4 years of permanent uninterrupted residence in Finland, or 6 years of permanent residence since the age of 15, with the last 2 years uninterrupted. (A spouse means the husband or wife of the citizen or a person cohabiting with the citizen in a relationship resembling marriage. Provisions on a spouse also apply to a registered partner.) Other conditions: see A06.

Person's parent or guardian is a citizen and makes an application on behalf of the minor person who lives with the parent or guardian. If these conditions are not met, naturalisation is possible on the basis of a weighty reason related to the best interests of the child. No further residence and language requirements if the child is under the age of 15 and permanently resident in Finland. If the child is 15, 16 or 17 years and permanently resident in Finland, he/she must have resided there for the last 4 years without interruption or a total of 6 years since the age of 7, with the last 2 years uninterrupted. 2 years of residence is sufficient if the child is a citizen of a Nordic country or a former Finnish citizen. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification:
Person is a minor under the age of 12 who is adopted by a citizen.;
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen after the age of 12.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification:
Person is the spouse of a deceased Finnish citizen and the spouses have lived together for the minimum of 3 years before death and the applicant has 4 years of permanent uninterrupted residence in Finland, or 6 years of permanent residence since the age of 15, with the last 2 years uninterrupted. (FIN 22) (A spouse means the husband or wife of the citizen or a person cohabiting with the citizen in a relationship resembling marriage. Provisions on a spouse also apply to a registered partner. (FIN 2(1)(8)).;
A child acquires Finnish citizenship by birth if the deceased father was Finnish citizen and married to the child's mother or the child is born in Finland the paternity of the deceased father, who was Finnish citizen, is established. What is said about the deceased father whose paternity is established also applies to a deceased mother whose maternity is established under the Maternity Act. (FIN 9(1)(3) and 9(3))
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is the spouse of a Finnish citizen and the spouses have lived together for a minimum of three years and the applicant has 4 years of permanent uninterrupted residence in Finland, or 6 years of permanent residence since the age of 15, with the last 2 years uninterrupted.

Person is a minor under the age of 15, resident in Finland, and co-applicant in the parent's application for naturalisation. No further residence or language requirements. Other conditions: see A06. If the child is 15, 16 or 17 years, he/she must have permanently resided in Finland for the last 4 years without interruption or a total of 6 years since the age of 7, with the last 2 years uninterrupted. Other conditions: see A06. A co-applicant is defined as a child that is under the applicant's custody and for whom the applicant is applying for Finnish citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: A former Finnish citizen who has not lost her/his citizenship on the basis of annulment of paternity (mode L13a) or annulment of established maternity (FIN 32) or false information (mode L09) (FIN 33) or on the grounds of a treason, high treason, or terrorism crime (FIN 33a) can reacquire Finnish citizenship by declaration.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification:
Person is a citizen of a Nordic country and has been permanently resident in Finland for the last 2 years without interruption. Other conditions: see A06.;
Finnish citizenship can be acquired by declaration if the person is a citizen of a Nordic country other than by naturalisation, has reached the age of 18 years, has been permanently residing in Finland for 5 years preceding application, and has not been sentenced to imprisonment during that time.

Person has, through no fault of his or her own, been considered a Finnish citizen for a minimum of 10 years as a result of such a mistake made by a Finnish public authority which has led to a serious consequence related to the rights and obligations of a Finnish citizen. In addition it is required that the person has strong ties to Finland on the basis of a long period of lawful residence in the country or for some other similar reason, and has been permanently resident in Finland for the last 2 years without interruption. Other conditions: see A06. See also A21.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has strong ties with Finland on the basis of a long period of lawful residence or for some other similar reason and has been permanently resident in the country for the last 2 years without interruption. In addition, one of the following three conditions must be fulfiled: i) it is unreasonably difficult to be engaged in permanent full-time work in Finland without citizenship, ii) person has, through no fault of his or her own, been considered a Finnish citizen for a minimum of 10 years as a result of such a mistake made by a Finnish public authority which has led to a serious consequence related to the rights and obligations of a Finnish citizen (see A20), or iii) there is otherwise special and weighty reason. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee, has a residence permit based on the need of secondary protection or humanitarian protection, and has been permanently resident in Finland for the last 4 years without interruption, or for a total of 6 years since the age of 15, with the last 2 years uninterrupted. (FIN 20) Other conditions: see A06. Exceptions to the language requirement for naturalisation are possible if the person is 65 or older and has a refugee status, or a status as a recipient of secondary protection, or a residence permit based on the need of humanitarian protection. (FIN 18b(1)(2))
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is involuntarily stateless and has been permanently resident in Finland for the last 4 years without interruption, or for a total of 6 years since the age of 15, with the last 2 years uninterrupted. Other conditions: see A06.
One or both parents must be a citizen. Excludes child born in Fiji to diplomat.
One or both parents must be a citizen. If application for registration is made after child is 18, residence in Fiji for 3 of 5 preceding years also required.
Requirements: Presence in Fiji for 5 of preceding 10 years, oath of allegiance. Criteria: good character, knowledge of language, intention to reside in Fiji.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Presence in Fiji for 5 of preceding 10 years, intention to reside in Fiji.

category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: For an adult married to a citizen. Person must also have present in Fiji for 3 of 5 preceding years.

Child under 18 when either parent became a citizen can become a citizen by registration. If an application for citizenship is made after child is 18, residence in Fiji for 3 of 5 preceding years also required.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: If application for registration is made after child is 18, residence in Fiji for 3 of 5 preceding years required.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

article: Constitution of Fiji 2013 s 5(4), Citizenship of Fiji Act 2009 s 8(6)
specification: Former citizen of Fiji who lost citizenship upon acquisition of foreign citizenship can regain Fiji citizenship (Constitution 2013 s 5(4)). An application for citizenship made by former citizen must be granted, save that the Minister can refuse the application if Minister not satisfied the person is of good character (Citizenship Act 2009 s 8(6).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in France to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in France to a person who was also born there.
Person is found in France of unknown parentage.
Person is born to stateless parents or to foreign parents and is not entitled to citizenship of another country.

category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in France for 5 years. (Residence requirement may be waived for certain categories including refugees.) Other conditions: good character, no criminal convictions of a certain kind, assimilation (especially language skills and knowledge of the rights and duties attached to French citizenship).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in France for 5 years. (Residence requirement may be waived for certain categories including refugees.
Assimilation required (especially language skills and knowledge of the rights and duties attached to French citizenship).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Assimilation required (especially language skills and knowledge of the rights and duties attached to French citizenship).
Good character required, no criminal convictions of a certain kind.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification:
Person is a minor who has been raised in France for 5 years by a citizen or for 3 years by a French welfare institution, or has received a French education for 5 years.;
Person is habitually residing in France since his or her sixth birthday, has attended school (under state control), and has a brother or a sister who has acquired French citizenship by virtue of art. 21-7 or 21-11 of the Civil Code. Acquisition by declaration at the age of majority (18).
category: Generally applicable provision (based on period of residence or schooling in country)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for 4 years, with common household, and has been resident in France for 3 years (5 years of marriage is required if person has less than 3 years of residence in France). No criminal record of a certain kind and no 'unworthiness' or 'assimilation defects'.

Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.;
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen by means of a 'simple adoption'.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is aged 65 at least, lawfully and habitually residing for more than 25 years in France, and parent of a French citizen
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is a minor and resident with a parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation, reintegration or declaration.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
Person (minor or adult) is a former citizen. Other conditions: see A06.;

Person lost citizenship by acquiring citizenship of another country (through marriage or naturalisation) or because of continued residence abroad, but maintained cultural, professional, economic or familial links with France or served in the French army, has not committed certain crimes and there is no expulsion order or a ban of residence. Or person is a former member of Parliament, Commonwealth Assembly or the Economic Council of France and establishes residence in France.

Person is a citizen of a country that recognises the French language as an official language, or speaks the French language as mother tongue, or received primary education in France. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been presumed to be a citizen for 10 years.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a refugee and resident in France. No further residence requirements. Other conditions: see A06. Political refugees can be exempted from language requirement if they have resided lawfully and habitually in the country for 15 years and are over 70.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a stateless person over the age of 70 and has been resident in France for 15 years. No further language requirements. Other conditions: see A06.

Person is someone with exceptional services for France or a case of special public interest, has rendered or could render importance services for France because of her/his capabilities and talents, or is of French background and contributes to the reputation of France and its international economic relations with her/his high skills. Residence requirement varies (maximum 2 years). Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has accomplished military service in the French army or was wounded while in service of and in operational engagement for the French army. No residence requirements. Other conditions: see A06.
Citizen and national by birth if one or both parents are citizens of FSM.
Citizen and national by birth if one or both parents are citizens of FSM.

Naturalisation of spouse of a citizen of FSM. Other criteria: residence in FSM for at least 5 years, renunciation of foreign citizenship, competence in at least one indigenous language, not convicted of a felony. Naturalisation is by the President, on Congress<d5> recommendation.

A <d4>child of a citizen<d5> may apply for naturalization. Other criteria include residence in FSM for at least 5 years, renounces foreign citizenship, competence in at least one indigenous language, not convicted of a felony.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: A <d4>national<d5> (a person born of parents one or both of whom are citizens, but who lost citizenship through failure to renounce foreign citizenship) may apply for naturalization. Other criteria include residence in FSM for at least 5 years, renounces foreign citizenship, competence in at least one indigenous language, not convicted of a felony.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in Gabon to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Gabon to a parent who was also born there or, if born out of wedlock, when the parent whose parentage is first established was also born there.
Person is born in Gabon to unknown parents. A newborn infant found in Gabon is presumed born in Gabon until proved otherwise.
Person is born in Gabon to stateless parents.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born in Gabon to foreign parents and has been resident for at least 5 consecutive years. Other conditions: declaration within 12 months preceding majority.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in Gabon for at least 5 years. Other conditions: aged at least 21 years, good character, does not have a serious physical or mental incapacity not incurred for the benefit of Gabon or a Gabonese citizen, and no criminal convictions.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Gabon for at least 5 years.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Good character required, person may not have criminal convictions.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person does not have a serious physical or mental incapacity not incurred for the benefit of Gabon or a Gabonese citizen.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been received in Gabon before the age of 15 years and brought up by a Gabonese citizen or by the public authorities.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person has been married to a Gabonese citizen for at least 3 years.  Government may oppose acquisition during the 6 months following the acquisition.
Person is a child adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the spouse of someone who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement may be waived).
Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring or re-acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost Gabonese citizenship as a result of a decision made in his or her name while still a child.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds
