specification: Person has rendered or is capable of rendering exceptional services to Gabon.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in the UK to a citizen.

Automatic acquisition of British citizenship by descent if person is born abroad to a citizen who acquired citizenship otherwise than by descent or is in the public service.; 
Entitlement to register as a British citizen if person is a minor whose parent acquired citizenship by descent and has resided at any time in the UK for 3 years: entitlement while child is minor. The parent's own British parent must have acquired citizenship otherwise than by descent. Other conditions: good character if person is over 10 years old. OR person is a minor whose parent is a citizen by descent and the child and both parents (unless one is dead or divorced) live in the UK for a period of three years and both parents consent (unless one parent has died). Other conditions: good character if person is over 10 years old.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in the UK to a parent who is resident there without immigration restrictions.
Person is a newborn child born in the UK of unknown parentage.
Person is born in the UK, under the age of 22, has been stateless since birth and resident in the UK for 5 years (maximum absence from the country for a total of 450 days).

category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in the UK for 5 years. Other conditions: good character, sufficient knowledge of one of the languages of the country, sufficient knowledge about life in the UK, intention to have principal home in the country and to continue residence in or service for the UK, oath of allegiance at citizenship ceremony. EEA national is required to have evidence of their right to permanent residence in order to apply for naturalisation.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the UK for 5 years, intention to have principal home in the country and to continue residence in or service for the UK.
Sufficient knowledge of one of the languages of the country required (test).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Sufficient knowledge about life in the UK required (test), oath of allegiance at citizenship ceremony.

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the spouse or civil partner of a citizen and has been resident in the UK for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is a minor who is born in the UK and whose parent acquires citizenship or becomes settled in the UK. Other conditions: good character if person is over 10 years old.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: A person who is married to a British citizen at the time of application needs only three years' lawful residence and indefinite leave to remain (compared to five years residence and one years ILR for other applicants). Thus, a person who meets those criteria and who is married to a British citizen at the time of application can apply under this section even if that was not the basis for their admission.

Person has previously renounced citizenship. Entitlement to register if the person has done so in order to obtain citizenship of another country. In other cases registration depends e.g. on person's intention to reside in the UK. Other condition: good character. Special rules for citizens with restricted citizenship rights (from former UK colonies).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen, a citizen with restricted citizen rights, or a former UK subject, has been stateless since birth and resident in the UK for 3 years (maximum absence from the UK for 270 days).

Person has served the UK, an international organisation of which the UK is a member, or a company or association based in the UK, for 5 years. Other condition: good character.;
Person is a citizen with restricted citizen rights or a former UK subject, and served the UK in colonial times.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person is born in Georgia to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to two citizens. Or to a citizen and a non-citizen, one of whom has permanent residence in Georgia. Or to a citizen and a non-citizen both of whom permanently reside abroad, if the parents agree on the child<d4>s acquiring citizenship of Georgia.
Person is a child living in Georgia and of unknown parentage.

Person is born in Georgia to parents who have the status of stateless person, and are permanently resident in Georgia, or to one stateless parent permanently resident in Georgia and the other parent is unknown.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident for 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the language as well as of history and the basic principles of the law, renunciation of other citizenship, and positive security check.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident for 10 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the language as well as the history and the basic principles of the law, have a job and/or real estate in Georgia, or carry on business on the territory of Georgia or hold an interest or shares in a Georgian enterprise, renunciation of other citizenship, and positive security check (i.e. person may not have committed certain crimes or be suspected by law enforcement agencies of having committed such crimes or pose a threat to state/public security). If person is a beneficiary of support ex Art. 12 Civil Code (i.e. has a serious psychosocial, mental or intellectual disorder), he/she is exempted from language requirement, civic knowledge requirement and income requirement.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident for 10 years.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.

Knowledge of the language. If person is a beneficiary of support ex Art. 12 Civil Code (i.e. has a serious psychosocial, mental or intellectual disorder), he/she is exempted from language requirement, civic knowledge requirement and income requirement.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of the history and the basic principles of the law. If person is a beneficiary of support ex Art. 12 Civil Code (i.e. has a serious psychosocial, mental or intellectual disorder), he/she is exempted from language requirement, civic knowledge requirement and income requirement.
Positive security check (i.e. person may not have committed certain crimes or be suspected by law enforcement agencies of having committed such crimes or pose a threat to state/public security).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person must have a job and/or real estate in Georgia, or carry on business on the territory of Georgia or hold an interest or shares in a Georgian enterprise.  If person is a beneficiary of support ex Art. 12 Civil Code (i.e. has a serious psychosocial, mental or intellectual disorder), he/she is exempted from language requirement, civic knowledge requirement and income requirement.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is married to a citizen and has been lawfully resident for 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the language as well as the history and the basic principles of the law, renunciation of other citizenship, and positive security check.

Person is a former citizen whose citizenship has been terminated a) unlawfully, b) by renunciation, or c) as a result of his/her parent's/parents' choice. Other conditions: knowledge of the language, and positive security check.;
Person is a former citizen who lost citizenship by acquiring a foreign citizenship and applies for reacquisition of citizenship before 31 December 2020. Person must fulfil language requirement and pass a security check. .
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person considers Georgia to be his/her homeland his/her ancestor a) is residing in an occupied territory of Georgia or is displaced from the territory or b) emigrated in the past for political reasons or due to economic/social hardship. Person must fulfil language requirement and civic knowledge requirement.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident for 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the language as well as the history and the basic principles of the law, renunciation of other citizenship, and positive security check.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person was born in Georgia before 21 December 1991 and resided in the Autonomous Republic of Abkhazia or in the territory of Tskhinvali Region (former Autonomous Region of South Ossetia) before that date, or is a child of such a person. Person may not have acquired a foreign citizenship and must pass a security check.
category: Additional restrictions apply (eg citizenship status of parent)

specification: Person is successful in sport, science or art and is willing to carry out his/her activities in Georgia or represent Georgia.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person makes an investment in Georgia that substantially contributes to the development of the country's economy.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Ghana to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is a child of not more than 7 years of age who is found in Ghana and whose parents are unknown.

Person has been legally resident in Ghana for an aggregate period of at least 5 years over 7 years, including the 12 months preceding the date of application. Other conditions: good character, not sentenced in Ghana or elsewhere to imprisonment, able to speak and understand an indigenous Ghanaian language, capable of making a substantial contribution, assimilated into the Ghanaian way of life.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been legally resident in Ghana for an aggregate period of at least 5 years over 7 years, including the 12 months preceding the date of application.
Person is able to speak and understand an indigenous Ghanaian language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person is assimilated into the Ghanaian way of life.
Person has good character, not sentenced in Ghana or elsewhere to imprisonment.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is capable of making a substantial contribution.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is married to a citizen. If the application is by a man based on marriage to a woman who is a citizen, the authorities may request the applicant to show that the marriage was effected in good faith, and the applicant must reside permanently in Ghana.
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Person is a child of not more than 16 years who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is born in or outside Ghana and one grandparent is a citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a grandchild of a citizen

specification: Person is the child of a person who is acquiring citizenship of Ghana by registration or naturalisation and an application is made by the parent.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship under previous provisions prohibiting dual citizenship and applies for a certificate of citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen of any approved country and has been ordinarily resident for at least 5 years. Other conditions: can speak and understand an indigenous language of Ghana.
Person is born to a citizen.
Person is born to a citizen.
Person is born to a parent who was also born there.
A newborn child found in Guinea is presumed to  be Guinean.

Person is born in Guinea to parents who are unknown, stateless or foreign and person is not entitled to any other citizenship. Person is regarded to never have been a Guinean citizen if it is established during minority that he or she is entitled to a foreign citizenship.

Person is born in Guinea to foreign parents, has attained the age of 16 years and has resided there during the 5 years preceding the moment that he/she manifests the will to acquire Guinean citizenship and is habitually resident there at that moment. Person is excluded from the provision if he/she has been convicted for certain crimes or subject to expulsion order/entry ban.; Person has attained the age of 16 years and has resided there during the 5 years preceding the moment that he/she submits a declaration in order to acquire Guinean citizenship and is habitually resident there at that moment. Or person has attained the age of 13 years and is habitually resident there at the moment his/her legal representative submits a declaration in order to acquire Guinean citizenship. Person who has attained the age of majority is excluded from these provisions if he/she has been convicted for certain crimes or subject to expulsion order/entry ban. President may oppose acquisition of citizenship.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Guinea for at least 5 years. Other conditions: Person must be of good character and may not have been convicted to a prison sentence of more than one year (unless the sentence has been suspended), person may not have been convicted for an act against the fundamental interests of the nation or terrorism or to a prison sentence of more than six months (unless the sentence has been suspended), person may not be subjected to an expulsion order or entry ban and may not have resided in Guinea irregularly, person must have sufficient knowledge of one of the national languages, Person must have sufficient knowledge of Guinean culture and society and adhere to the values and essential principles of the Guinean Republic.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Guinea for at least 5 years (or person performs military service, civil service or professional services for Guinea abroad during this period).
Person must have sufficient knowledge of one of the national languages.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must have sufficient knowledge of Guinean culture and society and adhere to the values and essential principles of the Guinean Republic.

Person must be of good character and may not have been convicted to a prison sentence of more than one year (unless the sentence has been suspended). Person may not have been convicted for an act against the fundamental interests of the nation or terrorism or to a prison sentence of more than six months (unless the sentence has been suspended). Person may not be subjected to an expulsion order or entry ban and may not have resided in Guinea irregularly.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person has been married to a citizen for at least five years (reduced to three years if child is born before/during the marriage) and has resided in Guinea at least three years after the marriage was concluded. Acquisition can be opposed by the President within one year of marriage. Person may not have been convicted for an act against the fundamental interests of the nation or terrorism or to a prison sentence of more than six months (unless the sentence has been suspended). Person may not be subjected to an expulsion order or entry ban and may not have resided in Guinea irregularly.

Person is the minor child of a person who acquired Guinean citizenship, in case the child has not acquired citizenship through the naturalisation process. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor child and adopted by a citizen in conformity with legal requirements. A 'simple adoption' is not sufficient.;Person is adopted by a citizen, has reached the age of majority and resides in Guinea. Person may not have been convicted for an act against the fundamental interests of the nation or terrorism or to a prison sentence of more than six months (unless the sentence has been suspended). Person may not be subjected to an expulsion order or entry ban and may not have resided in Guinea irregularly.;Person is adopted by a citizen by 'simple adoption'. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the spouse of a person who has acquired Guinean citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).

Person is a minor child of a person who has acquired Guinean citizenship.;Person is an adult child of a person who has acquired Guinean citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a former citizen, resides in Guinea and has been subjected to a ministerial investigation. Person has not been deprived of Guinean citizenship ex GUI 116 (unless he/she has been rehabilitated) or repudiated Guinean citizenship (certain exceptions apply if person has served in the Guinean military or has provided exceptional services to Guinea).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered important services to Guinea. Other conditions: see A06 (residence requirement reduced to three years).; Person has rendered exceptional services to Guinea or naturalisation represents an exceptional interest for the country. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has voluntarily served in the Guinean army in time of war. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).
Person is born in The Gambia to a citizen.
Person is born outside The Gambia to a citizen other than by descent (i.e. parent was born in The Gambia or is a citizen by naturalisation).
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person has been ordinarily resident in The Gambia for a continuous period of not less than 15 years. Other conditions: good character, intention to permanently reside, capable of supporting self and dependants, renounce citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been ordinarily resident in The Gambia for a continuous period of not less than 15 years. Intention to permanently reside required.
category: More than 10 years of residence required

specification: Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is capable of supporting self and dependants.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is married to a citizen and has been ordinarily resident in The Gambia since the marriage for at least 7 years.
Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship through marriage.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen of The Gambia who lost citizenship on acquiring another and renounces that other citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in Guinea Bissau to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen in the service of the state.; Person is born abroad to a citizen and s/he declares that s/he wishes to be a citizen or the birth is recorded in the civil register.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Guinea-Bissau to Lusophone parents. Both parents must be foreign citizens with the citizenship of a Portuguese Speaking State, i.e. Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Equatorial Guinea, Mozambique, Portugal, S<8b>o Tom<8e> and Pr<92>ncipe, and Timor-Leste.
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: A newborn infant found in the territory of Guinea Bissau is presumed to be a Guinean citizen.
Person is born in Guinea Bissau and does not possess another citizenship, or parents are stateless or of unknown citizenship.

Person has been habitually resident in Guinea Bissau for at least 6 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the culture and identification with it. Acquisition of nationality can be opposed if person does not have sufficient ties to the national community, is convicted to a sentence of more than 6 years imprisonment or for a crime against the security of the state, has exercised political or sovereign functions in favour of another state, or has served in the military of another state.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Guinea Bissau for at least 6 years.
Person must have knowledge of the culture and identification with it. Acquisition of nationality can be opposed if person does not have sufficient ties to the national community.
Person must have knowledge of the culture and identification with it. Acquisition of nationality can be opposed if person does not have sufficient ties to the national community.

Acquisition of citizenship can be opposed if person has been convicted to sentence of more than 6 years imprisonment or for a crime against the security of the state, not exercised political or sovereign functions in favour of another state.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has been married to a citizen for at least 3 years and resident in Guinea Bissau at least 1 year, and declares the will to acquire citizenship.
Person is fully adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the minor child of a father or mother who is acquiring citizenship and is included in the application. Person may opt for other citizenship on attaining majority.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship through acquiring another or through renunciation, re-establishes residence in Guinea Bissau and declares that s/he wants to reacquire citizenship. If person lost citizenship due to acquisition of the foreign spouse's citizenship, marriage must have been terminated or annulled.  Government may oppose reacquisition on the same terms as under mode A06.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered relevant services to the Guinean people either during or after the liberation struggle, or for national development. Article 9 distinguishes two types of relevant services: relevant services to the Guinean people, which are grounds for waiving the residence requirement, and relevant services to the Guinean State in the national development process, which are grounds for waiving the residence requirement and the knowledge of the Guinean culture requirement. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Equatorial Guinea to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Equatorial Guinea to foreign parents. Other conditions: option can be exercised from the age of 18 years provided the person has been resident for 10 years.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been legally resident for at least 40 years. (Note: there are other conditions that appear procedural but could be seen as substantive, eg certificate of good conduct (corresponds to no convictions.)
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been legally resident for at least 40 years.

specification: Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Person must demonstrate integration through knowledge of Spanish language/an indigenous language.

specification: Person must demonstrate integration through knowledge of the culture, habits and customs of Equatorial Guinea

No convictions for a serious crime in another country  (Note: there are other conditions that appear procedural but could be seen as substantive, eg certificate of good conduct (corresponds to no convictions.)
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Certificate of tax payment (solvencia tributaria) required.

specification: Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship and naturalisation is requested to be extended to the child.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person has lost citizenship because of a voluntary act.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Greece to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person is registered at the 1st class of a Greek primary school and continues to attend this school at the time of declaration of nationality acquisition, is born to parents who both have lawful residence  in Greece at the moment the nationality declaration is made, and at least one of his/her parents has had lawful residence in Greece for a minimum of five years before birth. If the child is born before the lapse of the five years<d5> residence, Greek nationality may be acquired after a period of 10 years of continuous lawful residence of the parent. Exceptions may apply if child is disabled.
Person is born in Greece to at least one parent also born there and permanently resident in Greece at the time of the person's birth.
Person is born in Greece with unknown citizenship or does not acquire another citizenship at birth.
Person is born in Greece with unknown citizenship or does not acquire another citizenship at birth.
Person is a minor who was born out of wedlock and whose descent from a citizen is recognised by that parent or legally established.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification:
Person is a minor, born in Greece and registered at the 1st class of a Greek primary school where (s)he continues to study at the time of declaration of citizenship acquisition in combination with continuous lawful residence of one of his/her parents for a minimum of 5 years before the child's birth and lawful residence of both parents at the moment of declaration.;
Person is born and resident in Greece. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Greece for 7 years. Other conditions: no criminal record of certain crimes, stable income, sufficient knowledge of the language, history and culture of Greece.

specification: Person is born in Grenada, unless born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.

Person has been resident in Grenada for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in Grenada, or in government service, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 5 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, sufficient knowledge of English, intent to reside in Grenada or continue government service, and oath of allegiance (only for British protected persons and persons who are not Commonwealth citizens or citizens of Republic of Ireland). Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Grenada for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in Grenada, or in government service, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 5 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Oath of allegiance (only for British protected persons and persons who are not Commonwealth citizens or citizens of Republic of Ireland).

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen (or was married to a person who was a citizen during the subsistence of the marriage). Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of Ireland has been resident in Grenada, or has been in government service, or has had partly such residence and partly such service for at least 5 years immediately prior to the application. article: ARs 2, 3 [S.R.O. 6 of 1978, Section 15]; GRE 5(3), Second Schedule, Regulation 4
specification: Person is stateless. Other conditions: good character.;  Person is married to a citizen of Grenada.

Person must be at least 18 years of age and meet the application requirements, which require investment in the National Transformation Fund or in an 'Approved Project' (real estate). The individual must first secure Permanent Residency and then can apply for citizenship. If a person provides false information, has a criminal record (or is subject to a criminal investigation), is considered a security risk, or has been denied a visa by a country with which Grenada has visa-free travel, or has been denied CBI by another country, then said person is automatically denied citizenship. Other conditions: oath of allegiance, payment of fees.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of someone who acquires citizenship as an emigrant (mode A21) or is of special interest for Croatia. Person is a minor both whose parents are acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. If only one parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation, the child should either reside in Croatia or the other parent should be stateless or of unknown citizenship. A parent can apply  for their child (without the consent of the other) in cases of death of the other parent, formal disability, full guardianship or unknown residence of the other parent.

specification: Person is a former citizen who has lost citizenship while resident in another country due to the fact that acquisition of citizenship of that country is an employment condition. category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification:
Person is of Croatian ethnicity and resides abroad. Other condition: respect for the legal order, customs and culture of the country.;
Person is an emigrant from Croatia, or a descendant of a former emigrant. Other condition: respect for the legal order, customs and culture of the country. 2020 law stipulates, additionally, that applicant whose parents are proven to be ethnic Croats, does not need to provide a proof of Croat ethnicity (CRO 16). Also,  the law more closely defines the category of emigrant as a person who left Croatia before 8th October 1991 with the intention to reside abroad. Additionally, (CRO11) emigrants are defined as members of Croatian nation who originate from the territory of 'former states' that Croatia was part of.  The knowledge of Croatian language is not required for naturalisation of ethnic Croat emigrants.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the special interest of Croatia. Other conditions: respect for the legal order, customs and culture of the country.

specification: Person is or has been resident abroad and in the public service. Discretionary exemption from residence and other requirements.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification:

specification: Person is the wife of a naturalised male citizen

specification: Person is born in Iraq to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to a male citizen.;The Minister may consider Iraqi any person born outside Iraq to an Iraqi mother and an unknown or stateless father, if he chooses the Iraqi
nationality, within one year from coming of age (reaching the age of majority), unless he fails to do so, due to difficult circumstances, provided that he is residing within Iraq at the time of application for the Iraqi nationality.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born in Iraq to unknown parents.

Person is born in Iraq to a non-Iraqi father who was also born in Iraq, and the father was habitually residing in the country at the time of child's birth. Person must have reached the age of majority.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in the country for 10 years. Other conditions: has an income, is of good character, has not been convicted for a crime or an offence against public morality, and has no disability. Palestinians are excluded.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the country for 10 years.
Person is of good character, has not been convicted for a crime or an offence against public morality.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person may not have a disability.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen (2 years residence) or the husband of a female citizen (5 years residence and other conditions under A06).
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Person is the minor child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Child acquires citizenship at the same time as the parent, provided that they are residing with him in Iraq.

specification: Person is a former Iraqi citizen who was denaturalised on political, religious, racist or sectarian grounds.

specification: Person is born in Iceland to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Iceland of unknown parentage, unless it is proven that he/she has a foreign citizenship before reaching the age of 5.
Person is 21 years old or below and is born in Iceland, is stateless and has been resident in Iceland for 3 years since birth.

Person has been resident in Iceland for 7 years and meets the conditions for obtaining a permanent residence permit. Other conditions: no criminal convictions, capable of working and have a good reputation, proficiency in Icelandic language (language test), property not subject to encumbrance or liens, capable of self-support, and has not received a support grant from a local authority for the past 3 years.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Iceland for 7 years and meets the conditions for obtaining a permanent residence permit.
Proficiency in Icelandic language required (language test).
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: No criminal convictions, good reputation required.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is capable of working, property not subject to encumbrance or liens, capable of self-support, and has not received a support grant from a local authority for the past 3 years.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is between 18 and 21 years of age and has been resident in Iceland since the age of 13 or since the age of 16 if the person is a citizen of a Nordic country. Residence requirement is reduced to three years if person is stateless.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has been resident in Iceland for 3 years (or 5 years in case of registered partnership). Other conditions: see A06.
Person is a minor under the age of 18 who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is an unmarried minor who is resident in Iceland whose father or mother (with custody over the child) is acquiring citizenship by declaration or by naturalisation.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who acquired citizenship at birth, was resident in Iceland until the age of 18, and has been resident in Iceland for 2 years. Residence in Iceland is sufficient if person is a citizen of a Nordic country.
Person is a citizen of a Nordic country and has been resident in Iceland for 7 years (or 5 years if the person was resident in a Nordic country before the age of 16).
Person is a recognised refugee (or holds a similar status) and has been resident in Iceland for 5 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is considered stateless in accordance with the Foreigners Act and has resided in Iceland for 5 years. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is born in Israel to a citizen. Children born after the death of their Israeli parent(s) will also be able to acquire Israel citizenship.

Person is born abroad to a citizen in one of the manners prescribed in paragraphs a-e. Transmission only to first generation abroad. Children born after the death of their Israeli parent(s) will also be able to acquire Israel citizenship.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Israel after the establishment of the State (citizenship 'by return'). This only applies if at least one parent was registered in the Population Register at the time of the person's birth (see ISR 2(c)(5)). The clause means that the 1950 Law of Return only applies to these individuals, who must necessarily be Jewish). It does not provide a form of ius soli.
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is a minor, resident in Israel and parents are unknown.

Person is born in Israel, has never held another citizenship, applies for Israeli citizenship between his/her 18 and 21st birthday and has been resident for 5 consecutive years immediately preceding the day of the filing of the application. The application may be denied in case the person was convicted for an offence against the security of the State or to imprisonment for five years or more for another offence.

Person is in Israel and has been resident there for 3 out of the 5 years immediately preceding the day of the submission of the application. Other conditions: is entitled to reside in Israel permanently, has settled (or intends to settle) in Israel, has some knowledge of the Hebrew language, has renounced citizenship of another country or proven his/her willingness to do so upon becoming a citizen, and oath of loyalty.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person is in Israel and has been resident there for 3 out of the 5 years immediately preceding the day of the submission of the application. Person is entitled to reside in Israel permanently, has settled (or intends to settle) in Israel.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: Person must have renounced citizenship of another country or proven his/her willingness to do so upon becoming a citizen.
Person must have some knowledge of the Hebrew language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen. Person may obtain Israeli citizenship even if s/he her/himself does not meet the requirements under mode A06.

Person is a minor who is adopted. Other conditions: person is adopted under the 1981 law for adopting children and his adoptive father or mother is a citizen. Or, when adopted outside Israel, his adoptive father or mother are citizens on the basis of clauses A to E in ISR 4A2, provided that the adopters were not residents of Israel on the day of the adoption and both adoptive parents give their consent.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person who is a descendant of a person who was a citizen under ISR 3A(a) shall be a citizen by residence in Israel if s/he is not a citizen by virtue of any other provision of the Nationality Law and was a resident of Israel and was registered in the Population Register on the date of the 5740 amendment.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born after the death of a parent who was a citizen at the time of his/her death.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is the spouse of someone who has applied for citizenship and who meets or is exempt from the requirements listed under mode A06. Person may obtain Israeli citizenship even if he/she does not meet the requirements under mode A06.

Person is a minor residing in Israel and his/her parent acquires citizenship by naturalisation.;Person is a resident of Israel or a resident of an Occupied Zone and a parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. If the minor is a foreign citizen and only one of the parents naturalised, citizenship shall not be conferred upon the minor if one of the parents declares that s/he does not wish the minor to become a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: The Minister of the Interior may grant citizenship to children of Israeli parents born outside of Israel and who lost their nationality under ISR 10 of the Nationality Law 1953 while a minor, provided they make an application to the Minister between their 18th and 22nd birthday.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

article: Law No. 5710-1950, The Law of Return, 4A-B
specification: The 1970 amendment extends the right of return to the spouse of a Jew and to the child and grandchild of a Jew as well as their spouses, unless a voluntary change of religion has occurred. Provisions are included to exclude persons likely to pose a danger to public welfare and state security. An oleh obtains Israeli citizenship upon arrival in Israel (ISR 2 under the Nationality Law 1953). Jew is defined as a person who was born to a Jewish mother or who converted, and is not a member of another religion.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person who did military service or a person who has lost a son or daughter in such service is exempt from the naturalisation requirements under A06 (except the requirement of having settled or intending to settle in Israel and oath of loyalty); The Minister of the Interior may exempt an applicant of all or any of the requirements under A06 (except entitled to reside permanently in Israel and intent to settle in Israel) if there exists in his opinion a special reason for this exemption; Person is a resident of full age of a zone occupied by Israel, has applied for naturalisation even though he is not in Israel, and the Minister of Interior is satisfied that the applicant identifies with Israel and its objectives and s/he or a member of his/her family has performed a significant act for Israel, including a significant act to further the economy of the country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Italy to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Italy of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Italy to parents who are unknown or stateless, or is not entitled to citizenship of the parents' country.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification:
Person is a minor who is born out of wedlock and is recognised by a father who is a citizen, or whose descent is established by judicial ruling.; 
Person is an adult who is born out of wedlock and is recognised by a father who is a citizen, or whose descent is established by judicial ruling (within one year of acknowledgement). Also applies to children from incestuous relationships.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

Person is born in Italy and has resided there legally and without interruption since birth until the age of majority.; person declares the wish to acquire Italian citizenship within a year of the age of majority.
Person has been resident in Italy for 3 years (discretionary)

specification:
Person is born abroad to a Jamaican mother, or to a non-Jamaican mother married to a Jamaican citizen, residing abroad in the employment of the Jamaican diplomatic service. Person is born to a citizen iure soli, iure sanguinis or by registration due to marriage to a citizen.;

Person is a minor and born abroad to a citizen not covered by Article 3C Constitution (see above).

Person is born in Jamaica. Unless born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy. Person is deemed to be born in the country if at the time of birth the mother is a citizen residing abroad in the diplomatic service of Jamaica, or if -regardless whether she is a citizen- the mother resides abroad as the spouse of a citizen who works in the diplomatic service of Jamaica.
Person is a minor and person is born on the territory of unknown parentage. Note: Country is party to the 1961 Convention on Statelessness, Article 1.

Paternity admitted by father or supported through evidence: father's name entered in register of births, declaration of paternity made in front of an authorized individual (such as a Justice of the Peace), or a judicial order form another country that establishes paternity.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has been resident in Jamaica for 12 months immediately prior to the application, as well as for 4 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: full capacity, good character, intent to reside in Jamaica, and oath of loyalty. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Jamaica for 12 months immediately prior to the application, as well as for 4 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Intent to reside in Jamaica required.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is married to a Jamaican citizen or to someone who becomes a citizen. Other conditions: oath of loyalty (exception for Commonwealth citizens and citizens of Ireland). Registration may be denied if the marriage is one of convenience to acquire citizenship, if the spouses lack intention to have a common household after marriage, or in case of conviction for certain criminal offences.
Person must be a minor. Decision at Minister's discretion.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person born to a deceased citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person marries someone who becomes a Jamaican citizen. Conditions: oath of allegiance, no criminal conviction, intention to live permanently together as spouses.
Person is a minor and parent is a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen by birth, descent or adoption who previously renounced citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of Ireland has been ordinarily resident in Jamaica, or in the service of the government, or has partly such residence and partly such service for 5 years. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive residence requirements. Other conditions: full age and capacity.
Person is a citizen of a First Schedule country or the Republic of Ireland has either been in government service or been partly in government service while resident in Jamaica.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification:
Person is born to a father who has Jordanian nationality.
Person is born in Jordan to a mother who holds Jordanian nationality and a father of unknown nationality or who has no nationality or whose affiliation has not been legally established.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born to a father enjoying Jordanian nationality.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born in Jordan to unknown parents is considered a foundling in the Kingdom, unless the opposite is proven.

Person has been regularly resident in Jordan for a period of four years preceding the date of the application, person must not have been convicted for offences that violate honor and morals, person intends to reside in Jordan, person knows how to read and write the Arabic language, person is of good conduct and has a good reputation, person is of sound mind and does not suffer from impairment/handicap that would make him/her dependent/a burden on society, person has a lawful means of livelihood, taking into account not to compete with Jordanians in the professions in which a limited number of positions are available.
The Council of Ministers may grant or reject the naturalization application in accordance with JOR 12's provisions. The Council of Ministers, with the approval of His Majesty, can dispense with the four-year residence requirement if the applicant is Arab or if the naturalization benefits the public interest. The naturalization certificate is granted by the Council of Ministers and shall bear the signature of the minister of Interior or the Minister's deputy.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been regularly resident in Jordan for a period of 4 years preceding the date of the application. Person intends to reside in Jordan.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

specification: The naturalization certificate only will be granted to individuals who renounce his/her former nationality at the time of the naturalization.
Person knows how to read and write the Arabic language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person may not have been convicted for offences that violate honor and morals. Person is of good conduct and has a good reputation.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is of sound mind and does not suffer from impairment/handicap that would make him/her dependent/a burden on society. Person has a lawful means of livelihood, taking into account not to compete with Jordanians in the professions in which a limited number of positions are available.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: A foreign woman who marries a Jordanian citizen may obtain Jordanian nationality with the approval of the Minister of Interior if she announces her desire in writing and has been married for (a) 3 years (if she holds an Arab nationality) or (b) 5 years (if she holds a non-Arab nationality).
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: JOR 8(1) (see A08) should apply to the female spouses of a recently naturalized husband because the term Jordanian in the law refers to 'any person who possesses Jordanian nationality in accordance with the provisions of this law,' in which case, such a wife would have to receive approval of her written application for nationality from the Minister of Interior and have been married for three years (if holding an Arab nationality) or five years (if holding a non-Arab nationality). Also see A26 for the current provisions under which the wife of an investor who acquires nationality also can acquire nationality. The provisions in A26 suggest that naturalized men can register their wives to receive nationality at the time of their application.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: JOR 3(3) and JOR 9 (see A01b) should apply to the children of recently naturalized fathers because the term Jordanian in the law refers to 'any person who possesses Jordanian nationality in accordance with the provisions of this law.' As such, recently naturalized men should be able to register their children as Jordanian nationals (perhaps at the same time as he acquires nationality). As with Jordanian female citizens by birth, naturalized Jordanian women should not be able to confer nationality to their children.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: The Council of Ministers, upon the recommendation of the Minister of the Interior, may return the Jordanian nationality to a Jordanian who renounced his Jordanian nationality to acquire another nationality in accordance with the provisions of this law based on a request submitted to the Minister of Interior.;A Jordanian woman who marries a non-Jordanian and then renounces her Jordanian nationality may submit a request for the return of that nationality if the marriage ends for any reason.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification:
Every person who has a father of Arab descent and holds the nationality of an Arab League member state (i.e., the law's definition of an Arab person) and has resided continuously in Jordan for no less than 15 years can obtain Jordanian nationality by a decision of the Council of Ministers, upon the recommendation of the Minister of Interior, if he/she renounces his/her original nationality by a written declaration and in accordance with that country's laws and provided that he/she (1) is of good conduct and has never been convicted for offences that violate honor and morals, (2) has a lawful means of livelihood, (3) is of sound mind and does not suffer from an impairment/handicap that would make him/her dependent/a burden on society, and (4) takes an oath of allegiance to His Majesty.;
The Council of Ministers, with the approval of His Majesty, can dispense with the four-year residence requirement of JOR 12's naturalization provisions if the applicant is Arab (i.e., has a father of Arab descent and holds the nationality of an Arab League member state); for the other conditions, see A06 (except the residence requirement).

His Majesty can, upon the recommendation of the Council of Ministers, grant Jordanian nationality to an expatriate (i.e., every Arab born in Jordan or the usurped part of Palestine and migrated from or fled these countries as well as the children of such a person--though this likely would only apply to the children of men meeting these criteria) who submits a written request for it, provided that this person renounces any other nationality he/she holds when submitting this request.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: The Council of Ministers, with the approval of His Majesty, can dispense with the four-year residence requirement if the applicant's naturalization benefits the public interest. For the other conditions, see A06 (except the residence requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: JOR 13(2), Cabinet decisions No. 6800 of October 2, 2019
specification:
Person can acquire citizenship without a four-year residence requirement if the applicant's naturalization benefits the public interest. Other conditions: see A06 (except the residence requirement). Conditions include satisfying one of the following four options as well as a security and financial solvency check (and are limited to 500 investors a year): 
(1) Making a zero-interest, three-year 1 million dollar (this likely refers to U.S. dollars, it explicitly does not refer to Jordanian dinar) deposit at the Central Bank of Jordan that the investor does not withdraw during that period and buying treasury bonds of the same value at an interest rate to be decided by the Central Bank of Jordan for 6 years.
(2) Buying shares/stocks worth at least 1 million dollars in Jordanian companies and investing 750,000 dollars in small and medium enterprises for no less than three years (with certification of these purchases provided by the relevant authority). 
(3) Setting up an investment project or investment projects in any productive economic sector (according to existing legal provisions for non-Jordanian investments) and paying 1.5 million dollars if the project(s) is registered in the Amman (capital) governorate (or paying 1 million dollars in other governorates), provided that the project(s) creates at least 20 job opportunities registered with the Social Security Corporation for Jordanians and remains operational for at least three years.
(4) Having an overall average total value of fixed assets in an existing project or an overall share/dividend of an existing project (according to certified annual budgets) during the last three years worth at least 1 million dollars in the Amman (capital) governorate (or 700,000 dollars in other governorates) for each partner that also provided at least 20 jobs for Jordanians (or 15 jobs in other governorates) during the last three years according to the Social Security Corporation.
An investor who obtains Jordanian nationality under one of these provisions can obtain Jordanian nationality for his: wife, his unmarried, widowed, or divorced daughters who live in his care/protection, unmarried sons no older than 18 years old when applying, and parents if they are dependent on him. An investor whose investment exceeds 3 million dollars also can obtain Jordanian nationality for his sons who are no older than 30 years old when applying as well as those sons' wives and children.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Japan to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen. (But see the interrelationship with mode L06 with regard to those who also acquired at birth the citizenship of their country of birth.)
Person is a child born in Japan of unknown parentage.

Person is born in Japan to parents without citizenship.; Person is born in Japan, has been stateless since birth, and has been domiciled in Japan for 3 consecutive years since then. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to age, full capacity, and means of living).
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is a child under the age of 20 whose father or mother, who are presently citizens and were also citizens at the time of the child's birth, has acknowledged paternity or maternity. Person acquires citizenship through a notification to the Minister of Justice.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is born in Japan and has been domiciled or resident in Japan for 3 consecutive years. Other conditions: see A06. Or person is born in Japan to a person who was also born in Japan. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person is over the age of 20, of full capacity, and has been domiciled in Japan for a continuous period of 5 years. Other conditions:  renunciation of another citizenship (requirement can be waived if renunciation is impossible, e.g. for refugees), good character, sufficient means of support either in the person's own property or ability or that of the spouse/relatives, not having advocated the overthrow of the Constitution or the Government of Japan.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been domiciled in Japan for a continuous period of 5 years.
Renunciation of another citizenship required (requirement can be waived if renunciation is impossible, e.g. for refugees).
Good character required. Person may not have advocated the overthrow of the Constitution or the Government of Japan.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Sufficient means of support either in the person's own property or ability or that of the spouse/relatives
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has been domiciled or resident in Japan for 3 consecutive years. Or the person has been married with a citizen for 3 years and has been domiciled in Japan for 1 consecutive year. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to age and full capacity).
Person is the child of a citizen and is domiciled in Japan. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to residence, age, full capacity, and means of living).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is adopted by a citizen, has been domiciled in Japan for 1 consecutive year, and was a minor according to the law of his/her native country at the time of the adoption. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to age, full capacity, and means of living).
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a descendant of a former citizen has been domiciled or resident in Japan for 3 continuous years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the child of a deceased father.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification:
Person is a former citizen other than by naturalisation and is domiciled in Japan. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to residence, age, full capacity, and means of living).;
Person who is under the age of 20 and lost citizenship as a result of choosing for another citizenship that was acquired by birth in a foreign country (mode L06) will reacquire Japanese citizenship by making a notification to the Minister of Justice, provided that he/she is domiciled in Japan. A person who lost citizenship after receiving a notice for not choosing either foreign citizenship or Japanese citizenship (mode L06) will reacquire Japanese citizenship by making notification to the Minister of Justice within 1 year after becoming aware of the fact that he/she has lost Japanese citizenship and provided that the foreign citizenship is renounced.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been resident in Japan for a continuous period of 10 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has rendered special meritorious services to Japan. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Kazachstan to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to parents who are both citizens, or to one parent who is a citizen and the other parent is stateless or of unknown citizenship.; Person is born abroad to one parent who is a citizen and at least one parent had permanent residence in Kazachstan at the time of the child's birth. If the parent(s) have permanent residence outside the country, their joint consent is required.
Person is a child staying in Kazachstan and of unknown parentage.
Person is a child born in Kazachstan to stateless parents who have permanent residence in the country.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been lawfully and permanently resident for 5 years. Other conditions: security and public policy checks (list of reasons for refusal).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully and permanently resident for 5 years.
Security and public policy checks required (list of reasons for refusal).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is married to a citizen and has been lawfully and permanently resident for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is a child who is adopted by parents who are citizens. If one parent is a foreigner, their joint written consent is required.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is under the age of 14 years and his/her parent(s) are acquiring citizenship. If one parent remains a foreigner, the child can acquire citizenship provided that the parents submit a joint written application and provided the child has permanent residence in the country. Child's consent is required if between 14 and 18 years.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a rehabilitated victim of mass political repressions who has been deprived of or involuntary lost citizenship (as well as his/her descendants) and who moved to the country with the aim of permanent residence.; Person is a former citizen and applies for restoration of citizenship.

Person is a citizen of a former Soviet republic who takes up permanent residence in Kazakhstan and his/her child, spouse, parent, sister, brother, grandfather or grandmother is a citizen of Kazakhstan.

Persons are ethnic Kazakhs who moved to the country with the aim of permanent residence or study at a higher educational institute in Kazakhstan. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).;Person is a citizen of the former union of republics, arrived in Kazakhstan with the aim of permanent residence, and has one close relative who is a citizen of the Republic of Kazakhstan (a child, including an adopted child/spouse/parent, including adoptive parents/sister or brother/grandfather or grandmother). Acquisition is irrespective of the term of the person's residence in Kazakhstan. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has performed special work for the country, or applicant is a family member of the person. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Kenya to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found in Kenya and appears to be less than 8 years of age.

Person has been lawfully resident in Kenya for at least 7 years, including 12 months immediately prior to application. Other conditions: adequate knowledge of Kenya and rights and duties of citizens, understand speak KiSwahili or a local dialect, understand the nature of the application, not convicted and sentenced to term of imprisonment of 3 years or more, capable of making a substantive contribution to Kenya, not adjudged bankrupt, and country of previous citizenship is not at war with Kenya.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident in Kenya for at least 7 years, including 12 months immediately prior to application.
Person is able to understand speak KiSwahili or a local dialect.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person has adequate knowledge of Kenya and rights and duties of citizens.
Person has not convicted and sentenced to term of imprisonment of 3 years or more, and country of previous citizenship is not at war with Kenya.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is capable of making a substantive contribution to Kenya, not adjudged bankrupt.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been married to a citizen for a least 7 years and is not a prohibited immigrant.

Person is the child of a citizen by registration born before the parent acquired citizenship, or the person is a dependant or under the legal guardianship of someone who is a citizen by registration. Other conditions: production of document conferring citizenship on a parent, and of the birth certificate and proof of lawful residence in Kenya of the child or parent with a disability.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor child who is adopted by a citizen. Other conditions: proof of Kenyan citizenship of adopting parent, valid adoption certificate and proof of lawful residence of the child in Kenya.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person was married to a citizen and but for the death of the citizen would have been entitled to register as a citizen. Other conditions: has not remarried to a non-citizen.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person was a Kenyan citizen by birth and lost citizenship because s/he acquired citizenship of another country.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person does not have an enforceable claim to the citizenship of any recognised state and has been living in Kenya since 1963 or who migrated to Kenya before 1963 and has been living in Kenya since then, and their descendants. Other conditions: knowledge of KiSwahili or a local dialect, not convicted to an offence and sentenced to 3 years imprisonment, understands rights and duties of a citizen. Application must be made within 7 years of commencement of  the Act (period was extended in 2016 by 3 years and in 2017 by 2 years).
category: Additional restrictions apply (eg citizenship status of parent)

specification: Person is born in Kyrgyzstan to parents who are both citizens. If only one parent is a citizen, the parents' written consent is required.
Person is born abroad to parents who are both citizens. If only one parent is a citizen, the parents' written consent is required.
Person is a child located on the territory of Kyrgyzstan and of unknown parentage.
Person is a child born in Kyrgyzstan to parents who are both without citizenship and are permanently residing in the country.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has had 5 years of continuous and uninterrupted residence in the country. Other conditions: knowledge of the official language (sufficient for communication), commitment to comply with the Constitution and legislation of the country, source of subsistence, and meet security and public policy checks (list of reasons for refusal).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has had 5 years of continuous and uninterrupted residence in the country.
Knowledge of the official language (sufficient for communication)
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Commitment to comply with the Constitution and legislation of the country.
Person must meet security and public policy checks (list of reasons for refusal).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has a source of subsistence.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a female foreign citizen or stateless person, is married to a citizen and arrived in the country with the purpose of having permanent residence.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person has been resident for 1 year, has reached the age of majority, and has a parent who is a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except language requirement).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is adopted by a citizen. If person is adopted by a couple one of whom is a foreigner, the written consent of both adoptive parents is required (not necessary if the child is stateless). Child's consent is required between the age of 14 and 18.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship. If one parent remains a foreigner, his/her written consent is required. If one parent is without citizenship, the child shares in the acquisition of citizenship by the other parent automatically (if child is resident in the country) or upon the request of the parent acquiring citizenship (if child is resident abroad).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Persons was born in the country, had the citizenship of the former USSR, and has been resident for 1 year. Other conditions: see A06 (except language requirement); Person is a former citizen, has been resident for 1 year, and returned to have permanent residence. Other conditions: see A06 (except language requirement). Or person is a former citizen and resides continuously and legally in the country. Other conditions: see A06 (except language requirement).
Person is of Kyrgyz ethnicity, has a foreign citizenship or no citizenship and returns to Kyrgyzstan to have permanent residence.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee and has been resident for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has high achievements in the fields of science or culture or a profession or qualification that is in high demand in Kyrgyzstan, and has been resident for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has invested in highly prioritised sectors of the economy of the country and has been resident for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Cambodia to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Cambodia to a mother and father who were also born there and who are legally resident there.
Person is born in Cambodia of unknown parentage or is a newborn found in Cambodia.
Person is a minor who was born out of wedlock and whose descent from a citizen is recognised by that parent, or whose paternity has been established by a court ruling.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is born in Cambodia and has been continuously resident there for 3 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person is resident in Cambodia and has been continuously resident there for 7 years from the moment s/he received a residence card. Other conditions: good morals, clean criminal record, ability to speak the Khmer language, knowledge of Khmer script and history, evidence that person can integrate into Khmer society, physical and mental health so as not to become a danger or burden to society.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person is resident in Cambodia and has been continuously resident there for 7 years from the moment s/he received a residence card.
Ability to speak the Khmer language
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of Khmer script and history, evidence that person can integrate into Khmer society.

category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Physical and mental health so as not to become a danger or burden to society.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen, with common household, for 3 years and has resided in Cambodia for at least 12 months. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirements).
Person is adopted by a citizen through full adoption.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the parent of a minor child who is a citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is the spouse of someone who includes the person in his/her naturalisation application.
