Person is a minor whose parent includes the child in his/her naturalisation application.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person has special merits or achievements that serve the interest of Cambodia. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence condition and language requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person has made an authorized investment and has legally resided in Cambodia for 12 months. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence condition).;
Person has made a donation to the national budget or the humanitarian sector and has legally resided in Cambodia for 6 months. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence condition and language requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Kiribati after independence day (12 July 1979) and  his/her father is a citizen or one of the parents is of I-Kiribati descent. Citizenship is not acquired if neither parent is a citizen and father (or mother if parents unmarried) is a foreign diplomat or person<d5>s father (or mother if parents are unmarried) is a citizen of a country with which Kiribati is at war and birth occurred in occupied place.  (Note discrimination on the basis of gender and marital status.)
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born outside Kiribati after independence day, as long as person's if father is or would have been a citizen of Kiribati on the date of person's birth. (Note gender discrimination - citizenship by descent through father only)
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born in Kiribati after independence day (12 July 1979) and person does not acquire another citizenship.

Person can apply for naturalization. Criteria: ordinarily resident in Kiribati for 7 years (waived if applicant has lost or renounced citizenship), intends to continue to reside in Kiribati, good character, able to speak and understand Kiribati language, respect for customs and traditions of Kiribati, means of support, reasonable knowledge and understanding of the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizenship, and has renounced other citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Ordinarily resident in Kiribati for 7 years (waived if applicant has lost or renounced citizenship).
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Ability to speak and understand Kiribati language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Respect for customs and traditions of Kiribati, reasonable knowledge and understanding of the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizenship required.

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person must have means of support.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Woman who marries a person who is or becomes a citizen can apply for registration as a citizen of Kiribati. (Note gender discrimination: no similar provision for a male spouse of a citizen.)
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person born outside Kiribati prior to independence day (12 July 1979) becomes a citizen if his or her father (or mother if person born outside marriage) becomes or would have become a citizen on independence day. (Note gender discrimination.)
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Child becomes a citizen if the adopter, or in the case of a joint adopter <d0> the male adopter <d0> is a citizen (gender discrimination)
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Male applicant for naturalisation can request that his wife becomes a citizen at the moment he acquires citizenship. (Note gender discrimination: no similar provision for female applicants and male spouse.)
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Male applicant for naturalisation can request that his children become a citizen when he does. (Note gender discrimination: no similar provision for female applicants.)
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: A woman who loses Kiribati citizenship by marrying a foreign citizen can apply to regain Kiribati citizenship if her marriage has broken down. (Note gender discrimination.)
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is the child of a citizen (registration required).
Person is born in St Kitts. Unless born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.
Person is a newborn infant found in St Kitts of unknown parentage.

Person is a minor or adult who was born in St Kitts and has always been stateless.  Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, no sentence to death or a prison sentence of at least 12 months, good character, not declared bankrupt, sufficient means for self-support, oath of loyalty.

Article 119 defines a parent for a child born out of wedlock as the mother and a male who 'shows' himself  to be the father, or who has been 'found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be his or her father.' The 1984 Citizenship Act states that a father 'includes a person who acknowledges and can show that he is the father of the child or has been found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be the father of the child.' Paternity may be established via: entry into register of births, by deed in front of an authority, and an order declaring paternity from another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person previously a citizen of SKN, via Article 90, but had renounced it.;                                                   Person born in territory, but did not meet criteria for citizenship under Const. 90(a)
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in St Kitts for 12 months immediately prior to the application (unless person is a British protected person), as well as for 14 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: full capacity, good character, intent to reside in St Kitts, and oath of loyalty. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in St Kitts for 12 months immediately prior to the application (unless person is a British protected person), as well as for 14 years predating the 12-month period. intent to reside in St Kitts required.
category: More than 10 years of residence required

specification: Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is married to a Kittitian or to a Commonwealth citizen who becomes a Kittitian or to someone who was previously a Kittitian, or to someone who is entitled to citizenship by registration ex f Constitution Article 92 b-d and f. Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, no sentence to death or a prison sentence of at least 12 months, good character, not declared bankrupt, sufficient means for self-support, and oath of loyalty.
Person is minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the grandchild of a person who, prior to Sep 19, 1983, was a British citizen or a British Dependent Territory citizen and who would have become a Kittitian via Article 90a-b upon Independence except that s/he died or renounced citizenship.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a grandchild of a citizen

specification: Person is born to someone who but for his or her death or renunciation would have become a citizen. Parent must have been born in St. Kitts and Nevis and was a British citizen or a British Dependent Territories citizen or the parent must have been working for the Kittitian government overseas.; Person is married to someone who renounced his or her citizenship, or who, but for his or her death would become a citizen, or, although marriage terminated, they were married for three years prior to Independence.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is the spouse of someone who becomes a citizen by virtue of mode A16 or A18. Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, no sentence to death or a prison sentence of at least 12 months, good character, not declared bankrupt, sufficient means for self-support, and oath of loyalty.
Person is the minor child of a person who becomes a citizen, or who would have become a citizen but for his or her death. Other condition: oath unless a Commonwealth citizen
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who renounced citizenship. Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, no sentence to death or a prison sentence of at least 12 months, good character, not declared bankrupt, and sufficient means for self-support.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen, of full capacity and age, and has been ordinarily resident in St Kitts, or in government service, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 14 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, no sentence to death or a prison sentence of at least 12 months, good character, not declared bankrupt, sufficient means for self-support, and oath of loyalty.

Person is of full age and capacity, a citizen of a First Schedule country and has been partly or fully in public service for the 14 years prior to his or her application. Minister may refuse citizenship registration on grounds of public safety, order and defence, lack of good character, public charge likelihood and other grounds found in Article 11 of the Citizenship Act.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the special economic interest of St Kitts.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in South Korea to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in South Korea of unknown parentage.
Person is born in South Korea to parents without citizenship.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is a minor and is acknowledged by a father or mother who is a citizen. Parent must already have been a citizen at the time of the person's birth.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person is born in South Korea, has been domiciled there for a continuous period of 3 years, and one parent was also born in South Korea. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been domiciled in South Korea for a continuous period of 5 years and has permanent residence status. Other conditions: good character, sufficient means of support either in the person's own property or ability or that of his/her family, basic knowledge of Korean language and customs, and renunciation of citizenship of a foreign country (unless unreasonable to request), take an oath, and not harm nationality security, public order or public welfare.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been domiciled in South Korea for a continuous period of 5 years and has permanent residence status.
Renunciation of citizenship of a foreign country (unless unreasonable to request).

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Basic knowledge of Korean language and customs.
Good character required. Person may not harm nationality security, public order or public welfare.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Sufficient means of support either in the person's own property or ability or that of his/her family.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has been domiciled in South Korea for 2 consecutive years while being married. Or the person has been married with a citizen for 3 years and has been domiciled in South Korea for 1 consecutive year. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation requirement and permanent residence status requirement) .
Person is the (minor adopted) child of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to age, residence and means of living and permanent residence status requirement).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is adopted by a citizen while being an adult under South Korean law at the time of the adoption, and the person has been domiciled in South Korea for 3 consecutive years. Other conditions: see A06 (except permanent residence status requirement)
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the child of a person who was a citizen, and has been domiciled in South Korea for a continuous period of 3 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except permanent residence status requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Father was a citizen, but died before the child was born.;Person is the spouse of a citizen who died or disappeared while the couple was domiciled in South Korea. Residence requirements listed under Mode A08 still apply, but may be fulfiled during marriage and/or during widowhood. Other conditions: see A06 (except permanent residence status requirement).
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is a minor who is included in the parent's application for naturalisation.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen. Reacquisition can be refused on grounds relating to disorderly behaviour, harm that was inflicted on the state or society, if citizenship was renounced to evade military service, or if reacquisition is deemed inappropriate for reasons of public security or national welfare. Person is required to take an oath.

Person contributed greatly to South Korea or has special abilities in fields such as science, education, culture, and sports. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating renunciation requirement, age, residence, and means of living and permanent residence status requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Kuwait to a male citizen; Person is born in Kuwait to a female citizen and father is unknown or paternity has not been established.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born abroad to a male citizen; Person is born abroad to a female citizen and father is unknown or paternity has not been established.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born in Kuwait to unknown parents.

Person is born from a mother who is a citizen, has resided in Kuwait until reaching the age of majority, and parents are divorced or father is deceased. Person may be treated as a citizen before reaching the age of majority by Minister's decision. Renunciation of original citizenship required. Person must be fluent in Arabic, has an income, good character, not been sentenced for a crime against honour or security, is Muslim.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen, provided that she declares her wish to acquire citizenship and that the marriage has lasted for at least 15 years from the date of her declaration. Renunciation of original citizenship required.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is the spouse of a male citizen, if she declares her wish to be considered a citizen within 1 year following the date of her husband's naturalisation. Renunciation of original citizenship required.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)
Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person applies for reacquisition, has lawfully resided in Kuwait for at least 1 year, and has renounced citizenship of another country. Acquisition is by resolution of the Council of Ministers upon the recommendation of the Minister of the Interior.
Person belongs to another Arab country. Other conditions: see A06 (but residence reduced to 15 years). Renunciation of original citizenship required.

Person has lived in Kuwait for a minimum of 20 years (15 years if person is an Arab and originates from an Arab state). Other conditions: fluent in Arabic, has an income, good character, not been sentenced for a crime against honour or security, holds a qualification needed in a country (such as a degree for a profession), and is Muslim. Renunciation of original citizenship required.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has rendered important services to the country. Other requirements: fluent in Arabic, has an income, good character, not been sentenced for a crime against honour or security, is Muslim.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Laos to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to two citizens, to a citizen and a stateless person, or to at least one citizen who has a permanent address in Laos. In case both parents are citizens but have their permanent address abroad, the child's citizenship will be decided by the parents.
Person is a child found in Laos of unknown parentage.

Person is born in Laos to parents who are both stateless, permanently residing in Laos, integrated into Lao society and culture, and the parents request Lao citizenship for the child. Or person is born to a stateless parent and a citizen parent (regardless of their place of residence or place of birth).
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has had continuous and permanent residence in Laos for 10 years. Other conditions: respect the Constitution and laws of the country, social and cultural integration, written and oral fluency in Lao, good health, not sentenced to imprisonment by any court, protect and develop the country, cause no harm to the national interest, have profession, qualifications and a stable economic status, and renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has had continuous and permanent residence in Laos for 10 years.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Written and oral fluency in Lao.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Social and cultural integration required, respect the Constitution and laws of the country, social and cultural integration, written and oral fluency in Lao.
Not sentenced to imprisonment by any court, protect and develop the country, cause no harm to the national interest.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Profession, qualifications and a stable economic status required.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a married couple consisting of two citizens. In case one parent is a citizen and the other parent is a citizen of another country or stateless, the child will acquire citizenship upon agreement by the adoptive parents.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the minor and unmarried child of parents who both are acquiring citizenship, or one parent is acquiring citizenship while the other parent is stateless and the child resides in Laos.; Person is the minor and unmarried child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship while the other parent holds citizenship of another country, or one parent is acquiring citizenship while the other parent is stateless and the child resides abroad. The child may acquire citizenship upon the request of the citizen parent. Children between the age of 15-18 can choose the citizenship of either parent.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who previously renounced his/her citizenship. Citizenship cannot be reacquired if citizenship was withdrawn by the authorities.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is of the Lao race. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation requirement). Residence requirement is reduced to 5 years if the person holds citizenship of another country, and to 3 years if the person is stateless.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has resided in Laos for at least three years and has contributed to the national liberation or national defense and development and has knowledge, expertise, or talents or has been successful in a business that the Party and the State are in need of. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Lebanon to a male citizen. (In Lebanon, there is a problem with individuals who are born [to a Lebanese mother] out of wedlock not being able to have their birth registered. Lack of birth registration may result in problems with not being considered a citizen. This can be resolved in court, but this is not a simple process. We are not aware of any legal provisions that allow access to citizenship by mother if illegitimate, and on the ground we have never seen cases where this takes place.)
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born abroad to a male citizen. (In Lebanon, there is a problem with individuals who are born out of wedlock not being able to have their birth registered. Lack of birth registration may result in problems with not being considered a citizen. This can be resolved in court, but this is not a simple process. We are not aware of any legal provisions that allow access to citizenship by mother if illegitimate, and on the ground we have never seen cases where this takes place.)
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born in Lebanon to unknown parents.
Person is born in Lebanon and does not acquire any other citizenship at birth.
Person is the wife of a male citizen and she has lived in the country for 5 years.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is the wife of a male person who acquires citizenship.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor child of a male person who acquires citizenship.;Person is a major child of a male person who acquires citizenship (application required).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a woman who lost citizenship as a result of marriage with a foreigner. She may, upon her request, recover citizenship after the dissolution of her marriage.;Person is of Lebanese origin and resettles in Lebanon
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in Liberia to a citizen. Other conditions: must be Negro or of Negro descent.
category: Group restriction: only if citizen parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen. Other conditions: must be Negro or of Negro descent. Or person is born outside Liberia of a father who was born a citizen of Liberia and remains so at the time of the birth, and resided in Liberia prior to the birth of the child.
category: Group restriction: only if citizen parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born in Liberia and is a Negro or of Negro descent.
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is a woman of Negro descent who is married to a citizen. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Group restriction: only if spouse of a citizen is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is the child born outside Liberia of alien parents or of a citizen mother and a father who was not born a citizen and the father is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation while the child is under the age of 21. Other conditions: child is residing in Liberia following lawful admission for permanent residence.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a woman formerly a citizen who under a prior law lost citizenship automatically by marriage to an alien.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is Negro or of Negro descent and has been lawfully resident for at least 2 years. Other conditions: good moral character and attached to the principles of the constitution, renounce citizenship of another country, declaration that s/he does not believe in anarchy, two witnesses to attest to moral character. Petition for naturalisation filed with the Circuit Court of the county in which the person resides and decided by the court.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Libya to a male citizen. Not clear what are the governing rules for female citizens transferring their citizenship (contradiction in the law and governing rules are yet to be issued).
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born abroad to a male citizen if registered within 1 year. Not clear what are the governing rules for female citizens transferring their citizenship (contradiction in the law and governing rules are yet to be issued).
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born in Libya to unknown parents.

Person has been resident in Libya for 10 years. Other conditions: has an income, of good character, in physical health, under 50 years old and fulfils any other condition deemed relevant to the public interest.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Libya for 10 years.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person has an income and is in physical health.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person who is a female spouse of a male national can acquire facilitated naturalisation after 2 years of marriage.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of a male parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Child acquires citizenship at the same time as the parent.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person who has emigrated from Libya and lost his/her citizenship can re-acquire it upon submitting the necessary documents.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has special skills. No other conditions prescribed.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born to a citizen who did not receive citizenship via descent and birth outside the territory.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in St Lucia. Unless born to a father who is a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or the father is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.
Person is a minor infant born in St Lucia of unknown parentage.

Person has been resident in St Lucia for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in St Lucia, or in government service, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 7 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: renunciation of another citizenship, good character, full capacity, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen,  intent to reside in St Lucia or to continue government service, and oath of allegiance. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in St Lucia for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in St Lucia, or in government service, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 7 years predating the 12-month period. Intent to reside in St Lucia required.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen or was married to a person who was entitled to apply to be registered as a citizen. Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, adequate knowledge of English, no sentence for a criminal offence that carries a prison sentence of at least 6 months or for a drugs-related offence, good character, residence in the country, and oath of loyalty (only if person has reached the age of 21, and only for British protected persons and persons who are not Commonwealth citizens.
Person is under 21 and parent is a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is under the age of 21.;Person is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the parent of someone who acquired citizenship by investment, is over 65 years, fully supported by the applicants and physically or mentally challenged.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person was married to someone who would have become a citizen but for his or her death. Or person was the child (adopted, step, or natural) of someone who would have been entitled to registration as a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

article: Const. 102(1)a and e, 2(a andc), STL 6(1)a, e and f(i);  CBI 2(a) and 30(2)
specification: Person married to a citizen.; Person married to someone who applies to register as a citizen by investment. Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, and oath of loyalty (with exceptions).

Person's parent acquired citizenship via investment. Other conditions: person is under age 18 or if between 18 and 25, person is fully dependent on the citizen parent and is also enrolled in an institution of higher education. If a person is older than 25, but mentally or physically incapacitated and dependent on the citizen parent, then s/he can apply acquire citizenship via investment.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a former citizen who renounced citizenship in order to acquire or retain citizenship of another country. Other conditions: no danger to public defence, safety or order, and oath of loyalty (with exceptions).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen and has been ordinarily resident in St Lucia for 7 years immediately prior to the application.  Other conditions: good character,  adequate knowledge of English, no sentence for a criminal offence that carries a prison sentence of at least 6 months or for a drugs-related offence, no danger to public defence, safety or order, residence in the country.
Person is a minor who is stateless.
category: Additional restrictions apply (eg citizenship status of parent)

specification: Person has been ordinarily resident in St Lucia for 7 years immediately prior to the application and fully ot partly in government service during this time. Other conditions: good character and adequate knowledge of English.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person is above 18, meets the application criteria, is financially independent and invests in the Saint Lucia Economic Fund. Other conditions: person cannot be a potential national security risk, under criminal investigation, have been convicted of a criminal offense (exception is a traffic violation), provided false information on the application, been denied a visa to a country with which Saint Lucia has visa-free travel, or done anything to bring disrepute to Saint Lucia. Person must take an oath of allegiance.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Liechtenstein to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Liechtenstein, has been stateless since birth and has not yet reached the age of 21 years, and has had at least 5 years of continuous legal and main residence in the country.

Person has had 10 years of uninterrupted lawful and main residence in Liechtenstein and applies for naturalisation in the municipality by popular ballot. Other conditions: renunciation of another citizenship, language and integration test. Person must fulfil security requirements listed in LIE 4b. Person's livelihood must be sufficiently secured.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has had 10 years of uninterrupted lawful and main residence in Liechtenstein.

category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person must fulfil security requirements listed in LIE 4b.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person's livelihood must be sufficiently secured.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has had 30 years of uninterrupted lawful and main residence in Liechtenstein immediately before application, of which the years spent in the country under the age of 20 count as double. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person has been the spouse or registered partner for 5 years, or resided in Liechtenstein for 10 years before entering the marriage or registered partnership. Other condition: renunciation of citizenship of another country.
Person is a child who has not yet reached the age of 10 and is adopted by a citizen.; Person is minor whose parent marries a citizen who adopts the minor child.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Child is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship and the child has ordinary residence in Liechtenstein. Consent is required if the child is over the age of 15.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person has had 30 years of uninterrupted lawful and main residence in Liechtenstein immediately before application (years spent in the country under the age of 20 count as double). Other conditions: renunciation of another citizenship, language and integration test.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a stateless minor who has been resident in Liechtenstein for 5 years.
Person is born in Sri Lanka to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to a citizen and is within 1 year after birth registered at the office of a consular officer of Sri Lanka in the country of birth or at the office of the Minister in Sri Lanka.; Person is of full age and sound mind, resident in Sri Lanka, and was not registered in accordance with SRI 5(2). Other conditions: intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. Minister may refuse the application on grounds of public policy.
Person is a newborn deserted infant found in Sri Lanka of unknown and unascertainable parentage. Child is deemed to have the status of a citizen by descent.

Person is the spouse of a citizen by descent or registration, of sound mind, and has been resident in Sri Lanka throughout a period of 1 year immediately preceding the date of the application. Other conditions: intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. Minister may refuse the application for reasons of public interest.

Person is of full age and sound mind, resident in Sri Lanka, and his or her parent was a citizen by descent who lost citizenship under SRI 20. Other conditions: intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. Minister may refuse the application on grounds of public policy.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Parent was a citizen who died before the child was born.;  Person is the widow(er) of a citizen by descent or registration, of sound mind, and has been resident in Sri Lanka throughout a period of 1 year immediately preceding the date of the application. Other conditions: intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. Minister may refuse the application for reasons of public interest.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is a minor whose parent includes the child in his or her registration application.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen by descent who is resident in Sri Lanka. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country, intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, and oath of allegiance. Minister may refuse reacquisition on grounds of public policy and may exempt the person from the renunciation requirement. Reacquisition can be extended to minor children but not to spouse.

Person has been granted a 5-year visa or endorsement under the Immigrants and Emigrants Act, has been registered in a Resident Guest Scheme for foreign professionals, and has made a significant contribution to the social and cultural life of Sri Lanka (e.g. in the fields of science, medicine or entertainment).  Other conditions: intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka. A maximum of 200 persons may be registered under modes A24 and A26 in any year, and 1,000 in the aggregate.;
Person is resident in Sri Lanka and is eminent in professional, commercial, industrial or agricultural life. Other conditions: intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. A maximum of 25 persons may be registered under this mode each year.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is resident in Sri Lanka and has rendered distinguished public service or is eminent in professional, commercial, industrial or agricultural life. Other conditions: intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. A maximum of 25 persons may be registered under this mode each year.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person has been granted a 5-year visa or endorsement under the Immigrants and Emigrants Act, has been registered in a Resident Guest Scheme for foreign investors, and has made a substantial contribution to the economic development of the country.  Other conditions:  intent to continue to ordinarily reside in Sri Lanka, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance. A maximum of 200 persons may be registered under modes A24 and A26 in any year, and 1,000 in the aggregate.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born abroad and either of the parents is a citizen otherwise than by descent.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Lesotho. Unless one parent has diplomatic status, or the parent is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place controlled by the enemy, and the other parent is not a citizen.

Person is born in Lesotho, falls under one of the exceptions to mode A02a (i.e. one parent has diplomatic status, or the parent is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place controlled by the enemy), and would otherwise be stateless.

Person has been lawfully resident in Lesotho for at least 5 years. Other conditions: age at least 21 years, no mental incapacity, adequate knowledge of Sotho or English, good character, financially solvent, renounce other citizenship. If a Commonwealth citizen, the person does not need to show that s/he is financially solvent.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully resident in Lesotho for at least 5 years.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Adequate knowledge of Sotho or English required
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Financially solvent (unless person is a Commonwealth citizen), not have mental incapacity.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person marries a citizen and has continuously and lawfully stayed in Lesotho in cohabitation with his/her spouse.
Person is the minor child, including an adopted child or child under legal guardianship, of a citizen. Other conditions: lawfully resident for at least 5 years, and good character.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person was married to a citizen who has died and who would have been entitled to citizenship acquisition under mode A08.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person lost or renounced citizenship upon acquisition or retention of another citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is stateless and has been lawfully resident in Lesotho for at least 3 years. Other conditions: no criminal conviction to sentence of more than 5 years in prison.
Person is born in Lithuania to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is found or living in Lithuania of unknown parentage.
Person is born, in Lithuania or abroad, to stateless parents legally residing in Lithuania.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born to a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has legally resided in Lithuania for the last 10 years and has the right of permanent residence. Other conditions: proficiency in language of Lithuania, legal source of support, knowledge of basic provisions of the Constitution, renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country, no circumstances by reason of which citizenship shall not be granted, e.g. person committed international crimes such as aggression, genocide, crimes against humanity and war crime.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has legally resided in Lithuania for the last 10 years and has the right of permanent residence.
Renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country.
Proficiency in language of Lithuania required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of basic provisions of the Constitution required.
No circumstances by reason of which citizenship shall not be granted should be present, e.g. person committed international crimes such as aggression, genocide, crimes against humanity and war crime.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has legal source of support.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has legally resided in Lithuania for the last 7 years. For a person married to a citizen of the Republic of Lithuania who is a deportee or political prisoner to be resident together with his or her spouse in the Republic of Lithuania for the last 5 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except legal source of support).
Person is adopted by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Parent was a citizen, but died before the child was born.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person is under 14 years of age. If a person is between 14 and 18 years of age, his/her consent is required.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen, or a descendant of the said citizen. The citizenship is reacquired through restoration or reinstatement. Persons who held citizenship of the Republic of Lithuania before 15 June 1940 and their descendants, who have not acquired citizenship of the Republic of Lithuania before the entry into force of this Law, shall have an indefinite right to reinstate citizenship of the Republic of Lithuania, irrespective of whether they are permanently resident in the Republic of Lithuania or in any other state.

Person is of Lithuanian descent, is not a citizen of another country, and has never been a citizen of Lithuania. There are also no circumstances by reason of which citizenship shall not be granted, e.g. person committed international crimes such as aggression, genocide, crimes against humanity and war crime.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: LIT 18(4). The law (No XII-269) of 25 May 2013 provided that there is Paragraph 5 of Article 18 (not Paragraph 4 of Article 18).
specification: Person is a recognised refugee and resident in Lithuania. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: A child of stateless persons or a child whose one parent  are legally permanently resident in the Republic of Lithuania shall be a citizen of the Republic of Lithuania, irrespective of whether he was born in or outside the territory of the Republic of Lithuania, provided he has not acquired citizenship of another state at birth.

Person makes a substantial contribution to strengthening Lithuanian statehood, to increasing the country's power and to promoting its authority in the international community. Other conditions: proof of integration or permanent residence.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Luxembourg to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Luxembourg to a person who was also born there.
Person is found in Luxembourg of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Luxembourg to parents who are stateless or unable to transfer their citizenship.
Person is a minor and descent from a citizen is established. Parent must be a citizen at the time of establishment.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification:
Person born in Luxembourg to foreign nationals acquires Luxembourgish nationality automatically when he/she reaches the age of 18 if 1) he/she has resided in Luxembourg for at least five consecutive years before their 18th birthday, and 2) one of their parents who is non-Luxembourgish resided in Luxembourg for at least 12 consecutive months prior to the child's birth.; 
Person can acquire nationality by declaration at the age of 12 if he/she has resided at least 5 consecutive years in Luxembourg (last year of which without interruption) and his/her parents resided in Luxembourg for at least 12 consecutive months prior to the child's birth.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has resided in Luxembourg for 5 years before the application (last year preceding application without interruption). Other conditions: pass a language test and attend course 'Living together in the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg' or pass the test of this course, absence of a criminal record of a certain kind.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has resided in Luxembourg for 5 years before the application (last year preceding application without interruption).
Person must pass a language test.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person must attend course 'Living together in the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg' or pass the test of this course.
Absence of certain crimes on a criminal record required.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person must have had seven years of schooling in a Luxembourg public school and 1 year of residence preceding the application.
category: Restricted to period of schooling in country

specification: Person must pass a language evaluation test and have attended course 'Living together in the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg' or have passed the test of this course. If person is a non-resident, three years of marriage preceding the application is required.
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
Person is a former citizen 'by origin'. Other conditions: good reputation (no false statements, no criminal offences). No residence requirement until the end of 2020 (LUX 89).;
A woman who lost citizenship (obtained by origin, option, or naturalisation)  can reacquire it through the registrar of her last place of residence in Luxembourg (no residence required)

Person is a recognised refugee or has 'statut de protection subsidiaire'. Person has been resident in Luxembourg for 5 years before the application(last year before application without interruption). Other conditions: pass a language evaluation test and have attended course 'Living together in the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg' or have passed the test of this course.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has rendered exceptional services to Luxembourg.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a volunteer soldier having served at least one years. Condition: certificate of good and loyal services of chief commander.
Person is born in Latvia to two citizens, or to one citizen and LAT 9(2) or 9(5) (regarding dual citizenship) are complied with.
Person is born abroad to two citizens, or to one citizen and LAT 9(2) or 9(5) (regarding dual citizenship) is complied with.
Person is found in Latvia of unknown parentage, or person is left without parental care or is an orphan and is under extra-familial care in Latvia.

category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Latvia for 5 years and has reached the age of 15. Other conditions: proficiency in language of Latvia, knowledge of basic principles of the Constitution, national anthem and history of the country (but exceptions under LAT 21), legal income and no due taxes, pledge of loyalty to Latvia, renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country, and no further restrictions (see LAT 11). Exemption from renunciation requirement applies to nationals of a Member State of the EU, the EFTA or NATO, Australia, Brazil or New Zealand, or a country with which Latvia has concluded a dual citizenship agreement. Decision regarding naturalisation is made by the Cabinet of Ministers and cannot be appealed.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Latvia for 5 years.

Renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country required. Exemption from renunciation requirement applies to nationals of a Member State of the EU, the EFTA or NATO, Australia, Brazil or New Zealand, or a country with which Latvia has concluded a dual citizenship agreement.
Proficiency in language of Latvia required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of basic principles of the Constitution, national anthem and history of the country, and pledge of loyalty to Latvia required. Pledge loyalty to Latvia.
Legal income and no due taxes.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor, permanently resident in Latvia, and his/her father or mother is acquiring citizenship (child must consent if between the age of 14-18). Agreement from both parents is required if the other parent remains a citizen of another country. Other condition: renunciation of citizenship of another country (unless person is a national of a Member State of the EU, the EFTA or NATO, Australia, Brazil or New Zealand, or a country with which Latvia has concluded a dual citizenship agreement).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
Person is a former citizen under the age of 25 who lost citizenship as a result of a choice made by his/her parents or adopters without his/her written consent, except if the person has acquired citizenship of a country not explicitly listed in the Citizenship Act and to which the restrictions of LAT 11 apply (except the restrictions on military service).; 
Person whose citizenship was withdrawn under mode of loss L06 may only reacquire citizenship 5 years after the period for appealing the withdrawal or a court judgment rejecting the appeal have passed. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a national of a Member State of the EU, the EFTA or NATO, Australia, Brazil or New Zealand, or a country with which Latvia has concluded a dual citizenship agreement. Decision regarding naturalisation is made by the Cabinet of Ministers and cannot be appealed. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation requirement).
Person has rendered special meritorious service for the benefit of Latvia. Other condition: no further restrictions (see LAT 11).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Morocco to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person is a minor who is born in Morocco and whose father was also born in the country. Other conditions: person resides in Morocco and the father comes from a country of Arab and Muslim majority and also belongs to this group.
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person has been resident in the country for at least 5 years. Other conditions: sufficient knowledge of Arabic, has an income, good character, not been convicted for certain crimes, and no disabilities.

specification: Person has been resident in the country for at least 5 years.

category: Language requirement without certification or test

category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person must have an income and may not have disabilities.

category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is the child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Child acquires citizenship at the same time as the parent.

specification: Person has lost his/her citizenship and wishes to regain it.

Person is born in Moldova to at least one of the parents who is stateless or a beneficiary of international protection.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is under the guardianship of parents at least one of whom is a citizen. Other condition: renunciation of citizenship of another citizenship (unless person is stateless).
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is 18 years or older, was born in Moldova, and is not yet registered by the authorities as a citizen of Moldova and does not hold proof of citizenship.
