specification: Person has been resident in Moldova for 10 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the official language and the provisions of the Constitution of Moldova (citizenship test), legal sources of income. Grant of citizenship can be refused if person has committed international or military crimes or crimes against humanity, was involved in terrorist activity, has been sentenced to imprisonment and has a criminal record or is under criminal investigation, carries out activities that threaten state security, public order, health or morality, or in the process of acquiring or regaining citizenship, presents false information or hides some pertinent data.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Moldova for 10 years.
Person has knowledge of the official language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person has knowledge of the provisions of the Constitution of Moldova (citizenship test).

Grant of citizenship can be refused if person has committed international or military crimes or crimes against humanity, was involved in terrorist activity, has been sentenced to imprisonment and has a criminal record or is under criminal investigation, or carries out activities that threaten state security, public order, health or morality.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has legal sources of income.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has resided in Moldova for 5 years before the age of 18. Other conditions: knowledge of the official language and the provisions of the Constitution of Moldova (citizenship test), legal sources of income. Grant of citizenship can be refused for conditions as per AO6.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for 3 years. Other conditions: see mode A06.
Person has been resident in Moldova for 3 years with a parent who is a citizen. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen. If one adopting parent is not a citizen, a joint decision is required on the child's citizenship. Child's consent is required if he/she is 14 years or older.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person has been resident in Moldova for 3 years with a child who is a citizen. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is the spouse of a person who acquired citizenship on the basis of A24 and contributes to Public Investment Fund for Sustainable Development.
Person is under the age of 18 and is born to a parent who is acquiring citizenship by reacquisition or naturalisation.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person may reacquire citizenship provided he/she does not fulfil one of the criteria for refusal of citizenship (see A06) or citizenship has previously been withdrawn.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a beneficiary of humanitarian protection or political asylum and has been resident in Moldova for 8 years. Loss or renunciation of citizenship of another country is required except in cases where this is not possible or cannot be reasonably requested. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised stateless person and has been resident in Moldova for 8 years. Other conditions: see mode A06
Person is an exceptional case whose acquisition of citizenship is in the interests of Moldova, provided he/she does not fulfil one of the criteria for refusal of citizenship (see A06).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Madagascar to a citizen
Person is born  to a parent who is a citizen.

Person is born in Madagascar to unknown parents of whom at least one can be presumed to have been Madagascan. Factors that can be taken into account are the name of the child, physical characteristics, caretakers, education and living environment. Newborn child found in Madagascar is presumed to have been born there.
category: Group restriction: only if person is (apparent) member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Descent does not have any effect unless recognised under the conditions established by civil law.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for 5 years. Other conditions: sound mind, not a danger to the community because of state of health, good character and not convicted to sentence of more than 1 year in prison nor for crime of dishonesty, assimilated to the community notably through knowledge of Madagascan language.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for 5 years.
Person must be assimilated to the community notably through knowledge of Madagascan language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must be assimilated to the community
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is a woman married to a citizen and declares the desire to acquire citizenship, or the woman automatically loses her original citizenship or she is stateless. Government may oppose acquisition within 2 years on grounds that the woman is undeserving or of serious mental or physical incapacity.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is adopted by a citizen, opts for citizenship before majority, and has been resident for at least 5 years. Other conditions: the government may oppose acquisition on grounds that the child is undeserving, is not sufficiently assimilated, or has serious mental or physical incapacity.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the wife of a foreigner who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: child is not married, has not served in the army of the country of origin, and is not subject to a decree opposing acquisition.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is former citizen who is resident in Madagascar and was not deprived of citizenship (unless s/he rendered exceptional services).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered important services to Madagascar. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence period).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen otherwise than by descent.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is a child found in Mexico of unknown parentage. Child will be presumed to have a Mexican father and mother.

Person has been resident in Mexico for 5 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country (only after citizenship has been granted), knowledge of Spanish language, knowledge of Mexican history and integration in the national culture (both not applicable to minors and persons older than 60), no prison sentence for a criminal act committed in Mexico or abroad, and oath of loyalty.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Mexico for 5 years immediately prior to the application.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country (only after citizenship has been granted).

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Knowledge of Mexican history and integration in the national culture (both not applicable to minors and persons older than 60).
No prison sentence for a criminal act committed in Mexico or abroad.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has been resident in Mexico, with common household, for 2 years immediately prior to the application and with no more than 6 months of total absence due to residence abroad. Residence requirement is waived if citizen works abroad in public service of Mexico.

Person is an adopted minor or a minor descendant to the second degree, the citizen-parent exercises parental authority, and the person has been resident in Mexico for 1 year continuously prior to the application. Person can apply him/herself within 1 year after reaching the age of majority if the citizen exercising parental authority did not do so while person was a minor. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person has been resident in Mexico for 2 years and is a direct descendant of a citizen by birth (exemption from residence requirement is possible under certain circumstances), or has Mexican children who are citizens by birth. Other conditions: see A06. No residence requirement applies if the person is a second-degree descendant of a citizen by birth, and neither has another citizenship nor is recognised by another state.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to relatives in ascending and descending line)

specification: Person acquired another citizenship before 1997 and thereby lost Mexican citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been resident in Mexico for 2 years and is a citizen of a country in Latin American or the Iberian peninsula. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is a refugee. Other conditions: see A06 (except the requirements on knowledge of Mexican history and integration in the national culture).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been resident in Mexico for 2 years (requirement can be waived) and has been beneficial to the country (e.g. in the fields of culture, sports).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person born after effective date of Constitution (1 May 1979) is a citizen if at date of birth either parent is a citizen.
Person born after effective date of Constitution (1 May 1979) is a citizen if at date of birth either parent is a citizen.
Person born after date of Constitution (1 May 1979) is a citizen if born in RMI and is not at birth entitled to be or become a citizen of another country.

Person is ordinarily resident in RMI for 10 years, good character, speak and understand Marshallese (written test), understanding and respect for the customs and traditions of RMI, means of support, reasonable knowledge and understanding of the Constitution of the Marshall Islands and the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizenship, renounce foreign citizenship, oath of allegiance, pass written test. Cabinet decides applications for naturalisation, legislation imposes a quota of not more than 10 naturalisations per year.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Ordinarily resident in RMI for 10 years
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Person must speak and understand Marshallese (written test).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Understanding and respect for the customs and traditions of RMI. Reasonable knowledge and understanding of the Constitution of the Marshall Islands and the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizenship (written test).

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person can apply to High Court for citizenship by registration if adopted under the laws of the Marshall Islands as a child by a person then a citizen and has been resident in RMI for at least 5 years. If over 18, required to take oath and renounce other citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

article: Constitution Art XI, s 2(1)(b), Citizenship Act 1984 <a4>410, 411
specification: Person has been resident for three years and is a parent of a child who is a citizen. The High Court considers applications for registration. The Cabinet or the Minister may issue a certificate that the person is a fit and proper person in interests of national security. The High Court is not to grant registration unless satisfied person is not a threat, danger or risk to national security. Citizen by registration must renounce other citizenship.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: A child may be named in an application for citizenship by naturalisation. A statement from the other parent that he or she also wishes the child to become a citizen is required.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Citizen of the former Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands (administered by the United States) becomes a citizen of RMI if his or her parents had land rights in Marshall Islands.

Criteria: Distinguished service to the Republic or conferral of citizenship in the public interest, residence in RMI. Person need not renounce other citizenship and may maintain dual citizenship. Cabinet decides on applications and legislation imposes a quota of not more than 5 naturalisations per year.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Macedonia to a citizen (unless only one of the parents is a citizen and the parents decide that the child acquires the citizenship of another country).
Person is found or born in Macedonia of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Macedonia to parents of unknown citizenship or without citizenship.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Macedonia for at least 8 years. Other conditions: housing and permanent source of income, no convictions in Macedonia or another country of which the person is a national for committing a crime that carries a prison sentence of 1 year or more, no criminal procedure initiated in either of those countries, not sentenced to a measure prohibiting residence in Macedonia, no threat to national security or defense, knowledge of language of Macedonia and oath of loyalty, renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Macedonia for at least 8 years.
Renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country required.
Knowledge of language of Macedonia required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: No convictions in Macedonia or another country of which the person is a national for committing a crime that carries a prison sentence of 1 year or more, no criminal procedure initiated in either of those countries, not sentenced to a measure prohibiting residence in Macedonia, no threat to national security or defense.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Housing and permanent source of income required.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for at least 3 years and has been resident in Macedonia for at least 1 year. Other conditions: see A06 (except language proficiency and renunciation requirement). Or person has been the spouse of a citizen for at least 8 years, permanently resides abroad, and has a genuine bond with Macedonia. Other conditions: see A06 (except language proficiency and renunciation requirement).
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a direct descendant of the 1st generation of a former citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation requirement and 8 years of residence in Macedonia).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor both whose parents are naturalising in Macedonia, or one parent is naturalising and requests citizenship for the child who is resident in Macedonia, or both parents request citizenship for the child irrespective of where the child resides. Consent is required if the child is over 15. The child's application must be submitted simultaneously with that of the parent(s).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
Person is a former citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (except renunciation requirement and 8 years of residence in Macedonia).;
Person lost citizenship as a minor due to renunciation, and has uninterruptedly resided in Macedonia for at least 3 years before the age of 25.
Person is a recognised refugee and has been permanently resident in Macedonia for at least 6 years since the recognition of refugee status. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a stateless person and has been permanently resident in Macedonia for at least 6 years since the determination that he/she has no citizenship. Other conditions: see A06.

Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the special (scientific, economic, cultural, sports or other) national interest of Macedonia. Other conditions: no threat to security or defense of the country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person invested significant capital in Macedonia. Other conditions: no threat to security or defense of the country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Mali to a citizen. (Complicated conditions apply to those born in and out of wedlock, with requirements to establish descent, but the overall effect is to allow transmission if mother or father is a citizen.)

Person is born abroad to a citizen. (Complicated conditions apply to those born in and out of wedlock, with requirements to establish descent, but the overall effect is to allow transmission if mother or father is a citizen.)
Person is born in Mali to a parent also born there who is a citizen of another African state.
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born in Mali to unknown parents. Newborn child found in Mali is presumed born there.
Person is a child who is the subject of an adoption by descent (adoption filiation) by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person was born in Mali and has been habitually resident for 5 years and makes a declaration within 6 months of majority.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been habitually resident for at least 10 years. Other conditions: good character, mental health, integrated into Malian community, not convicted to sentence of more than 1 year imprisonment.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for at least 10 years.
Person must be integrated into Malian community
Person must be integrated into Malian community
Person must be of good character, not convicted to sentence of more than 1 year imprisonment.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is married to a citizen unless s/he declines citizenship. Government may oppose within 1 year of marriage.
Person is the minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen and is habitually resident in Mali. Other conditions: consideration by Council of Ministers of the reasons for which the person lost citizenship.
Person is born in Malta and in wedlock to a citizen, or out of wedlock to a mother who is a citizen.
Person is born abroad and in wedlock to a citizen who has acquired citizenship otherwise than by descent, or out of wedlock to a mother who is a citizen.
Person is newborn infant found in Malta of unknown parentage.

Person is born in Malta and has been stateless since birth, is habitually resident in the country for 5 years, and not convicted in any country of an offence against the security of Malta or convicted for a crime which carries a prison sentence of 5 years or more.

Person has been resident in Malta for at least 5 of the past 7 years preceding the application. Other conditions: adequate knowledge of Maltese or English language, good character and deemed suitable to be a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Malta for at least 5 of the past 7 years preceding the application.
Adequate knowledge of Maltese or English language required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must have good character and be deemed suitable to be a citizen.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person has been married to a citizen for five years and is still married and living with the spouse at the time of the application (or, if separated, with common household for 5 years). No residence requirement if spouse of person acquires citizenship due to exceptional service (mode A24).
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is born in Malta to a former citizen who was also born there, who emigrated from Malta and lost citizenship due to acquisition of citizenship of another country
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen who dies before the 5th year of marriage. Person may apply for citizenship following the lapse of the 5th year from the date of marriage, provided that up to the time of death the spouses were living together.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification:
Person was a citizen (by birth, descent or at the point of Maltese independence) who lost citizenship before 10 February, 2000 due to the acquisition or retention of citizenship of another country and who resided abroad for an aggregate period of 6 years. Or the person is a former citizen and takes up permanent residence, but not if citizenship was originally obtained through registration or naturalisation.;
Person was originally a citizen by registration or naturalisation, but re-acquisition may be denied if it is considered contrary to the public interest. Or the person was a citizen by birth/descent before emigration and failed to maintain citizenship because he/she ceased to be a citizen of the United Kingdom and Colonies on Independence Day.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered exceptional services to Malta or to humanity. Other conditions: oath of allegiance.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person invested a combined amount of 0.8 million euros and owns property valued at 0.35 million euros (or rents property at 16,000 euros p/a). Other conditions: 1 year effective residence in Malta, proof of moral standing, clean criminal record, health certificate and insurance, and oath of allegiance.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Myanmar to a parent who is a citizen and the other parent is either also a citizen, associate citizen or 'naturalised' citizen. Or the person is a 3rd generation descendant from 'naturalised' (grand)parents (i.e. person is born to parents both of whom were 'naturalised' citizens and/or associate citizens, and the person's grandparents were 'naturalised' citizens).

Person is born abroad to a parent who is a citizen and the other parent is either also a citizen, associate citizen or 'naturalised' citizen. Or the person is a 3rd generation descendant from 'naturalised' (grand)parents (i.e. person is born to parents both of whom were 'naturalised' citizens and/or associate citizens, and the person's grandparents were 'naturalised' citizens).

Person can become a 'naturalised' citizen if s/he is the only and lawful spouse of a citizen and has been continuously resident in Myanmar for 3 years. Other conditions: good character and sound mind.

Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring associate citizenship or 'naturalised' citizenship and the child is mentioned in the parent's application. If the child has reached the age of 18, s/he must take a separate oath of allegiance, or s/he must do so within 1 year of reaching the age of 18. The child will, following the parent, either become an associate citizen or a 'naturalised' citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is born in Montenegro to a citizen.
Person is found in Montenegro of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Montenegro to parents of unknown citizenship or stateless.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been resident in Montenegro for 10 years uninterrupted immediately before the application. Other conditions: renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country, no convictions for committing a crime that carries a prison sentence of 1 year or more, housing and source of income sufficient for material and social welfare, command of language of Montenegro, no threat to the security of the country, fulfiled tax and other legal obligations.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Montenegro for 10 years uninterrupted immediately before the application.
Renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country required.
Command of language of Montenegro required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person may not be a threat to the security of the country.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person must have fulfiled tax and other legal obligations.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has resided uninterruptedly for 10 years in Montenegro before the age of 18 (place of birth is irrelevant). Other conditions: see A06 (except language competence, and proof of accommodation and income).
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen for 3 years and has been resident in Montenegro for 5 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except loss/renunciation of citizenship of another country and language competence).

Person is a minor both whose parents acquire citizenship by naturalisation, or the parent with whom the child uninterruptedly resides is naturalised. Other conditions: loss or renunciation of another citizenship. Consent is required if child is over the age of 14.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification:
Person is adopted by a citizen and does not have citizenship of another country.;

Person is adopted by a naturalised citizen in a weak adoption, resides in Montenegro, and does not have or renounces citizenship of another country. Consent is required if the person is over the age of 14.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a descendant up to the 3rd generation of a former citizen and has resided in Montenegro for 2 years immediately before the request for naturalisation, or the person was married to a citizen for 3 years (before death of the spouse) and has been resident in Montenegro for 5 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except loss/renunciation of citizenship of another country and language competence).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor both of whose parents are naturalising in Montenegro, or the parent with whom the child uninterruptedly resides is naturalising. Other conditions: loss or renunciation of another citizenship. Consent is required if child is over the age of 14. Child's application must be submitted simultaneously with that of parent(s).
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
Person is a former citizen or their descendant up to the 3rd generation who has resided in Montenegro for 2 years immediately before the naturalisation request. Other conditions: see A06 (except loss/renunciation of citizenship of another citizenship and language competence).;

Person is a former citizen who has lost citizenship due to acquisition of citizenship of another country while resident abroad. Other conditions: loss or renunciation of another citizenship, 1 year uninterrupted residence immediately before the declaration, no threat to the security of Montenegro.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a recognised refugee in Montenegro. Other conditions: see A06 (except housing and sufficient source of income, and language competence).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is stateless and has been resident in Montenegro for 10 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except loss/renunciation of citizenship of another citizenship, housing and sufficient source of income, and language competence).
Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in special (state, economic, cultural, scientific, sports or other) interest of Montenegro.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the special economic interest of Montenegro.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Mongolia to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to two citizens to a citizen and a stateless person, or to a citizen and a foreigner and the parents request the child to acquire Mongolian citizenship by written agreement.
Person is found in Mongolia to unidentified parents.
Person was born to parents who were both stateless and permanently residing in Mongolia, and s/he expresses the wish to acquire citizenship after the age of 16.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Mongolia for 5 years. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country, sufficient means for self-support, proper knowledge of Mongolian customs and language, not commit any criminal acts during the 5-year period, and acquisition of citizenship may not prejudice the reputation and interests of Mongolia. Mongolian citizenship shall be refused if person (1) committed a crime against humanity, (2) conducted an activity against the national security or vital interests of Mongolia, (3) has been claimed as a member of an international terrorist organisation, (4) has been determined by court to be a dangerous criminal, (5) is serving a sentence, (6) has been deported from the territory of Mongolia, and (7) when the person advertises a religion that inconsistent with the Mongolian national customs and law.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been permanently resident in Mongolia for 5 years.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Proper knowledge of Mongolian customs and language required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Proper knowledge of Mongolian customs and language required.

Person may not have committed any criminal acts during the 5-year period, and acquisition of citizenship may not prejudice the reputation and interests of Mongolia. Mongolian citizenship shall be refused if person (1) committed a crime against humanity, (2) conducted an activity against the national security or vital interests of Mongolia, (3) has been claimed as a member of an international terrorist organisation, (4) has been determined by court to be a dangerous criminal, (5) is serving a sentence, (6) has been deported from the territory of Mongolia, and (7) when the person advertises a religion that inconsistent with the Mongolian national customs and law.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person must have sufficient means for self-support.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor under the age of 16 both whose parents are acquiring citizenship. If only one parent is acquiring citizenship, the minor under the age of 16 may acquire citizenship based on a request (in the form of a written well-founded agreement) by the parents. Minor's written consent is required if s/he is between the age of 16-18.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship after being adopted by foreign citizens, shared in the loss of citizenship by the parents (reacquisition is possible only within 5 years after reaching the age of 18), or the person was a citizen at any time after 11 July 1921 and acquired citizenship of another country.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has 'done an honour' for Mongolia, has a much-needed profession or relevant experience for Mongolia, or has been or will likely be exceptionally successful in any field of science. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to residence, means for self-support, and knowledge of customs and language).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is child of a citizen working for the Mozambican state.; Person is the child of a citizen and declares through legal representatives or on own behalf, during the year after s/he turns 18, that s/he wishes to be Mozambican.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Mozambique after independence. Other conditions: if one parent is in the employment of another country, the person must declare that s/he wishes to be Mozambican either through legal representatives or on own behalf, during the year after s/he turns 18.
Person is born in Mozambique of one parent also born there.
Person is born in Mozambique to parents who are stateless or of unknown citizenship.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Mozambique for at least 10 years. Other conditions: know Portuguese or a Mozambican language, have full capacity and can ensure own subsistence, and civil probity.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident in Mozambique for at least 10 years.
Person must know Portuguese or a Mozambican language
category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been married to a citizen for at least 5 years.
Person is fully adopted by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the minor unmarried child of a person who has acquired citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who establishes domicile in Mozambique and fulfils other requirements established by law.;Person is a female former citizen who lost her Mozambican citizenship due to marriage to a foreigner (no further requirements).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered relevant service to the State. Other requirements: see A06 (except residence and language requirement).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Mauritania to a citizen.

Person is born abroad and father is a citizen.;Person is born abroad and mother is a citizen. Registration required during the year before he/she reaches the age of majority. Authorities may oppose registration.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person born in Mauritania to unknown parents.

category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has lived in Mauritania for at least 10 years. Other conditions: fluent in one of the official languages, good character and physical health.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has lived in Mauritania for at least 10 years.
Person must be fluent in one of the official languages.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person must be of good physical health.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the female spouse of a male citizen, has been married for at least five years, and has resided in Mauritania for at least five years.;Person is the male spouse of a female citizen follows (conditions under A06 apply except that residence requirement is reduced to five years).
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Person's paternal grandfather was a citizen of Mauritania.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has special skills. Other conditions: see A06 (except that residence requirement is reduced to five years).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Mauritius to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen who was born in Mauritius.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is a newborn child found abandoned in Mauritius.

Person has been resident for at least 5 years during the previous 7 years, including 12 months preceding the application. Other conditions: good character, adequate knowledge of English or any other language current in Mauritius and of the responsibilities of a citizen, renounce other citizenship. Modified conditions apply to Commonwealth citizens (MAU 5).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident for at least 5 years during the previous 7 years, including 12 months preceding the application.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Adequate knowledge of English or any other language current in Mauritius required
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Adequate knowledge of the responsibilities of a citizen required
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is married to a citizen. Other conditions: has been living with spouse in Mauritius for at least 4 years, and it is not in the interests of national security or public policy not to grant citizenship.
Person is the minor child of a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor child who is the subject of an adoption order and the adopter, or in case of a joint adoption the male adopter, is a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is married to a person who is acquiring citizenship. Other conditions: has been living with spouse in Mauritius for at least 4 years, and it is not in the interests of national security or public policy not to grant citizenship.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (with residence requirement)

specification: Person lost citizenship on acquiring another, or on marriage or and the marriage ends, and is ordinarily resident in Mauritius. If not ordinarily resident in Mauritius restoration of citizenship is discretionary.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has invested at least USD 500,000 in Mauritius. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence period may be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Malawi to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person is born in Malawi and has always been stateless or one of parents was a citizen of Malawi at the time of birth, and has been ordinarily resident for at least 3 years. Other conditions: not convicted of an offence or detained for behaviour prejudicial to public security nor sentenced to imprisonment for 5 years.

Person has been ordinarily resident for at least 7 years. Other conditions: adequate knowledge of vernacular language or English, good character, financially solvent, would be a suitable citizen, renounce other citizenship. Similar but modified terms (financial solvency not required) apply to Commonwealth citizens and citizens of certain African states (MWI 13-14).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been ordinarily resident for at least 7 years.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Adequate knowledge of vernacular language or English required
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is financially solvent. Financial solvency not required for Commonwealth citizens and citizens of certain African states (MWI 13-14).
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a citizen and has been ordinarily resident for 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of a vernacular language or English, good character, suitable citizen, and renounce other citizenship.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of a citizen and ordinarily resident in Malawi. Other conditions: adequate knowledge of vernacular language or English, good character, and suitable citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is the wife of a deceased citizen and has been ordinarily resident for 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of a vernacular language or English, good character, suitable citizen, and renounce other citizenship.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person lost or was deprived of citizenship, and minister considers it desirable in all the circumstances of the case. Other conditions: renounce other citizenship.

Person has a close connection to Malawi, through birth in Malawi and ordinary residence for at least 20 years. Or person has permanent residence in Malawi and born in Malawi or in Mozambique north of the Zambezi river and both parents born in Malawi or in Mozambique north of the Zambezi river. Other conditions: ordinarily resident 5 years, knowledge of a vernacular language or English, good character, suitable citizen, renounce other citizenship.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is conferred citizenship by the minister in such special circumstances as he in his discretion thinks fit.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: Const 14(1)b, Second Schedule Part II (1)a, Second Schedule Part III 17
specification: Person is born in Malaysia to a citizenship mother or in wedlock to a citizen father.

article: Const 14(1)b, Second Schedule Part II, (1)b-c, Second Schedule Part III 17; Administrative amendment to Const 15(2)
specification: Person is born abroad to a father who is a citizen and was born in Malaysia, to a father who is a citizen and resident abroad in the service of the government, or to a father who is a citizen and the child is registered with the Malaysian authorities within 1 year after birth.; Person is under the age of 21 years and was born abroad to a mother who is a citizen and a father who is not a citizen.

article: Const 14(1)b, Second Schedule Part II under (1)a, 2
specification: Person is born in Malaysia to a permanently resident foreigner. Unless born to a father who is a foreign diplomat, or the father is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.

Person is under the age of 21 deemed fit by the Federal Government under special circumstances. (Note:  During parliamentary debates in 1962 when the government introduced Article 15A, it was clarified that 'special circumstances' referred to a 'child who probably has no parents here' or who <d2>obviously has attachment to the country<d3> as a citizen.)

Person is born in Malaysia and does not acquire citizenship of another country. Unless born to a father who is a foreign diplomat, or the father is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.

Person has been resident in Malaysia for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was resident (holding Malaysian permanent resident status) in the country for 10 out of 12 years prior to the application. Other conditions: good character, adequate knowledge of Malay language, intent to make Malaysia his/her permanent home, and oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Malaysia for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was resident (holding Malaysian permanent resident status) in the country for 10 out of 12 years prior to the application.

category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the female spouse of a male citizen and has been resident in Malaysia (holding Malaysian permanent resident status) for 2 years immediately preceding the application and intends to do so permanently. Other conditions: good character and oath of allegiance.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is under the age of 21 and the child of a citizen (or a person who was a citizen at his/her death). Application needs to be made by the parent or guardian.  Other conditions: oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is born in Namibia to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen and birth is registered with consular authorities.

Person is born in Namibia to a person who is ordinarily resident at the time of birth. Other conditions: parents are not enjoying diplomatic immunity, nor represent another country, nor members of any police or military unit seconded for service in Namibia, nor illegal immigrants.
Person is born in Namibia to a parent who is ordinarily resident in Namibia, and would otherwise be stateless.

Person has been lawfully and ordinarily resident for at least 10 years. Other conditions: good character, adequate knowledge of responsibilities and privileges of Namibian citizenship, willing to renounce citizenship of another country, not convicted of an offence listed in schedule to act.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been lawfully and ordinarily resident for at least 10 years.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Adequate knowledge of responsibilities and privileges of Namibian citizenship required
Person must be of good character, not convicted of an offence listed in schedule to act.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person has been married to a citizen for at least 10 years.
Person is a minor child  who is adopted by a citizen and birth is registered in accordance with the requirements listed in the act.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the unmarried minor child of a person who is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who applies for restoration of citizenship.

category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in wedlock in Niger to a citizen, or person is born out of wedlock in Niger and parent to whom descent is established is a citizen.
Person is born in wedlock outside Niger to a citizen, or person is born out of wedlock outside Niger and parent to whom descent is established is a citizen.
Person is born in Niger to a parent who was also born there.
Person is born in Niger to unknown parents. A newborn infant found in Niger is presumed born there.
Person is a child who is the subject of a legitimating adoption by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for at least 10 years. Other conditions: good character, not sentenced to imprisonment.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for at least 10 years.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is married to a citizen. Other conditions: 3 years residence in Niger after marriage, good character, not involved in banditry or trafficking in drugs or other illegal activity, sufficient means, integrated into Niger society.

Person is the minor child born in wedlock or legitimised of a parent who is acquiring citizenship, or person is the minor child born out of wedlock whose parent to whom descent is established is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who was not deprived of citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has rendered exceptional services. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence period may be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Nigeria to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person has resided in Nigeria for a continuous period of 15 years, or has resided for 1 year prior to application and 15 years over previous 20 years. Other conditions: good character, in opinion of governor of state where to be resident is acceptable to the local community and assimilated into the way of life of people in that part of the Federation, capable of making a useful contribution to the advancement of Nigeria, renunciation of other citizenship (unless applicant is a citizen by birth in the other country).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has resided in Nigeria for a continuous period of 15 years, or has resided for 1 year prior to application and 15 years over previous 20 years
category: More than 10 years of residence required

specification: Renunciation is required unless applicant is a citizen by birth in the other country.
Person is assimilated into the way of life of people in that part of the Federation.
Person has good character, in opinion of governor of state where to be resident is acceptable to the local community.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is capable of making a useful contribution to the advancement of Nigeria.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a woman married to a citizen. Other conditions: good character, intention to be domiciled in Nigeria. Must renounce another citizenship that is not a citizenship from birth.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is born in Nigeria to a grandparent who is a citizen by birth.; Person is born outside Nigeria to a grandparent who is a citizen and applies to be registered, is of good character and intends to be domiciled in Nigeria.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a grandchild of a citizen

specification: Person is born in Nicaragua to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Nicaragua. Unless born to foreign diplomats, foreign employees of international organizations, or those sent by their national governments to work in Nicaragua.
Person is an infant found in Nicaragua of unknown parentage.

article: Const 19, NIC 53, Art. 112 Execute Decree 31/2012, Art. 125 Execute Decree 31/2012
specification: Person has been resident in Nicaragua for a continuous period of 4 years since being granted a permanent resident permit. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country, certificate of good conduct (provided by police) and language test (except persons who have studied in Nicaragua, elderly persons and persons with certain disabilities or health conditions).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

article: Const 19, NIC 53, Art. 112 Execute Decree 31/2012, Art. 125 Execute Decree 31/2012
specification: Person has been resident in Nicaragua for a continuous period of 4 years since being granted a permanent resident permit.
category: Less than 5 years of residence required

article: Const 19, NIC 53, Art. 112 Execute Decree 31/2012, Art. 125 Execute Decree 31/2012
specification: Renunciation of citizenship of another country required (except if person is a national by birth of Spain or a Central American country (see A18).

article: Const 19, NIC 53, Art. 112 Execute Decree 31/2012, Art. 125 Execute Decree 31/2012
specification: Language test (except persons who have studied in Nicaragua, elderly persons and persons with certain disabilities or health conditions).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

article: Const 19, NIC 53, Art. 112 Execute Decree 31/2012, Art. 125 Execute Decree 31/2012
