specification: Person has been permanently resident in Nicaragua for 2 years as the spouse of a citizen.
Person has Nicaraguan children and has been permanently resident in Nicaragua for 2 years.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is born abroad to a parent who once held citizenship and requests for citizenship upon reaching the age of majority or upon emancipation.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor under the age of 21 whose parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation and has parental authority over the child. Child must choose between Nicaraguan citizenship and the citizenship of origin upon reaching the age of majority or upon emancipation.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a citizen by naturalisation who lost citizenship due to acquisition of a foreign citizenship, express renunciation or using both citizenships to enter and exit Nicaragua.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen by birth of a Central American country or a Spanish citizen by birth and has been permanently resident in Nicaragua for 2 years. No requirement to renounce the other citizenship.

Person has performed extraordinary services to Nicaragua. Under this mode the person becomes a citizen by birth.;
Person has been permanently resident in Nicaragua for 2 years, and has established an industry or exercises an activity that contributes to the economic, social or cultural development of the country. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in the Netherlands to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person is born to a parent who is resident in the Netherlands at the time of the person's birth and who was him/herself also born to a parent who was resident in the Netherlands at the time of his/her birth. Person must also be resident in the Netherlands at the time of birth.
Person is a minor who is found in the Netherlands or aboard a ship or aircraft from the country and is of unknown parentage.
Person (minor or adult) is born in the Netherlands, has been stateless since birth and resident there for 3 years.

Person is a minor whose descent from a male citizen is legally established, recognised by the father, or legitimated by marriage. DNA proof of the paternity is required if the child is 7 years or older.;

Person is a minor and is recognised by a citizen who has raised and cared for the child for 3 years immediately before the declaration.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person is born in the Netherlands and has been resident there since birth.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in the Netherlands for 5 years immediately before the application and there are no objections against indefinite residence in the country. Other conditions: no threat to public order, public decency or safety, proficiency in Dutch language (certification), knowledge of Dutch society (citizenship test), declaration of solidarity, renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country (with substantial exceptions).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the Netherlands for 5 years immediately before the application and there are no objections against indefinite residence in the country.
Renunciation or automatic loss of citizenship of another country (with exceptions).

category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Knowledge of Dutch society (citizenship test) and declaration of solidarity required.
Person may not be a threat to public order, public decency or safety.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person is an adult and has been resident in the Netherlands since the age of 4.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification:
Person has been the spouse of a citizen, with common household, for 3 years. Person must have been resident in the Netherlands for 3 years in case of sustained relationship other than marriage or registered partnership. Other conditions: see A06.;
Person has been resident in the Netherlands for 15 years (only for marriage and registered partnership).

Person is a minor who is put under joint custody of 2 persons at least one of whom is a citizen who has raised the child for 3 years, and the child's residence is not in another country of which the child is a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification:
Person is a minor who has been adopted by a citizen (acquisition 3 months after judicial decision).;
Person is an adult who is adopted by a citizen. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification:
Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation and the child is mentioned in the naturalisation decree (if child is 16 or 17: only with explicit consent). Child must have been resident in the Netherlands for 3 years immediately before the application. No language and integration requirements. Other conditions: see A06.; 
Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship by declaration and the child is mentioned in the declaration (if child is 16 or 17: only with explicit consent). Child must be resident in the Netherlands.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification:
Person is a former citizen who lost citizenship other than by failure to renounce citizenship of another country (mode L10) and there are no objections to indefinite residence in the Netherlands.;
Person has been resident in the Netherlands for 1 year and there are no objections to indefinite residence in the Netherlands.
Person is 65 years old and has been resident in the Netherlands for 15 years.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee and has been resident in Netherlands for 5 years. No requirement to renounce previous citizenship. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is stateless and has been resident in the Netherlands for 3 years immediately before the application.

Person is a special case (e.g. the spouse of a diplomat, a sportsman or a person who deserves special treatment on humanitarian grounds). Possibility to waive residence and other requirements. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born to a citizen.
Person is born to a citizen.
Person is found in Norway of unknown parentage.
Person is a recognised stateless person born in Norway. Other conditions of the provision do not apply to a child born in Norway.

Person is at least 12 years of age and has resided in Norway for a total of 7 years in the last 10 years with residence or work permits of at least 1 year duration. If applicant is between 18 and 67 years old, there is a requirement of either 300 hours of state-approved language classes or to document sufficient knowledge of Norwegian or Sami language, and to pass a civic integration test. Refugees must have completed a mandatory introduction program. If the applicant has been sentenced to punishment, a certain time must have lapsed before naturalisation is possible. There is no right to naturalisation if this goes against the state's vital interests or foreign policy considerations.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has resided in Norway for a total of 7 years in the last 10 years with residence or work permits of at least 1 year duration.
If applicant is between 18 and 67 years old, there is a requirement of either 300 hours of state-approved language classes or to document sufficient knowledge of Norwegian or Sami language.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person must pass a civic integration test.

If the applicant has been sentenced to punishment, a certain time must have lapsed before naturalisation is possible. There is no right to naturalisation if this goes against the state's vital interests or foreign policy considerations.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person arrived in Norway as a minor. Ordinary naturalisation applies (see A06), with reduced residency requirement: person must have resided a total of 5 out of 7 years with a residence permits of at least 1 year.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen, with common household. Ordinary naturalisation applies (see A06) with reduced residency requirement: Person must have has resided in Norway at least 3 out of the last 10 years with residence or work permits of at least 1 year. In addition, the duration of the residence and the duration of the marriage with citizen must total a minimum of 7 years.

Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring or has acquired citizenship by naturalisation. If over 2 years old, the person must have been resident in Norway for 2 years, with residence or work permits of at least 1 year.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification:
Person is a minor who, if under the age of 2, has been resident in Norway for 2 years and whose parent is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Other conditions: see mode A09.;
Person is an unmarried minor child of a citizen of a Nordic country that acquires Norwegian citizenship by declaration. The child must be resident in Norway.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who has been resident in Norway for 2 years with work or residence permits of at least 1 year.; Person who lost his/her Norwegian citizenship and has thereafter only been a citizen of Nordic countries, may reacquire the citizenship by declaration if residing in Norway.; Person lost his/her citizenship due to acquisition of, or failure to renounce other citizenship. Exceptions apply where the person has been sentenced to certain criminal sanctions. Other conditions: person must have resided for at least 6 months in Norway before the age of 22, unless the Norwegian citizenship was originally acquired by naturalisation. There is no right to reacquisition if this goes against the vital interest of the state or foreign policy considerations.

Person is a citizen of Denmark, Finland, Iceland or Sweden and has been resident in Norway for 2 years. Other conditions: see mode A06.;
Person is over 18 and has been resident in Norway for 7 years, has a clean criminal record. Also by declaration if the person is a former citizen who acquired citizenship of Denmark, Finland, Iceland or Sweden and seeks to recover citizenship. Automatic extension to minor children.

Person is a descendant of citizens who emigrated to Murmansk or Arkhangel County in Russia from the second half of the 19th century until the Russian border was closed in the late 1920s, who have been granted a residence or work permit because they have a specific connection with Norway, and who have been resident in Norway for 2 years preceding the application with residence or work permits of at least one year. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised stateless person. Ordinary naturalisation applies (see A06), but with no minimum age or residence requirement. However, if the person is over 18, he or she must have been resident in Norway for 3 years, with a residence permits of at least 1 year. This provision does not apply to persons who by their own action or omission has chosen to be stateless, or who in a simple way can acquire the citizenship of another state.

Person is born in Nepal to a father who is a citizen, or to a mother who is a citizen and the father is untraceable.; Person is born in Nepal to a mother who is a Nepali citizen and a non-citizen father, has permanently resided in Nepal and has not acquired citizenship of a foreign country.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born abroad to a father who is a citizen, or to a mother who is a citizen and the father is untraceable.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is a child found in Nepal of unknown parentage.
Person is the wife of a male citizen. Other conditions: proof of marriage relationship and renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is the child of someone who acquired citizenship under mode A24, and the child was born prior to the parent acquiring citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person lost citizenship due to acquisition of citizenship of another country, returns to reside in Nepal, and shows evidence of having renounced his/her foreign citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been resident in Nepal for 15 years and has special merits in the fields of science, philosophy, art, literature, world peace, human welfare or Nepalese industry, finance or social welfare. Other conditions: good character, sound mind, able to read and write Nepali or any other language in practice in Nepal, engaged in an occupation and domiciled in Nepal, his/her country of origin allows Nepalese citizens to naturalise, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance.; Person is granted honorary citizenship.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: Constitution s 72, Naoero Citizenship Act 2017 s 9
specification: Person born in Nauru is a citizen by birth, provided that at the time of the person<d5>s birth either or both parents is a citizen (Citizenship Act 2017 s 9). Person born after 31 January 1968 is a citizen if both parents were Nauruan citizens, or if born of a marriage between a Nauruan and Pacific Islander and neither parent seeks a foreign citizenship for the child immediately after birth (Constitution s 72).

article: Constitution s 72, Naoero Citizenship Act 2017 s 12(1)
specification: Person born outside Nauru and one or both parents are citizens is deemed a citizen (Citizenship Act 2017 s 12(1)). Person is a citizen if born after 31 January 1968 to two Nauruan parents or of a marriage between a Nauruan and Pacific Islander and neither parent seeks a foreign citizenship for the child immediately after birth (Constitution s 72).

article: Constitution s 73, Naoero Citizenship Act 2017 s 4(d)
specification: Person born in Nauru after 31 January 1968 without any nationality may apply to the Cabinet for citizenship.
Person can apply for citizenship if born in Nauru to non-citizens and has continuous period of residence of 20 years.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

article: Constitution s 74, Naoero Citizenship Act 2017 s 13
specification: The Constitutional provision is gendered - it provides that a non-citizen woman who marries a Nauruan citizen can apply for Nauruan citizenship. The Citizenship Act 2017 is gender-neutral - it provides that a person married to a citizen can apply for citizenship by marriage. Criteria: lawfully married and residing with spouse in Nauru for 7 years (may be waived by Cabinet), committed to permanent residence in Nauru, of good health and character, willing to fulfil the duties, responsibilities and privileges of being a citizen, no criminal convictions.
n.a. Note: A child of a non-citizen who marries a citizen is not eligible for citizenship unless formally adopted by the spouse who is a citizen.
A non-citizen child adopted by one or more citizens, present in Nauru and with prior approval from Minister becomes a citizen upon court making an adoption order.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person whose parents have renounced citizenship of Nauru can apply for citizenship if at least one grandparent is a citizen.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: A person under 20 is eligible to apply for citizenship concurrently with parents or after grant of citizenship to one or both parents.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person who has renounced citizenship may reapply for Nauruan citizenship.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Pacific islander resident in Nauru for 10 years who adheres to the customs of Nauru can apply for admission to the Nauruan community.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in NZ after 1 January 2006 and at least one of his/her parents was a citizen or was entitled under the Immigration Act 2009 to be in NZ indefinitely, or one of his/her parents was entitled to reside indefinitely in the Cook Islands, Niue or Tokelau.

article: NEZ 7(1); NEZ 8; NEZ 9(1)(b); NEZ 10; NEZ 6(4); NEZ 6(5); NEZ 13(3)
specification: Person is born outside NZ on/after 1 January 1978 to a parent who is citizen otherwise than by descent, or the parent is a citizen by descent and the person would otherwise be stateless.; Person is born abroad, may be a citizen by descent, is 16 years or over and satisfies the requirements in NEZ 8(1) and NEZ 8(2).; Person is born abroad to a citizen by descent. Citizenship may be granted by the Minister in special cases.; Person was born abroad before 1 January 1978 to a mother was a citizen otherwise than by descent; Person is born abroad to a citizen who is the head of a mission, an employee of the State services or Armed Forces, a person working overseas for the public service of Niue, Tokelau or the Cook Islands, an officer or employee of NZ Trade and Enterprise, or an officer/employee of the NZ Tourism Board.; Person would have been born in Tokelau but was born in Samoa because of a medical necessity and at the time of his/her birth s/he would have been a citizen if born in Tokelau.; Person was born abroad on/after 1 January 1949 but before 1 January 1978 to a father who was a citizen or, if the person was born after 1970, to a mother who was a citizen.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is deemed to be a citizen by birth if s/he, having recently been born, was found abandoned in New Zealand investigations failed to establish the identity of at least one of the parents.
Person is deemed a citizen by birth if born in New Zealand on or after 1 January 1978 and the person would otherwise be stateless.

Person must be present in New Zealand (or in the Cook Islands, Niue or Tokelau) for a minimum of 1350 days during the 5 years immediately preceding the date of application and for at least 240 days in each of those 5 years. Other conditions: be 16 years or older, full capacity, application in the subscribed manner, good character, sufficient knowledge of the responsibilities and privileges of citizenship, sufficient knowledge of English, intends to continue to reside in NZ or to enter into Crown service under the NZ government or service under an international organisation of which NZ is a member, or service in the employment of an entity resident or established in NZ.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person must be present in New Zealand (or in the Cook Islands, Niue or Tokelau) for a minimum of 1350 days during the 5 years immediately preceding the date of application and for at least 240 days in each of those 5 years and person intends to continue to reside in NZ or to enter into Crown service under the NZ government or service under an international organisation of which NZ is a member, or service in the employment of an entity resident or established in NZ.

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must have sufficient knowledge of the responsibilities and privileges of citizenship.
Good character required (disqualifying convictions listed in NEZ 9A).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person lost citizenship through renunciation. S/he may regain citizenship only by way of grant under NEZ 8, 8A or 9.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen of Western Samoa who was in NZ on 14 September 1982 and who was entitled to be in NZ indefinitely.

Person would otherwise be stateless. In making the decision the Minister may have regard to requirements set out in NEZ 8(2) and must have regard to whether the person has any disqualifying convictions pursuant to NEZ 9A.
Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the public interest because of exceptional circumstances of a humanitarian nature or other nature related to the person.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person intends to enter into or continue in Crown service under the New Zealand government, or service under an international organisation of which the NZ government is a member and the person meets the other criteria in NEZ 8(1) and 8(2).
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person is born in Oman to a male citizen. Person born to a female citizen can only obtain citizenship when the father was a citizen who became stateless or if the father is unknown.;Person is the child of a male citizen who has deceased or abandoned or divorced his wife at least 10 years ago and he/she had resided in the country for at least 10 years. Other conditions: good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor,  written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country, written consent of guardian.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born in Oman to a male citizen. Person born to a female citizen can only obtain citizenship when the father was a citizen who became stateless or if the father is unknown.;Person is the child of a male citizen who has deceased or abandoned or divorced his wife at least 10 years ago and he/she had resided in the country for at least 10 years. Other conditions: good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor,  written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country, written consent of guardian.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is a citizen (wedlock condition/supplementary provision may apply)

specification: Person is born in Oman to unknown parents.

Person has been resident in Oman for at least 20 years. Other conditions: can read and write Arabic, has an income, good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor, good physical health, written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Oman for at least 20 years.
Written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Person must be able to read and write Arabic.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person has good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen and the couple have resided in the country for at least 10 years and have a male child. Other conditions: can read and write Arabic, has an income, good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor, written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country. Or person is the husband of a female citizen, the couple must have lived in the country for 15 years and have a male child. Other conditions: can read and write Arabic, has an income, good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor, good physical health, written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Gender differentiation (residence requirement differs by gender)

specification: Person is the widow of a male citizen and the couple had resided in the country for at least 15 years and have a male child. Other conditions: can read and write Arabic, has an income, good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor, good physical health, written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country.;Person is the child of a male citizen who has deceased at least 10 years ago and he/she had resided in the country for at least 10 years. Other conditions: good character, not convicted of crime or offence in breach of trust or honor,  written consent and proof of renunciation of citizenship of another country, written consent of guardian.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person is the wife of someone who is acquiring citizenship by naturalisation. Conditional on fufilling other criteria.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (with residence requirement)

specification: Person has previously renounced his/her citizenship and acquired another citizenship, is of good behaviour, has not been convicted for a crime in breach of trust or honor, has returned to the country, and has renounced his/her other citizenship. Children of those who renounced citizenship can apply 5 years after reaching the age of majority if they fulfil the same further conditions.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in Pakistan to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to a citizen other than by descent.; Person is born abroad to a citizen by descent. He/she needs to be registered at a Pakistan consulate or the citizen parent needs to be in the service of Pakistan at the time of the birth.

Person is born in Pakistan. Unless born to a father who is a foreign diplomat and not a citizen of Pakistan, or the father is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.

Person has been resident in Pakistan for 12 months immediately prior to the application, as well as during 4 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: good character, adequate knowledge of one of the vernaculars of Pakistan, intent to reside in Pakistan or to enter or continue in the service of Pakistan, renunciation of citizenship of another country, and oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Pakistan for 12 months immediately prior to the application, as well as during 4 out of 7 years predating the 12-month period.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Adequate knowledge of one of the vernaculars of Pakistan.
category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the wife of a citizen. Other conditions: oath of loyalty and possession of a certificate of domicile.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is the wife of a deceased citizen (or of a person who would have been a citizen under PAK 3, 4 or 5). Other conditions: oath of loyalty and possession of a certificate of domicile.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person is the wife of someone who becomes a citizen, and makes a declaration expressing the wish to become a citizen within 1 year after the husband took the oath of loyalty. Other conditions: oath of loyalty and possession of a certificate of domicile.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (with residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor residing in Pakistan whose parent is acquiring citizenship through naturalisation, includes the child in his/her naturalisation certificate, and has parental authority over the child.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen. If person lost citizenship due to the non-renunciation of citizenship of another country or because s/he was deprived of citizenship, the person is not entitled to reacquisition but is dependent on the previous consent of the government.

Commonwealth citizens who transfer PKR 5 million worth of foreign exchange to Pakistan, may apply for citizenship. After confirmation from the State Bank of Pakistan of the transaction of the said amount, an immigrant visa is issued. A Pakistan Citizenship Certificate is granted upon arrival in the country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person is born abroad to a citizen by birth and establishes residence in Panama.;
Person is born abroad to a citizen by naturalisation and establishes residence in Panama (by declaration within 1 year of reaching the age of majority).
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

article: Const 9(1), Article 32 2019 Executive Decree 10 of 16 January 2019 on the implementation of Law 28 of 30 March 2011
specification: Article 32 of the Executive Decree 10 of 16 January 2019 on the implementation Law 28 of 30 March 2011 approves the Convention relating to the Status of Statelessness of 1954 and establishes that in cases where a child is found in the territory of the Republic whose identity is unknown it will be presumed that he/she was born in the country and that his or her parents are citizens of Panama.

article: Const 10(1), 12, PAN 1, 4, 8, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII
specification: Person has been resident in Panama for a continuous period of 5 years (time spent during minority is fully counted). Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country, proficiency in Spanish, basic knowledge of the geography, history and political organization of Panama, and oath of loyalty. Naturalisation can be denied for reasons of morality, safety, health, and physical or mental incapacity.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

article: Const 10(1), 12, PAN 1, 4, 8, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII
specification: Person has been resident in Panama for a continuous period of 5 years (time spent during minority is fully counted).

article: Const 10(1), 12, PAN 1, 4, 8, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII
specification: Oath of renunciation of citizenship of another country required (proof of renunciation is not required).

article: Const 10(1), 12, PAN 1, 4, 8, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII
category: Language requirement without certification or test

article: Const 10(1), 12, PAN 1, 4, 8, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII
specification: Basic knowledge of the geography, history and political organization of Panama.

article: Const 10(1), 12, PAN 1, 4, 8, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII
specification: Naturalisation can be denied for reasons of morality, safety, health, and physical or mental incapacity.

article: Const 10(1), 12, PAN 1, 4, 8, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has been resident in Panama for 3 years uninterrupted. Other conditions: see A06.
Person is born abroad and adopted by Panamanian citizens before the age of 7.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

article: Const 10(3) and 12, Decree-Law No. 3 of 22 February 2008, Title XIII
specification: Person is a citizen by birth of Spain or a Latin American country and fulfils the same conditions as required in those countries for the naturalisation of Panamanian citizens (reciprocity).

article:
Const 52, PER 2(3), Supreme Decree no. 004-97-IN, 4c;

specification:
Person is born abroad to a citizen by birth and is registered with the Peruvian consulate of the country of birth. Provision only applies to descendants up to the 3rd generation.;
Person is born abroad to a citizen, makes a declaration upon reaching the age of majority, and is resident in Peru.

specification: Person has been resident in Peru for a continuous period of at least 2 years. Other conditions: full capacity, exercise a profession or entrepreneurial activity or have sufficient means of subsistence, clean criminal record, and good behaviour and morals.

PER 3(1), Supreme Decree no. 004-97-IN, 8(a), 15 (revoked by Law 27532 in 2001?)

specification: Clean criminal record, and good behaviour and morals.

specification: Person was born abroad to non-citizens who have been resident in Peru since the child was 5 years old and he/she expresses the wish to become a citizen upon reaching the age of majority.

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen and has been resident in Peru, with common household, for 2 years. Other conditions: clean criminal record, good behaviour and morals, no contagious disease, and sound mind.

Person is a former citizen by birth who lost citizenship by renunciation and has been resident in Peru for a continuous period of at least 1 year. Other conditions: exercise a profession or entrepreneurial activity (or show proof that such activities will be exercised shortly), and good behaviour and morals.

specification:
Person has rendered distinguished services to Peru.;
Person is a qualified athlete residing in Peru who will represent Peru in official sporting events.

specification: Person is born in the Philippines to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.

Person is born in the Philippines, has been resident there since birth and is at least 18 years of age. Other conditions: good moral character, belief in the underlying principles of the Constitution, proper and irreproachable conduct, primary and secondary education in a government-recognised institution, have a known trade, business, profession or lawful occupation, be able to read, write and speak Filipino or any of the dialects of the Philippines, and must have mingled with Filipinos and evinced a sincere desire to learn and embrace the customs, traditions and ideals of the Filipino people. Not eligible are persons  who are opposed to organised government, who defend or teach the use of violence for the success or predominance of their ideas, believe in polygamy, have been convicted of crimes involving moral turpitude, suffer from mental alienation or incurable contagious diseases, have not mingled socially during the period of their residence in the Philippines, have not shown a desire to learn and embrace the customs, traditions and ideals of the Filipinos, are citizens or subjects with whom the Philippines is at war, or are citizens of a foreign country whose laws do not grant Filipinos the right to become naturalised citizens.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been resident in the Philippines for a continuous period of 10 years. Other conditions: aged 21 years or older, good moral character, irreproachable conduct, belief in the principles underlying the Constitution, own real estate worth not less than 5,000 Philippine pesos or have a lucrative trade, profession or lawful occupation,  written and oral knowledge of English or Spanish or any other principal Philippine language, enrol any minor children in a school where Philippine history, government and civics are taught, renounce any foreign hereditary or nobility titles, and lodge a declaration of intention. Not eligible for naturalisation are persons who are opposed to organised government, defend or teach the use of violence for the success and predominance of their ideas, believe in the practice of polygamy, have been convicted of crimes involving moral turpitude, suffer from mental alienation or incurable contagious diseases, have not mingled socially with Filipinos during their residence in the Philippines, have not shown a desire to learn and embrace Filipino customs, are citizens of nations with whom the USA and the Philippines are at war, or are citizens of a foreign country other than the USA whose laws do not grant Filipinos the right to become naturalised citizens.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the Philippines for a continuous period of 10 years.
Written and oral knowledge of English or Spanish or any other principal Philippine language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Belief in the principles underlying the Constitution, enrol any minor children in a school where Philippine history, government and civics are taught. Not eligible for naturalisation are persons who are opposed to organised government, defend or teach the use of violence for the success and predominance of their ideas, believe in the practice of polygamy, have been convicted of crimes involving moral turpitude, suffer from mental alienation or incurable contagious diseases, have not mingled socially with Filipinos during their residence in the Philippines, have not shown a desire to learn and embrace Filipino customs.

Good moral character, irreproachable conduct required.Not eligible for naturalisation are persons who are opposed to organised government, defend or teach the use of violence for the success and predominance of their ideas, believe in the practice of polygamy, have been convicted of crimes involving moral turpitude, suffer from mental alienation or incurable contagious diseases, have not mingled socially with Filipinos during their residence in the Philippines, have not shown a desire to learn and embrace Filipino customs.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person must own real estate worth not less than 5,000 Philippine pesos or have a lucrative trade, profession or lawful occupation.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in the Philippines and received his or her primary and secondary education in Philippine schools. Other conditions: see A06 (except declaration of intention).
category: Restricted to period of schooling in country

specification: Person is the male spouse of a female citizen and has been continuously resident in the Philippines for 5 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Gender restriction: only for male spouse of female citizen

specification: Person is the widow or minor child of a male applicant for naturalisation who died before a final decision on his application was rendered. The decision will produce the same legal effect as if it had been rendered during the life of the applicant.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is the female spouse of someone who becomes a citizen.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is a minor who was born in the Philippines and whose parent acquires citizenship by naturalisation, or person is a minor who was born abroad and was dwelling in the Philippines at the time of the parent's naturalisation. In case of a foreign-born minor child who was not dwelling in the Philippines at the time of the parent's naturalisation, the child will only be considered a citizen during his/her minority. Child will remain a citizen if (s)he begins to reside permanently in the Philippines while still a minor.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

article: Commonwealth Act no. 63, 2-3 (superseded by Republic Act no. 9225, 3-4)
specification: Person is a natural-born citizen and acquired citizenship of another country by naturalisation. Other conditions: oath of allegiance. Reacquisition is extended to unmarried children below the age of 18.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been continuously resident in the Philippines for 30 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except declaration of intention).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been continuously resident in the Philippines for 5 years and established a new industry or introduced a useful invention in the Philippines. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been continuously resident in the Philippines for 5 years and honourably holds office under the Government of the Philippines or under that of any of the provinces, cities, municipalities, or political subdivision thereof, or is engaged as a teacher in the Philippines in a public or recognised private school not established for exclusive instruction of children of persons of a particular nationality or race for a period of not less than 2 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: A person born of parents, one or both of whom are citizens of Palau or are of recognized Palauan ancestry, is a citizen of Palau.
A person born of parents, one or both of whom are citizens of Palau or are of recognized Palauan ancestry, is a citizen of Palau.
n.a. Note: Provision set out in A19 is confined to a person 'born of parents' of recognised Palauan ancestry. It excludes children by adoption.

A citizen of the Trust Territory of Pacific Islands immediately prior to effective date of Constitution (1 January 1981) with at least one parent of recognised Palauan ancestry automatically became a citizen of Palau upon independence.

article: Constitution, Art III, s 4, Citizenship Act <a4> 136-141
specification: Person over 18 years of age with at least one parent of recognised Palauan ancestry can petition the Supreme Court for naturalisation.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Registered birth in PNG on or after date of independence (16 September 1975). One parent must be a citizen or would have been entitled to citizenship on independence.
Person born outside PNG on or after independence (16 September 1975). One parent must be a citizen or would have been entitled to citizenship on independence day. Birth must be registered.
Foundling or child of unknown identity or citizenship status will be deemed to have at least one parent who was a citizen (and thereby an automatic citizen)

Naturalisation on application to Minister. Criteria: Residence for 8 years, good character, intend to reside permanently in country, speak and understand language, respect for customs and cultures of the country, unlikely to become a charge on public funds, reasonable knowledge and understanding of the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizenship, renounce other citizenship and make declaration of loyalty.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Renunciation of foreign citizenship required (except if person is a citizen of a prescribed country and obtained permission for retention of citizenship).

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Respect for customs and cultures of the country, reasonable knowledge and understanding of the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizenship.

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is unlikely to become a charge on public funds
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Spouse of a citizen can apply to the Minister for citizenship by marriage. Criteria: Residence for 12 months in preceding 3 years, good character, marriage valid in PNG laws (but not under custom) and renounce other citizenship (unless a dual citizen).

Person with one parent or grandparent who was or is eligible to be a citizen can apply to the Minister for citizenship by descent. Criteria: Residence for 12 months in preceding 3 years, good character, renounce other citizenship (unless a dual citizen).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Citizenship status to be determined by reference to natural parents, unless the Minister decides to allow an adoptive parent or grandparent (including adoption by custom) to be taken into account where the result would be to recognise citizenship
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person with one parent or grandparent who was or is eligible to be a citizen can apply to the Minister for citizenship by descent. Criteria: Residence for 12 months in preceding 3 years, good character, renounce other citizenship (unless a dual citizen).
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a grandchild of a citizen

specification: Child of an applicant for naturalisation can become a citizen at same time as applicant.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification:
Former citizen by automatic citizenship on date of independence (16 September 1975) or by descent can regain citizenship after 5 years residence (reduced to three years residence if person acquired foreign citizenship upon marriage and the marriage breaks down).;
A child who loses PNG citizenship as a result of their parent losing PNG citizenship (Constitution s 74(3)) can apply to regain PNG citizenship. Minister to grant citizenship where that is in the best interests of the welfare of the child.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

article: Constitution s 67(4), Citizenship Act 1975 s 6A; Constitution s 67(4), Citizenship Act 1975 s 6A
specification: Person in a particular sport who is likely to win recognised medals can apply for naturalisation. Person in a particular sport who is likely to win recognised medals can apply for naturalization (Constitution). Criteria: Committee will consider sporting background, specific qualifications and skills to be gainfully employed, knowledge or undertaking to learn language, other connections to country (Act).; Person who has <d2>resources, capital, commitment and credentials to invest in the country<d5>s economy to create employment and impart skills to citizens<d3> can apply for naturalisation. Criteria: Committee will consider business and investment background and standing in any other country, background in creating employment and imparting skills to employees in other country, holds relevant investor visa, knowledge or undertaking to learn language, other connections to country.

specification: Person is a minor who is born in Portugal and whose parents have been resident there for at least five years immediately preceding the request. specification: Person has been resident in Portugal for 5 years. Other conditions: sufficient knowledge of Portuguese language, existence of an effective link with the national community, no convictions for committing a crime punished with a prison sentence of 3 or more years, no danger or threat to security or national defence, or involvement in activities related to the practice of terrorism.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)
