If one of the parents is a foreigner and neither of the parents are permanent residents in the country, written agreement between the parents is required (acquisition is automatic if the parents fail to agree within 3 months from the child's birth and the child remains stateless).
Person is born in Tajikistan and of unknown parentage.

Person is a child born in Tajikistan to stateless parents and at least one parent permanently resides in the country. Or child is born to parents who are citizens of other countries and the child is not entitled to citizenship of these countries.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born to a stateless mother, irrespective of the place of birth, and an affiliation is established with the child's father who is a citizen.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has had permanent and continuous residence for 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the language (level of communication) and not being under criminal prosecution, renunciation of other citizenship (unless a bilateral treaty applies).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has had permanent and continuous residence for 5 years.
Renunciation of other citizenship required (unless person is a Russian citizen (bilateral treaty)).
Knowledge of the language (level of communication)
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person is not under criminal prosecution.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries

specification: Person has a parent who is a citizen and has had permanent and continuous residence for 2.5 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Persons is adopted by a citizen or a couple one of whom is a citizen and the other is stateless. If one of the adopting parents is a foreigner, the child acquires citizenship based on an application submitted by the adoptive parents.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the child of a parent who is acquiring citizenship. Child's consent is required if between 14 and 18 years.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person was born on the territory of the Soviet Socialist Republic of Tajikistan, held citizenship of the former Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, and has been resident for 2.5 years. Other conditions: see A06. Or person was born in the Soviet Socialist Republic of Tajikistan, was in possession of the citizenship of former Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, resided or resides in the states that are former members of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, but has not acquired citizenship of these states and, as a result, is stateless.; Person is a veteran of WW II, possessed citizenship of the former Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, and lives in Tajikistan. Or person previously was a citizen and applies to have citizenship restored. No other conditions.
Person is a stateless person and has had permanent and continuous residence for 2.5 years. Other conditions: see A06.

Person has outstanding achievements in the sphere of science, technology, healthcare or sports, achievements in the economic, social and cultural development of the country and the realisation of universal human values. No other conditions.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Turkmenistan to a citizen.

Person is born abroad to a citizen. If one parent has foreign citizenship and neither of the parents have resided habitually in the country before the child's birth, a joint application of both parents is required (not needed if the child does not acquire another citizenship).
Person is a child who is resident in Turkmenistan and of unknown parentage. Child shall be regarded as born in Turkmenistan.

Person is a child born in Turkmenistan to stateless parents (or single parent) who habitually reside in the country, or is the child of foreign citizens and cannot acquire the parents' (or single parent) citizenship.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born to a mother who is stateless and a citizen is recognised as the father.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of the official language (communication level), assumes the responsibility to abide by and respect the Constitution and laws of the country, legal sources of subsistence, and meet security and public policy checks (list of reasons for refusal).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually resident for 5 years.
Knowledge of the official language (communication level) required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Assumes the responsibility to abide by and respect the Constitution and laws of the country.
Person must meet security and public policy checks (list of reasons for refusal).
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is adopted by two citizens or by a parent who is a citizen and another who is stateless, and the person is resident in Turkmenistan. If one adoptive parent is a foreigner, the written consent of both spouses is required. Child's consent is required if between 14 and 18 years.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a citizen of the former USSR, and either has a close relative in Turkmenistan or has arrived for the purpose of habitual residence. Other conditions: see A06 (but residence requirement may be shortened).
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to relatives in ascending and descending line)

specification: Person is the child of parents (or single parent) who are acquiring citizenship. If one parent remains a foreign citizen, a joint application of both parents is required. Child's consent is required if between 14 and 18 years.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen and is habitually resident or has an intention to settle in the country. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to residence and means of subsistence).

Person belongs to the Turkmen people or is a descendant of such a person (children, grandchildren, great grandchildren and others). Other conditions: see A06 (but residence requirement may be shortened).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is recognised as a refugee in accordance with the law or international treaty to which Turkmenistan is a party. Other conditions: see A06 (but residence requirement may be shortened).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Persons have rendered outstanding services to Turkmenistan, have high achievements in science, technology, culture or sport, or have a profession or qualification of state interest. Other conditions: see A06 (but residence requirement may be shortened).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Timor-Leste to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen and the birth is registered with the Timorese Civil Registry.
Person is born in Timor-Leste to a person also born there.
Person is born in Timor-Leste to unknown parents.
Person is born in Timor-Leste to parents who are stateless or of unknown citizenship.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born in Timor-Leste and declares, of his/her own accord and after reaching the age of 17 years, that he/she wishes to acquire citizenship.
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person has been habitually and regularly resident in Timor-Leste for at least 10 years counted before 7 December 1975 or after 20 May 2002. Other requirements: full age under Timorese law and under the law of the State of origin, ability to speak one of the official languages, moral and civic guarantees of integration into Timorese society, capacity to govern oneself and to provide for own subsistence, knowledge of the history and culture of Timor-Leste.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been habitually and regularly resident in Timor-Leste for at least 10 years counted before 7 December 1975 or after 20 May 2002.
Ability to speak one of the official languages required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Moral and civic guarantees of integration into Timorese society required, knowledge of the history and culture of Timor-Leste required.
Capacity to govern oneself and to provide for own subsistence required.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been married for more than 5 years with a citizen. Other requirements: residence in Timor-Leste for at least 2 years, ability to speak one of the official languages. If the previous citizenship is lost as a consequence of the marriage, Timorese citizenship is acquired automatically. Note: a Ministerial Decree from 2018 made naturalisation on the basis of marriage a discretionary decision, even in cases where the foreign spouse lost his/her citizenship as a consequence of the marriage. This MD's legality is highly questionable.
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is the minor child of a parent who acquires Timorese citizenship by naturalisation, provided that the parent requests for the child to also acquire citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship by declaration of his/her parents when he/she was a minor. Person must have reached the age of majority and must have established residence in Timor-Leste for at least 1 year.; Person voluntarily renounced citizenship and has established residence in Timor-Leste for at least 5 years.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is granted citizenship, by the National Parliament, for having rendered high and relevant services to the country.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Tonga to a Tongan parent.
Person is born abroad to a Tongan parent.

article: Constitution of Tonga s 29, Nationality Act s 8
specification: Person has resided in Tonga for at least 5 years, good character, adequate knowledge of Tongan language, intends to reside in Tonga. A woman who was a Tongan subject before marriage to a non-Tongan who is no longer married, is not required to meet residence requirement.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

article: Constitution of Tonga s 29, Nationality Act s 8
specification: Residence in Tonga for at least 5 years (a woman who was a Tongan subject before marriage to a non-Tongan who is no longer married, is not required to meet residence requirement).

article: Constitution of Tonga s 29, Nationality Act s 8
Constitution of Tonga s 29, Nationality Act s 8
specification: Adequate knowledge of Tongan language required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

article: Constitution of Tonga s 29, Nationality Act s 8
Constitution of Tonga s 29, Nationality Act s 8
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

article: Constitution of Tonga s 29, Nationality Act s 8

specification: A non-Tongan who marries a Tongan is deemed to be a Tongan subject if he/she lodges a written declaration that he or she wishes to assume Tongan nationality and takes oath of allegiance.
Where a non-Tongan obtains naturalization, the King may also, in his discretion, naturalise any child of the person who is a minor under 16 years of age.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person who ceased to be a subject prior to the Nationality Amendment Act 2007 (14 September 2007) (which repealed provisions for loss of nationality by taking up foreign citizenship) may apply to Minister for re-admission to Tongan nationality.  Residence requirements do not apply.

Person who holds a Protected Person Passport or Tongan National Passport (i.e. in exchange for payment of a fee) before 22 August 1996 or for 5 years from that date or on humanitarian grounds (i.e. in exchange for payment of a fee) can apply for naturalisation.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person is born abroad to a citizen otherwise than by descent, or to a citizen in the service of Trinidad and Tobago.;
Person is born abroad to a citizen by descent (registration by parent while person is a minor, or by the person him/herself within 1 year after reaching the age of majority). Person loses citizenship if oath of allegiance is not taken within 1 year after reaching the age of majority.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Trinidad and Tobago. Unless born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and the child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy.

Status of Children Act is clear that children born out of wedlock have same rights as children born in wedlock. Paternity established through registration via Births and Deaths Registration Act, a paternity order via Family Law Act or similar order from another country, or through a paternity order established by the High Court (which can consist of a blood test).
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has been resident in Trinidad and Tobago for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in Trinidad and Tobago, or in government service, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 5 out of 7 years prior to the 12-month period. Other conditions: good character, full capacity, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, and oath of allegiance. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Trinidad and Tobago for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in Trinidad and Tobago, or in government service, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 5 out of 7 years prior to the 12-month period.

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Adequate knowledge of the duties of a citizen required, oath of allegiance.
Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Minister may decide whether any minor who meets 'special circumstances' may become a citizen.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person obtained citizenship or was eligible to obtain citizenship via registration under Article 10 of the 1962 Constitution. Article 10 stipulates that the individual would have become a citizen if it were not for the death of his or her spouse. Oath of allegiance required.;Person born outside of the country to a deceased parent who was a citizen otherwise than by descent.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification:
Person is a former citizen by birth or descent and has voluntarily acquired another citizenship or has renounced citizenship in order to acquire another citizenship.;

Person is a former citizen other than by birth or descent who lost citizenship due to voluntary acquisition of citizenship of another country. Other conditions: good character, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, oath of allegiance, legal entry into the territory and is not a member of a prohibited class under the Immigration Act.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen, a citizen of Ireland, or a British protected person and has either been resident in Trinidad and Tobago, in the service of the government, or had partly such residence and partly such service for 5 years. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive residence requirements (but required minimum of 12 months). Other conditions: good character, full capacity, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, and oath of allegiance.
Person is born in Tunisia to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person born in Tunisia whose non-Tunisian father and grandfather was also born in Tunisia.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is also born in country

specification: Person born in Tunisia to unknown parents (unless it is established during his/her minority that he/she is a foreign citizen. Newborn child found in Tunisia is assumed to have been born there until proven otherwise).
Person is born in Tunisia to stateless parents who have resided in Tunisia for at least five years.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been resident in the country for at least 5 years. Other conditions: sufficient knowledge of Arabic language, sound mind, good health, good character, has not been convicted to a prison sentence of more than 1 year, unless he/she has been rehabilitated, and foreign convictions can be disregarded.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the country for at least 5 years.
Sufficient knowledge of Arabic language required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Person must be of good character, may not have been convicted to a prison sentence of more than 1 year, unless he/she has been rehabilitated, and foreign convictions can be disregarded.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person marries a male citizen and automatically loses her original citizenship; Person marries a male citizen; Person marries a citizen.
Person is an unmarried minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the minor child of a father or widowed mother who is acquiring citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person proves that he/she is a Tunisian national by origin.
Person has provided exceptional services to Tunisia or his/her naturalisation is of exceptional interest to Tunisia.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Turkey to two citizens, or to a father or mother who is a citizen (birth in wedlock), or to a mother who is a citizen (birth out of wedlock).
Person is born abroad to two citizens, or to a father or mother who is a citizen (birth in wedlock), or to a mother who is a citizen (birth out of wedlock).
Person is found in Turkey of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Turkey to foreign parents and child is not entitled to citizenship of another country.
Person is born out of wedlock to a father who is a citizen and a mother who is a citizen of another country. Acquisition of citizenship only after the establishment of paternity.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has been resident in Turkey for an uninterrupted period of 5 years with intent to settle. Other conditions: good morals, not have a health condition that is dangerous to the person's surrounding, sufficient knowledge of the Turkish language, income requirement, not pose a threat to national security and public order. The grant of citizenship is discretionary and applications can be rejected by the authorities (taking into account the opinions of public institutions and organizations).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Turkey for 5 years with intent to settle.
Sufficient knowledge of the Turkish language.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Good morals, not pose a threat to national security and public order.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen and resident in Turkey for 3 years, lives in family unity and avoids acts incompatible with marriage unity. Other condition: does not pose a threat to national security.
Person is the adult child of a parent who has acquired citizenship by naturalisation.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen. Other condition: does not pose a threat to national security.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor whose parent is acquiring citizenship and the other parent consents to the child's acquisition of citizenship.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor
Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen by birth of the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.
Person is of Turkish descent and has been resident in Turkey for 5 years. Other conditions: see mode A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is stateless and has been resident in Turkey for 5 years with intent to settle. Other conditions: see A06.

Person rendered extraordinary service (or is thought to have a potential for such service) in the social, economic, scientific or technical fields. Person may not be considered a threat to national security and public order.;
Person has obtained a Turquoise Card (i.e. residence permit granted to highly-skilled foreigners). Person may not be considered a threat to national security and public order.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person has invested in Turkey by establishing an industrial plant/factory. No residence requirement.;
Person has obtained a residence permit ex Art. 31(1)(j) Law 6458 of 4 April 2013 (i.e. by making a certain investment as stipulated by presidential decree) and applies for citizenship. Person may not be considered a threat to national security and public order.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: A person born outside Tuvalu on or after the date the Constitution took effect (1 October 1986) is a citizen of Tuvalu by birth if on the date of his birth either of his parents is, or would but for their death have been, a citizen of Tuvalu.

A person born in Tuvalu on or after the date the Constitution took effect (1 October 1986) is a citizen of Tuvalu by birth. Exceptions: If neither parent is a citizen and person's father (or mother if born outside marriage) was a diplomat in Tuvalu, or neither parent is a citizen and person's father (or mother if born outside marriage) was a citizen of a country at war and birth occurred in occupied territory.
A foundling is considered to have been born in Tuvalu, absent proof to the contrary.

Criteria: residence in Tuvalu for seven years, intention to make Tuvalu his/her permanent home, is and will be able to remain financially self-supporting, familiarity with the laws and customs of Tuvalu, of good character and not suffering from any permanent communicable disease.  Must also take oath of allegiance.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Familiarity with the laws and customs of Tuvalu.

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is and will be able to remain financially self-supporting
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

article: Constitution of Tuvalu 1986 s 46, Citizenship Act s 5(1)(b)
specification: Person who marries a person who is or becomes a citizen can apply to be registered as a citizen.
Person who is adopted by a citizen (or person who would be a citizen by operation of law but for his or her death) can apply to be registered as a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person can regain citizenship by application. Requires five years residence in Tuvalu (not including period before citizenship was lost).

Person has worked for Tuvalu for preceding seven years as an official or representative in a foreign country protecting and promoting the interests of the Government of Tuvalu and its citizens, as remunerated by government of Tuvalu.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person is born in Taiwan to a citizen.
Person is born in abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Taiwan to unknown parents.
Person is born in Taiwan to parents who were both stateless.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person was born in Taiwan, is currently domiciled there, and has been resident for 3 continuous years of which at least 183 days annually. Other conditions: see A06.;Person is born in Taiwan to a parent who was also born there and the person is domiciled in Taiwan. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Age restriction: person can only acquire citizenship after reaching the age of majority

specification: Person is domiciled in Taiwan and has been resident for 5 continuous years of which at least 183 days annually. Other conditions: aged 20 years or older and of full capacity, good conduct, clean criminal record, basic knowledge of the country's language and of the rights and duties of a citizen, sufficient property or skills for self-support, and renunciation of citizenship of another country (unless it is proven that this is impossible for causes not attributable to the person or person is a high-level professional in the technological, economic, educational, cultural, art, sports domain or any other designated domain, serves the interests of the ROC and has been approved by the authorities).
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person is domiciled in Taiwan and has been resident for 5 continuous years of which at least 183 days annually.

Renunciation of citizenship of another country (unless it is proven that this is impossible for causes not attributable to the person or person is a high-level professional in the technological, economic, educational, cultural, art, sports domain or any other designated domain, serves the interests of the ROC and has been approved by the authorities).
Basic knowledge of the country's language
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Basic knowledge of the rights and duties of a citizen.

category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Sufficient property or skills for self-support
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is domiciled in Taiwan, has been resident for 3 continuous years of which at least 183 days annually, and is the spouse of a citizen (or is divorced due to domestic violence). Other conditions: see A06 (except income requirement).

Person is a minor and his/her (adoptive) parent now is a citizen. Provision applies even if the person has legally resided in the territory of the Republic of China for less than 3 years and does not meet the naturalisation requirements relating to age, full capacity, means of support, and language skills.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is domiciled in Taiwan, has been resident for 3 continuous years of which at least 183 days annually, and is adopted by a citizen. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person takes care of a (legally incapacitated) child who is a citizen.; Person is the guardian or auxiliary person of a citizen.
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is the child of a deceased citizen.; Person is the spouse of a deceased citizen, is still in contact with family-in-law (contact with familiy-in-law not required if person has been married for at least two years), is domiciled in Taiwan and has been resident for 3 continuous years of which at least 183 days annually. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Person is an unmarried minor whose parent acquires citizenship by naturalisation, and the child is included in the naturalisation application.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship under mode L01 (respectively L13 as the minor child of a citizen) and is currently domiciled in Taiwan. Other conditions:  good conduct, clean criminal record, sufficient property or skills for self-support. Does not apply to naturalised citizens and children who were included in the parents' naturalisation certificate.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been continuously resident in Taiwan for 10 years. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has made a special contribution to Taiwan. Provision also applies if the ordinary naturalisation conditions are not met. They are not subject to the requirement of residence of 183 days each year. Permission for naturalisation granted by the Ministry of the Interior shall be approved by the Executive Yuan. Person does not have to renounce his/her original citizenship.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person holds Alien Permanent Resident Card (Plum Blossom Cards) and has invested  (1) NT$ 15 million in a for-profit enterprise in Taiwan and created five or more job opportunities for ROC nationals for three years or (2) invested NT $ 30 million in Taiwanese government bonds for over three years. The Plum Blossom Card programme was introduced in 2009 for foreigners who have made special contributions or Senior Professionals or Investment Immigrants.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: n.a. (Note: in practice, the Tanzanian authorities interpret the ius soli provisions to require one parent to be a citizen.)
Person is born abroad to a citizen other than by descent (i.e. not also born outside the country).; Father a citizen by descent (person may apply for citizenship by naturalisation).
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in Tanzania unless father has diplomatic immunity and mother is not a citizen, or either parent is an enemy and birth takes place in territory occupied by the enemy. (Note: in practice, the notional provision is not applied and has been overruled by the state's legal office. The Tanzanian authorities thus interpret the ius soli provision to require one parent to be a citizen.)

Person has been resident for 12 months prior to the application and at least 7 years during previous 10 years. Other conditions: renounce other citizenship, adequate knowledge of Swahili or English, good character, and that given his/her past and potential contribution to the national economy, scientific and technological advancement and the national social and cultural welfare of the country s/he would be a good citizen of Tanzania.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident for 12 months prior to the application and at least 7 years during previous 10 years.
Adequate knowledge of Swahili or English required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test
General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Given his/her past and potential contribution to the national economy, scientific and technological advancement and the national social and cultural welfare of the country s/he would be a good citizen of Tanzania.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the wife of a citizen. Other conditions: renounce other citizenship.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of a citizen and an application is made on his or her behalf by the parent or guardian.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person's status as a citizen depends on status of father. If father is deceased, status shall be interpreted to refer to his status at time of death.
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is a woman who lost citizenship on acquiring another citizenship through marriage, and marriage subsequently breaks down.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is born in Uganda to a citizen by birth (see A02a for definition - excludes those who are not member of listed ethnic group - that is, children of naturalised citizens do not acquire citizenship at birth).
category: Group restriction: only if citizen parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is born abroad to a parent or grandparent who is a citizen by birth. (see A02a for definition - excludes those who are not member of listed ethnic group).
category: Group restriction: only if citizen parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

article: Const 10(a) and Schedule 3, UGA 12(a); Const 12(1), UGA 14(1)
specification: Person is born in Uganda and one parent or grandparent is or was a member of one of the indigenous groups residing within borders of Uganda as established in 1926 and set out in the 3rd Schedule.; Person is born in Uganda and neither parent nor any grandparent had either diplomatic or refugee status in Uganda, and the person has been continuously resident since 1962.
category: Group restriction: only if parent is member of a particular group, race or religion

specification: Person is a child not more than 5 years old found in Uganda of unknown parents.

Person has legally and voluntarily migrated to Uganda and has been living there for at least 10 years. Other conditions: adequate knowledge of prescribed vernacular language or English, good character, renunciation of another acquired citizenship.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has legally and voluntarily migrated to Uganda and has been living there for at least 10 years.
Renunciation of another citizenship required if a person has more than one foreign citizenship.
Adequate knowledge of prescribed vernacular language or English required.
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Person must be of good character.
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is a foreigner married to a citizen for at least 5 years.
Person is a child adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person whose status depends on marriage to a citizen shall not be impacted by death of spouse.
category: Spousal restriction: only applies to spouse

specification: Person is a former citizen by birth and renounced citizenship to acquire citizenship of another country. Other conditions: grounds for loss of citizenship are of no adverse effect to the public order and security of Uganda.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been resident for at least 20 years including 2 years prior to application. Other conditions: adequate knowledge of prescribed vernacular language or English, good character, renunciation of other citizenship.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: n.a. Note: Person who is a refugee is not entitled to citizenship by registration (easier than naturalisation) (see Const 12(1)).
Person is born in Ukraine to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is a newborn infant found in Ukraine of unknown parentage.

Person is born to foreigners who legally reside in Ukraine, and person does not receive the citizenship of his or her parents by birth.  Or person is born in Ukraine to stateless persons who reside legally in Ukraine (no need to prove that no other citizenship was acquired by birth). Or person is born to parents at least one of whom is a recognised refugee, and did not acquire any citizenship by birth, or acquired only the citizenship of the parent who is a refugee.

Person is a minor and descent from a citizen is established. Consent is required if child is over 14.;
Person is no longer a minor and descent from a citizen is established. Other condition: renunciation of citizenship of another country.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person is a minor born in Ukraine, and one of his or her legal guardians applies to register the child as a citizen. Or person was born before 24 August 1991 in what is now Ukraine, or on a number of other territories which were at the time of the person's birth included in the administrative units that are considered to be predecessors of the modern Ukrainian state. The requirement of renunciation of foreign citizenship applies for both adults and children falling under these regulations. Consent is required if child is over 14.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person has been resident in Ukraine for 5 years uninterrupted. Other conditions: permit to immigrate, renunciation of citizenship of another country, respect for the laws of Ukraine, language proficiency, legal means of subsistence, no convictions for grave crimes.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Ukraine for 5 years uninterrupted. Permit to immigrate required.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.

category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Respect for the laws of Ukraine required.
Person may not be convicted for grave crimes.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a minor who resides in Ukraine, and one of his or her legal guardians resides legally in Ukraine and applies for the child to acquire citizenship. A06 conditions do not apply, except renunciation of citizenship of another country. Consent is required if child is over 14.
category: Restricted to period of residence in country

specification: Person has been married to a citizen for 2 years. Other conditions: see A06 (except residency requirement).
Person is a minor and one of his or her parents is a citizen and applies for the child to acquire citizenship. Consent is required if child is over 14.
category: Age restriction: only if child is a minor

specification: Person is a minor and at least one of the adopters is a citizen (citizenship is acquired from the moment of adoption). Or person is an adult and stateless, and at least one of the adopters is a citizen (citizenship is acquired when the court's decision about adoption comes into force). Consent is required if child is over 14.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person was married to a citizen for at least 2 years, and the marriage ended due to death of the spouse. Other conditions: see A06 (except residency requirement).
category: Generational restriction: only applies to child or grandchild

specification: Person is a former citizen, returns to settle in Ukraine, renounces his or her other citizenship(s), and has not committed any grave crimes. If the person did not acquire a foreign citizenship after having lost Ukrainian citizenship, citizenship is reacquired upon application regardless of whether the person resides in Ukraine, under the condition of not having committed any grave crimes. Citizenship cannot be reacquired if it was lost due to acquisition by fraud.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: One of the person's parents, grandparents, (half-)siblings, children or grandchildren were born or permanently resided before 24 August 1991 on the territory of what became Ukraine or on a number of other specified, historically significant territories. Such a person can be registered as a citizen upon request, if he or she is stateless or renounces any other foreign citizenship. The person's children will also be eligible for Ukrainian citizenship via this provision. If person holds a residence permit ex Art. 4(20) Law on the Legal Status of Foreigners and Stateless Persons (i.e. military personnel), he/she is exempted from renunciation requirement.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is a recognised refugee in Ukraine, has lived there for 3 years from the moment of receiving refugee status. Other conditions: see A06 (except residency requirement, means of subsistence and the requirement to have been permitted to immigrate to Ukraine). Instead of renouncing their foreign citizenship by contacting their governments, refugees are required to declare to the Ukrainian authorities that they renounce their other citizenship.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has entered Ukraine as a stateless person, has lived there for 3 years, and declares not to have a foreign citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement and renunciation of citizenship of another country).

Person has special merits to Ukraine or his/her naturalisation is in the state interests of the country. Other conditions: respect for the laws of Ukraine and renunciation of foreign citizenship.;
Person is in the Ukrainian Armed Forces and was granted a state award. Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence requirement, immigration permit not required, no language requirement, no means of subsistence required, and proof of absence of another citizenship not required).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification:
Person is in the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement reduced to 3 years and immigration permit not required).;
Person holds a residence permit ex Art. 4(20) Law on the Legal Status of Foreigners and Stateless Persons (i.e. military personnel). Other conditions: see A06 (except no residence requirement, immigration permit not required, no language requirement, no means of subsistence required, and proof of absence of another citizenship not required).
Person is born abroad, has a parent or grandparent who is a citizen, and establishes residence in Uruguay.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: n.a. (Ex Const 75a-b, person can acquire 'legal citizenship' if he/she has had 3 years of habitual residence in Uruguay. Other conditions: good behaviour, have family in Uruguay (if not, 5 years' residence is required), and work participation or capital/property in Uruguay. Legal citizenship status cannot be equated with Urguayan citizenship.)
n.a. (Person is granted 'legal citizenship' for relevant merits or notable services rendered to Uruguay. Legal citizenship status cannot be equated with Uruguayan citizenship.)

category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is found in the United States of unknown parentage and is younger than 5 years.

Person is born out of wedlock to a father with whom a blood relationship is established by clear and convincing evidence, who was a citizen at the time of the person's birth, and who has agreed in writing (unless deceased) to financially support the person until the age of 18. Other conditions while person is under the age of 18: person is legitimated, the father acknowledges paternity, or paternity is established by judicial ruling. Person must have previously been physically and continuously present in the United States or one of its outlying possessions for 5 years. OR person is born out of wedlock to a mother who was a citizen at the time of the person's birth and had previously been physically and continuously present in the United States or one of its outlying possessions for 1 year. Note: The US Supreme Court ruled on 12 June 2017 in Sessions v. Morales-Santana that the differential treatment of children born out of wedlock from a citizen father or a citizen mother is unconstitutional and that a five year physical presence requirement applies to both a citizen father and a citizen mother until statutory changes have been made.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has been resident in the United States for a continuous period of 5 years. Other conditions: knowledge of fundamentals of the English language and the history and form of government of the United States, good morals, attachment to principles of the Constitution, well disposed to the good order and happiness of the United States, and oath of loyalty.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in the United States for a continuous period of 5 years.
Knowledge of fundamentals of the English language required (test).
category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Knowledge of  the history and form of government of the United States required.
Good morals required (as defined by INA 101(f) and 8 CFR 316.10)
category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person has been the spouse of a citizen and resident in the United States for 3 years with common household. (Residence requirement can be waived under certain circumstances.) Other conditions: see A06.
Person is the minor child of a citizen who has parental authority and the child legally and permanently resides in the United States.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is over the age of 50 or 55 and has been living in the United States for a total period of at least 20 or 15 years, respectively, subsequent to a lawful admission for permanent residence. Other conditions: see A06 (except language requirement). Persons over 65 years of age and living in the United States for periods totalling at least 20 years are additionally given 'special consideration' for purposes of knowledge of history and principles of governance.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has served at any time in the armed forces for a total period of at least 1 year, served in the armed forces during military hostilities, or made an extraordinary contribution to the national security of the United States or to the conduct of the United States intelligence activities. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
Person is born in Uzbekistan to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen. If one parent is a foreigner and neither of the parents have permanent residence in the country, the written agreement of the parents is required.
Person is a child who is present in Uzbekistan and of unknown parentage.

Person is born in Uzbekistan to stateless parents who are permanently residing in the country.; Person is born in Uzbekistan or proofs that at least one parent, grandfather or grandmother was born in Uzbekistan, and the person does not hold citizenship of another state. Other conditions: see A06 (except residence requirement).
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person is born to a stateless mother, is under the age of 14 years, and paternity is established of a father who is a citizen. Provision applies irrespective of the place of birth.
category: Other restrictions (age, marriage or other conditions apply)

specification: Person has been permanently resident for 5 years in the country. Other conditions: renunciation of other citizenship, lawful sources of subsistence, recognition and observance of the Constitution, not a member of parties and other organisations whose activity is incompatible with the constitutional principles of the country, not been convicted and not serving a prison sentence.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been permanently resident for 5 years in the country.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required.
Not a member of parties and other organisations whose activity is incompatible with the constitutional principles of the country, not been convicted and not serving a prison sentence.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is adopted by a citizen or a couple one of whom is a citizen and the other is stateless. If one adoptive parent is a foreigner, the agreement of both parents is required. Child's consent is required if between 14 and 18 years. Renunciation of other citizenship is required (unless person is stateless).
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a child under the age of 14 years whose parents (or sole parent) are acquiring citizenship. If one parent remains a foreigner the child acquires citizenship upon petition of the parent who is acquiring citizenship. Child's consent is required if between 14 and 18 years.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person rendered outstanding services to the Republic of Uzbekistan or has high achievements in science, technology or culture or has a profession or qualification of interest to the country. Other conditions: see A06 (but requirements relating to residence, renunciation of other citizenship and lawful means of subsistence may be waived).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born abroad to a citizen otherwise than by descent.
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person is born in St Vincent. Unless born to a foreign diplomat and neither parent is a citizen, or one of the parents is an enemy alien and child is born in a place then under occupation by the enemy. Citizenship Act declares that the mother, specifically, must be a citizen.

Constitution states that the 'father' of a child born out of wedlock or who is not yet legitimated can acknowledge and show that he is the father. Paternity can be established via notarized declaration, an order from another country that establishes paternity, a declaration of paternity from the SVG High Court. Citizenship Act states that male citizen 'acknowledges and can show' that he is the father of the child.
category: Generally applicable provision (no further conditions besides recognition/legitimation/establishment of parentage)

specification: Person has been resident in St Vincent for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in St Vincent, or in government service for 6 out of 9 years predating the 12-month period. Other conditions: renunciation of another citizenship (at the discretion of the Minister), good character, full capacity, adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen, intent to reside in St Vincent or to continue government service, and oath of allegiance. Minister is explicitly allowed to waive certain requirements.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in St Vincent for 12 months immediately prior to the application, and was either resident in St Vincent, or in government service for 6 out of 9 years predating the 12-month period.
Renunciation of another citizenship required (at the discretion of the Minister).
Adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Adequate knowledge of English and of the duties of a citizen

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen. Registration can be denied in the interests of defence, public safety or public order, if the person was sentenced for a criminal offence to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months during the 7-year period preceding the application, is not of good character, is a danger to public security, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means for self-support. Other condition: oath of loyalty (only if person has reached the age of 21, and only for British protected persons and persons who are not Commonwealth citizens or citizens of Ireland).
Person is under 21 and parent is a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is under 21.;Person is adopted by a citizen.
category: Generally applicable provision (adopted child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is married to someone who is a citizen or who would have become a citizen if it were not for partner's death. Minister may refuse application based upon national security and public safety or order interests.
category: Generally applicable provision (applies to descendant or spouse)

specification: Man or woman married to a citizen or to someone eligible to register for citizenship. Minister may refuse application based upon national security and public safety or order interests.
Person is a former citizen who renounced citizenship in order to acquire or retain citizenship of another country. Other condition: oath of loyalty.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a Commonwealth citizen and has been ordinarily resident in St Vincent for 7 years immediately prior to the application. Registration can be denied in the interests of defence, public safety or public order, if the person was sentenced for a criminal offence to death or to a prison sentence of at least 12 months during the 7-year period preceding the application, is not of good character, is a danger to public security, has been declared bankrupt, or has insufficient means for self-support.

category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Over past five years prior to application for citizenship, the person made 'substantial contributions' to the cultural development/growth of SVG. Other conditions: of good character, adequate knowledge of English language and citizenship responsibilities.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been in diplomatic or other public service of St Vincent.
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Person has made an important contribution to the cultural or economic growth of St Vincent for at least 5 years. Other conditions: good behaviour, knowledge of English and of duties of a citizen.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)
Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: Person has been continuously resident in Venezuela for at least 10 years immediately prior to the application. 'Favourable' conditions for obtaining naturalisation are: ownership of real estate in Venezuela or ownership of or partnership in a Venezuelan enterprise, parental authority over Venezuelan children, marriage to a Venezuelan citizen, and holding a degree from a Venezuelan university.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been continuously resident in Venezuela for at least 10 years immediately prior to the application.
Person has been the spouse of a citizen for at least 5 years.

Person is a minor whose parent acquires citizenship and has parental authority over the child. Child must declare his or her wish to be a citizen before the age of 21, and must have lived uninterruptedly in Venezuela for 5 years before making the declaration.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person was a citizen by birth, has previously renounced citizenship, and has been resident in Venezuela for 2 years. Ordinary naturalisation process applies if person was a citizen by naturalisation.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a citizen of Spain, Portugal, Italy, or a Latin American- or Caribbean country, and has been resident in Venezuela for a continuous period of at least 5 years immediately prior to the application. Other conditions: see A06.

article: Organic Law on Refugees and Asylum Seekers, art 26
specification: The naturalisation of any refugee residing in Venezuela will be facilitated.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

article: Organic Law on Refugees and Asylum Seekers, art 5 jo. art 26
specification: Persons who do not have citizenship of any country, or cannot return to the country where s/he previously had habitual residence, are considered refugees under Venezuelan law and as such covered by mode A22.

Person has rendered services contributing to the public good, the economic and social development of Venezuela or humanity in general, or has special achievements on the national or international level as a scientist, artist or writer. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is resident in Venezuela within the context of governmental developmental activities. Other conditions: see A06.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person is born in Vietnam to two citizens, to a citizen and a parent who is stateless, or to a mother who is a citizen and the father is unknown. If one parent is a citizen and the other parent is a citizen of another country, the child acquires Vietnamese citizenship if the parents agree in writing, but also if they do not reach agreement.

Person is born abroad to two citizens, to a citizen and the other parent is stateless, or to a mother who is a citizen and the father is unknown. If one parent is a citizen and the other parent is a citizen of another country, the child acquires Vietnamese citizenship if the parents agree in writing, but also if they do not reach agreement.
Person is a newborn or child found in Vietnam of unknown parentage.

Person is born in Vietnam to parents who are both stateless and have permanent residence in the country, or the child is born in Vietnam to a mother who is stateless and has permanent residence in the country and the father is unknown.
category: Parental status restriction: only if one or both parents are stateless (additional residence requirement may apply)

specification: Person has been resident in Vietnam for 5 years. Other conditions: full capacity, sufficient knowledge of the Vietnamese language to allow for integration into society, obey the Constitution and laws and respect the traditions, customs and practices of Vietnam, be capable of making a livelihood in the country, and renunciation of citizenship of another country, and having a Vietnamese name. Person's naturalisation is not permitted if this is detrimental to Vietnam's national interests.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Vietnam for 5 years.
Renunciation of citizenship of another country required (permission for retention of citizenship can be granted).
Sufficient knowledge of the Vietnamese language to allow for integration into society
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Obey the Constitution and laws and respect the traditions, customs and practices of Vietnam, having a Vietnamese name.
Be capable of making a livelihood in the country
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (but requirements relating to language, residence and ability to make a livelihood do not have to be fully met).
Person is the natural child of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (but requirements relating to language, residence and ability to make a livelihood do not have to be fully met).
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen. Consent is required if child is between the age of 15-18.; Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen while the other adopting parent is a citizen of another country. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements relating to full capacity, respect for the law, Vietnamese language, residence and livelihood). Consent is required if child is between the age of 15-18
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is the natural parent of a citizen. Other conditions: see A06 (but requirements relating to language, residence and ability to make a livelihood do not have to be fully met).
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a parent of a citizen

specification: Person is a minor living with his/her parents, and both parents acquire citizenship by naturalisation or restoration. In case only one parent acquires citizenship, the child will acquire citizenship if the parents agree in writing. In case no agreement is reached, the child will acquire citizenship if s/he lives with parent who acquires citizenship. Consent is required if the child is between the age of 15-18.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship other than by mode L09 and falls in any of the following categories: has applied for permission to return to Vietnam, his/her spouse, natural parent or natural offspring is a citizen, has made a meritorious contribution to Vietnam's national construction and defense, has helped the Vietnamese State, has invested in Vietnam, or has renounced citizenship to acquire citizenship of another country but this acquisition has not materialised. Other conditions: renunciation of citizenship of another country (with exceptions for some of the abovementioned categories). Reacquisition will be withheld if this would be detrimental to Vietnam's national interests. In case citizenship was previously withdrawn, the person can only apply for reacquisition after 5 years from the moment citizenship was lost.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is stateless, lacks personal identification papers, has been stably residing in Vietnam for 20 years, and respects the Constitution and laws of Vietnam.

Person has made meritorious contributions to Vietnam's national construction and defense. Other conditions: see A06 (but requirements relating to language, residence and ability to make a livelihood do not have to be fully met).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been helpful to the Vietnamese State. Other conditions: see A06 (but requirements relating to language, residence and ability to make a livelihood do not have to be fully met).
category: Generally applicable provision (applicable to military and public service)

specification: Anyone born after Independence Day (30 July 1980) whether in Vanuatu or abroad, shall become a citizen of Vanuatu if at least one parent is a citizen of Vanuatu.
Anyone born after Independence Day (30 July 1980) whether in Vanuatu or abroad, shall become a citizen of Vanuatu if at least one parent is a citizen of Vanuatu.

Person has resided in Vanuatu for continuous period of 10 years, no outstanding fees owing to the government, good character, sufficient understanding of local language/s, respect for the culture and the ways of life of Vanuatu, unlikely to become a charge on public funds, reasonable knowledge and understanding of the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizens, renounced or agreed to renounce foreign citizenship (except a recognised dual citizenship), oath of allegiance, pass Citizenship Test in Bislama, not involved in the financing of a terrorist act or funding of political instability in Vanuatu, not been removed from Vanuatu under the Immigration Act, not been convicted of any offence carrying a maximum penalty of imprisonment for 12 months or more in Vanuatu or other jurisdiction.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Residence in Vanuatu for continuous period of 10 years.
Person has renounced or agreed to renounce foreign citizenship (except if permission for having dual citizenship is obtained).

category: Language requirement with certification or test

specification: Respect for the culture and the ways of life of Vanuatu, reasonable knowledge and understanding of the rights, privileges, responsibilities and duties of citizens.

Good character required. Person may not be involved in the financing of a terrorist act or funding of political instability in Vanuatu, not have been removed from Vanuatu under the Immigration Act, not have been convicted of any offence carrying a maximum penalty of imprisonment for 12 months or more in Vanuatu or other jurisdiction.
category: Exclusion for certain specified crimes, offences or character queries and general moral character condition applies

specification: Person is unlikely to become a charge on public funds.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person married to a citizen may apply for citizenship if he or she has lived with his or her spouse in Vanuatu for at least 2 years.  Must also pass a citizenship test in Bislama.
A child adopted becomes a citizen on the day of adoption if  one or both adopting parents is a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Applicant can request his or her spouse become a citizen by naturalization at the same time as the applicant. Spouse is required to make a statement that he or she wishes to become a citizen.
Applicant can request that his or her child become a citizen at same time as the applicant.
category: Generally applicable provision (child can be minor or adult)

specification: A person who has renounced or lost Vanuatu citizenship may apply to regain citizenship.

Person <d2>has or will contribute to the advancement and betterment of the development process in Vanuatu<d3>. Regulations over time created various categories for what is effectively citizenship by investment.  Honorary citizenship is conferred by the President on the advice of the Prime Minister and after an assessment by the Citizenship Commission.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has been appointed under the Foreign Service Act 2013 as a representative of the Government overseas.
category: Other restriction: only for public service

specification: Person participates in the Capital Investment Immigration Plan. Person must meet other conditions (respect for Vanuatu culture, good character) but is not required to meet language requirements or pass citizenship test.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: A person born in Samoa to at least one parent who is a citizen at the time of birth.
Person born outside Samoa to at least one parent who is a Samoan citizen (otherwise than by descent) or has resided in Samoa for at least 3 years (registration required).
category: Generational transmission restriction: conditional on birthplace/place of residence /mode under which parent acquired citizenship

specification: A person born in Samoa but who is not eligible for citizenship, stateless and unable to obtain citizenship in another state may be granted citizenship by birth by Minister
Criteria: valid permanent resident permit for 5 years, good health and character, understands the responsibilities and privileges of being a citizen of Samoa, intends to reside in Samoa.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Valid permanent resident permit for 5 years
Person understands the responsibilities and privileges of being a citizen of Samoa.

category: General requirement without specification (good moral character)
Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Minister may register as a citizen a person who is married to a Samoan citizen. Criteria: married and residing with the citizen spouse for five years, intends to continue to reside in Samoa, of good health and character, understands the responsibilities and privileges of being a citizen of Samoa.
Person born outside Samoa who has at least one grandparent who is a citizen by birth (citizenship by descent).
category: Generational restriction: only if person is a grandchild of a citizen

article: Citizenship Investment Act 2015 ss 6, 10, Citizenship Act 2004 s 8(3)
specification: Person intends to invest in qualifying investment, demonstrates ability and willingness to invest a minimum determined amount ($4m) within 3 years, has a minimum net worth of a determined amount ($2.5m).  Person also must not be subject to investigation or convicted of an offence punishable by 2 or more years imprisonment, be considered a potential national security risk, involved in any activity that causes or is likely to cause disrepute to Samoa, or have been denied entry to Samoa or other country with which Samoa has vis-free travel.  Investor (and family members) granted permanent residence permit can apply for citizenship after three years residence. Must also comply with Citizenship Act 2014 s 8 requirements of good health and character and understanding of the responsibilities and privileges of being a citizen of Samoa.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Kosovo to a citizen.
Person is born to parents of another country who have a permanent residence permit in Kosovo and they give their consent to acquisition of citizenship.
Person is found in Kosovo of unknown parentage.
Person is born in Kosovo to stateless parents or the child would otherwise be stateless.

Person has been resident in Kosovo for 5 consecutive years after receiving permanent residence permit. Other conditions: respect for constitutional and legal order of Kosovo and integration into society, sufficient means of living without resorting to social assistance schemes, fulfilment of all the financial obligations owed to the state, and an elementary knowledge of one of the official languages of Kosovo (Albanian or Serbian) and of its culture and social order.
category: Generally applicable provision (see further conditions under A06a-A06f)

specification: Person has been resident in Kosovo for 5 consecutive years after receiving permanent residence permit.
Elementary knowledge of one of the official languages of Kosovo (Albanian or Serbian) required.
category: Language requirement without certification or test

specification: Respect for constitutional and legal order of Kosovo, integration into society and elementary knowledge of culture and social order required.
Sufficient means of living without resorting to social assistance schemes, fulfilment of all the financial obligations owed to the state required.
category: Requirement (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen, has been married for at least 3 years, and has been resident (on the basis of any type of residence) in Kosovo for 1 year. The spouse of a citizen shall not acquire citizenship if the marriage has been established against the Law on Family.
Person is a minor who is adopted by a citizen.
category: Age restriction: only if adopted child is a minor

specification: Person is a descendant within one generation of a person in Kosovo ('member of Kosovo diaspora') and maintains family links in Kosovo. No residency requirement.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is the spouse of a citizen, has been married for at least 3 years, and has been resident (on the basis of any type of residence) in Kosovo for 2 years. The spouse of a naturalised citizen shall not acquire citizenship if the marriage has been established against the Law on Family.
Person is a minor who is included in the parent's application for naturalisation. If a person is between 14 and 18 years of age, his/her consent is required.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person is a former citizen who was previously released from citizenship. Other conditions: see A06 (except age (i.e. person does not need to be an adult), residence and elementary knowledge of one of the official languages, culture and social order of Kosovo).
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person is a refugee and has been resident in Kosovo for 5 years from the day of the recognition of the refugee status. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements regarding sufficient means of living without resorting to social assistance schemes and the fulfilment of all the financial obligations owed to the state).
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is stateless and has been resident in Kosovo for 5 years from the day of the recognition of the refugee status. Other conditions: see A06 (except requirements regarding sufficient means of living without resorting to social assistance schemes and the fulfilment of all the financial obligations owed to the state).
Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in special (economic, social, sports, cultural, scientific or political) interest of Kosovo.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is someone whose acquisition of citizenship would be in the special economic interest of Kosovo.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in Yemen to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
Person is born in Yemen to a father who was also born in the country.
category: Gender restriction: only if the father is also born in country

specification: Person is born in Yemen to unknown parents.

Person is born in Yemen to a citizen mother and a stateless father or whose citizenship is unknown, has resided in Yemen for at least 10 consecutive years before reaching the age of majority and submits a request at the latest one year before reaching the age of majority.;Person is born in Yemen to foreign parents and has resided there until he/she reached the age of majority, speaks Arabic, of sound health, good repute, not convicted for a crime related to honour, and submits a request at the latest one year before reaching the age of majority.
category: Generally applicable provision (before age of majority)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen and has been married for 4 years. Other naturalisation requirements do not apply.
category: Gender restriction: only for female spouse of male citizen (no residence requirement)

specification: Person is the wife of a male citizen who has acquired citizenship by naturalisation and couple has 4 years of married life from the date of the application.
category: Gender restriction: only applies to female spouses (without residence requirement)

specification: Person is the minor child of a male applicant for citizenship. Child will obtain citizenship automatically as long as the child is living with the father.
category: Age restriction: only if child is minor

specification: Person lost citizenship through acquiring another or through marriage and is recommended to obtain citizenship through the Minister.
category: Mode restriction: only if citizenship was lost on particular grounds

specification: Person has been resident in the country for at least 10 years. Other conditions: proficient in Arabic, has good character, an income, and is either Arab or Muslim.;Person is of Yemenite origin (paternal line) and has resided in the country for at least five years. Other conditions: repudiate foreign citizenship.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person has special skills. No other conditions prescribed.
category: Provision exists (conditions not further specified in database)

specification: Person is born in South Africa to a citizen.
Person is born abroad to a citizen.
